title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
__How the Canada Pension PlanDisability benefit helps__:

- It can provide you with a small monthly income if you cannot work due to your disability.
- It will automatically convert to a CPP retirement pension when you turn 65.
- You can get an additional benefit for each dependent child under the age of 18.
- If you have a child aged 18 to 25 enrolled in full-time study, they can continue to get disability payments directly.
- While receiving the benefits, you do not make contributions to the Canada Pension Plan.
- CPP-Disability does not look at your total family income for your eligibility amount. It looks at your income and contributions.
content1.fr-CA:
__Comment la prestation dinvalidit du Rgime de pensions du Canada peut-elle aider?__:

- Elle peut vous fournir un petit revenu mensuel si vous ne pouvez pas travailler en raison de votre handicap.
- Elle sera automatiquement convertie en une pension de retraite du RPC lorsque vous aurez 65ans.
- Vous pouvez obtenir une prestation supplmentaire pour chaque enfant  charge g de moins de 18ans.
- Si vous avez un enfant g de 18  25ans inscrit  un programme dtudes  temps plein, il peut continuer  bnficier directement des prestations dinvalidit.
- Alors que vous recevez les prestations, vous ne versez pas de cotisations au Rgime de pensions du Canada.
- Le PPIRPC ne tient pas compte du revenu familial total pour dterminer le montant dadmissibilit. Elle tient compte de vos revenus et de vos cotisations.

content2.en-CA:
### When should I apply?

You should apply as soon as you develop a mental or physical condition that:

- prevents you from working at any job __and__
- is long-term or is likely to result in death.

### How much would I get?

The amount of CPP-Disability benefit is based on a flat-rate amount plus additional portions based on your Canada Pension Plan contributions. For example, in 2023, the monthly flat rate amount is $558.74. CPP-Disability is linked to inflation, so the rates change slightly each year. In 2023, the maximum monthly benefit amount is $1,538.67. The average monthly benefit in 2022 was $1,078.07.

### How does the childrens benefit work?

For people who are receiving CPP-D benefits, the plan also provides a benefit for each dependent child under the age of 18. In 2022, the amount was $264.53 for each child. This benefit is paid to the custodial parent. In cases of shared custody, Service Canada will consider paying the child benefit to the person collecting CPP-Disability benefits.

If a child of a CPP-Disability recipient is between the ages of 18 and 25 and enrolled in full time school at an accredited institution, this child portion can continue. The payments go to the adult child directly.

### Top-up from the B.C. government

You may find that your monthly CPP-Disability rate is less than the provincial disability assistance rate. If so, you may be eligible for a top-up from the provincial government. For example, in B.C., the maximum amount for a single person with the Persons with Disabilities designation is $1,358.50 a month. Contact your local [Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction office](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/access-services) for more information about this.

### I am receiving other government benefits. If I get the CPP-Disability benefit, will it affect my eligibility or amounts I can get from the other benefits?

Receiving CPP-Disability does not affect any federal benefits.

It may affect your provincial or territorial benefits. For example, in British Columbia, if you earn more than what you receive in Persons with Disabilities (PWD) benefits, you will be removed from PWD benefits.

Receiving CPP-Disability will not reduce the amount of CPP retirement pension you receive at age 65.
content2.fr-CA:
### Quand dois-je prsenter ma demande?

Vous devez prsenter votre demande ds que vous dveloppez une condition mentale ou physique qui:

vous empche dexercer nimporte quel emploi __et__
est de longue dure ou est susceptible dentraner la mort.

### Combien recevrais-je?

Le montant du PPIRPC est bas sur un montant fixe auquel sajoutent des portions supplmentaires en fonction de vos cotisations au Rgime de pensions du Canada. Par exemple, en 2023, le montant fixe mensuel est de 558,74$. Le PPIRPC est li  linflation, de sorte que les taux fluctuent lgrement chaque anne. Le montant maximal de la prestation mensuelle est de 1 538,67$ en 2023. La prestation mensuelle moyenne en 2022 tait de 1 078,07$.

### Comment fonctionne la prestation pour enfant?

Pour les personnes qui reoivent des prestations du PPIRPC, le rgime prvoit galement une prestation pour chaque enfant  charge g de moins de 18ans. Le montant tait de 264,53$ par enfant en 2022. Cette prestation est verse au parent qui a la garde des enfants. En cas de garde partage, Service Canada envisagera de verser les prestations pour enfant  la personne qui peroit les prestations du PPIRPC.

Si lenfant dun bnficiaire du PPIRPC est g de 18  25ans et quil est inscrit  temps plein dans un tablissement denseignement agr, cette portion pour enfant peut tre maintenue. Les paiements sont verss directement  lenfant adulte.

### Montant complmentaire du gouvernement de la Colombie-Britannique

Il se peut que votre taux mensuel du PPIRPC soit infrieur au taux provincial daide aux personnes handicapes. Si cest le cas, vous avez peut-tre droit  un montant complmentaire du gouvernement provincial. Par exemple, en Colombie-Britannique, le montant maximal pour une personne seule ayant la dsignation de personne handicape est de 1358,50$ par mois. Contactez votre [bureau local du ministre du Dveloppement social et de la Rduction de la pauvret] (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/access-services) pour en savoir plus  ce sujet.

### Je reois dautres prestations gouvernementales. Si je reois des prestations du PPIRPC, cela affectera-t-il mon admissibilit ou les montants que je peux obtenir des autres prestations?

Le fait de recevoir une prestation du PPIRPC na aucune rpercussion sur les prestations fdrales.

Cela peut influencer vos prestations provinciales ou territoriales. Par exemple, en Colombie-Britannique, si vous gagnez plus que ce que vous recevez en prestations pour personnes handicapes, vous serez retir des prestations pour personnes handicapes.

Le fait de recevoir une prestation du PPIRPC ne rduira pas le montant de la pension de retraite du RPC que vous recevrez  lge de 65ans.

content4.en-CA:
### Other ways to plan for your future

Most likely, CPP-Disability alone will not meet your every need. Most people with disabilities will need supports from other federal and provincial programs. To learn about other benefits, you may be able to get, use the [Benefits wayfinder](https://benefitswayfinder.org/).

There are other supports for planning for the future like wills, trusts, estate planning, and supported decision-making. To learn more, visit [Plan Institutes Workshops and Webinars](https://planinstitute.ca/learning-centre/events/).
content4.fr-CA:
### Autres moyens de planifier votre avenir

Il est fort probable que le PPIRPC ne suffise pas  elle seule  rpondre  tous vos besoins. La plupart des personnes handicapes auront besoin de laide dautres programmes fdraux et provinciaux. Pour vous renseigner sur les autres prestations auxquelles vous pouvez avoir droit, utilisez l[Orienteur en mesure daide](https://benefitswayfinder.org/fr).

Il existe dautres aides permettant de planifier lavenir, comme les testaments, les fiducies, la planification successorale et la prise de dcision assiste. Pour en savoir plus, visitez le site [Ateliers et webinaires du Plan Institute](https://planinstitute.ca/learning-centre/events/).

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
The Disability Tax Credit (DTC) is a non-refundabletaxcredit. It helps people with a disability, or those who support them, to reduce the amount of income tax they have to pay.

To claim the disability amount, you must be approved for the Disability Tax Creditcertificate (Form T2201).

An individual may claim the disability amount once they are eligible for the DTC. This amount includes a supplement for persons under 18 years of age at the end of the year. For example, for the tax year 2022, the maximum disability amount was $8,870. The maximum supplement for those under 18 was $5,174.

However, this does not mean that your taxes would be reduced by these amounts. Because of the way taxes are calculated, the maximum amount that the credit can reduce taxes is in the range of $1,200 for a person over 18.  The amounts vary province to province.
content1.fr-CA:
Le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes (CIPH) est un crdit dimpt non remboursable. Il aide les personnes handicapes, ou celles qui les soutiennent,  rduire le montant de limpt sur le revenu quelles doivent payer.

Pour demander le montant pour invalidit, vous devez tre approuv par le Certificat pour le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes (formulaireT2201).

Une personne peut demander le montant pour invalidit ds quelle a droit au CIPH. Ce montant comprend un supplment pour les personnes ges de moins de 18ans  la fin de lanne. Par exemple, pour lanne fiscale2022, le montant maximal dinvalidit tait de 8870$. Le supplment maximal pour les moins de 18ans tait de 5174$.

Toutefois, cela ne signifie pas que vos impts seront rduits de ces montants. En raison de la faon dont les impts sont calculs, le montant maximum que le crdit peut rduire est de lordre de 1200$ pour une personne de plus de 18ans. Les montants varient dune province  lautre.

content2.en-CA:
### I don't owe any income tax, why should I apply for the Disability Tax Credit Certificate?

1. The Disability Tax Credit can open the door to other programs for you. You must get the credit to be able to open a [Registered Disability Savings Plan](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/registered-disability-savings-plan). You may be able to get the [Canada Workers Benefit Disability Supplemen](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/child-family-benefits/canada-workers-benefit.html)t and the [Child Disability Benefit](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/child-family-benefits/child-disability-benefit.html).
2. Certain medical expenses can only be claimed on your tax return if you have the Disability Tax Credit. These include some prescription therapies and a personalized therapy plan. You may also be able to claim a [Disability Supports Deduction](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/forms-publications/forms/t929.html) for some medical expenses.
3. In the year that you buy a home, you qualify for the [Home Buyers' Amount](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/topics/about-your-tax-return/tax-return/completing-a-tax-return/deductions-credits-expenses/line-31270-home-buyers-amount.html) on your taxes. Having the Disability Tax Credit means you do not have to be a first-time homebuyer. It also allows you to claim an additional $10,000.
4. You may be eligible for the non-refundable [Home Accessibility Tax Credit](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/programs/about-canada-revenue-agency-cra/federal-government-budgets/budget-2015-strong-leadership/home-accessibility-tax-credit-hatc.html) for qualifying expenses incurred for work performed or goods acquired in respect of a qualifying renovation of an eligible dwelling of a qualifying individual.
5. The Canada Caregiver Credit is for members of your family who support you with food, shelter, and clothing. It is a non-refundable tax credit. If you have a Disability Tax Credit, your family member does not need to get a signed letter from your doctor to receive the credit.
6. If your income is low and you do not owe any tax, you can still claim the Disability Tax Credit on your tax return and transfer it to an eligible caregiver. They can use it to reduce their own taxes.
7. You can see other benefits of getting the DTC at this [DABC DTC Help sheet](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/HS14.pdf).

### Who can I transfer the Disability Tax Credit to?

If you have little or no taxable income, you can transfer all or a portion of the Disability Tax Credit to a parent, spouse, sibling, or child who takes an active part in your care through financial support, help with foods, clothing, or shelter.   

### Can I claim the Disability Tax Credit for previous tax years?

If you were eligible for the Disability Tax Credit in previous years but did not claim it on your tax returns, you can request adjustments for up to 10 years. 

### I am not sure if I already have the Disability Tax Credit. How can I find out?

Log into your CRA [My Account](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/e-services-individuals/account-individuals.html?utm_campaign=not-applicable&utm_medium=vanity-url&utm_source=canada-ca_my-cra-account) to check. This is a secure portal that lets you view your personal income tax and benefit information and manage your tax affairs online. You may need to register if you have not done so already. 

Representatives (including friends and family members) can access My Account on your behalf using [Represent a Client](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/represent-a-client.html).

You can also call the CRA:  
From Canada or the United States: [1-800-959-8281](tel:18009598281)  
From anywhere else: [613-940-8495](tel:6139408495).  
If you use a teletypewriter, call 1800-665-0354 during regular hours of service.

### I am receiving government benefits. If I get the Disability Tax Credit, will it affect my eligibility or amounts I receive?

- It does not affect any federal benefits.
- It does not affect provincial benefits.
- It may open up other benefits.
content2.fr-CA:
### Je ne dois pas dimpt sur le revenu, pourquoi devrais-je demander le Certificat pour le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes?

1. Le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes peut vous donner accs  dautres programmes. Vous devez obtenir le crdit pour pouvoir ouvrir un [rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/fr/registered-disability-savings-plan). Vous pouvez peut-tre obtenir le [supplment pour personnes handicapes de lAllocation canadienne pour les travailleurs](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/prestations-enfants-familles/allocation-canadienne-travailleurs.html) et la [prestation pour enfants handicaps](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/prestations-enfants-familles/prestation-enfants-handicapes.html).
2. Certains frais mdicaux ne peuvent tre rclams dans votre dclaration de revenus que si vous bnficiez du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Il sagit notamment de certains soins sur ordonnance et dun plan de traitement personnalis. Vous pouvez galement demander une [dduction pour produits et services de soutien aux personnes handicapes](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/formulaires-publications/formulaires/t929.html) pour certains frais mdicaux.
3. Lanne o vous achetez une maison, vous avez droit au [montant pour lachat dune habitation](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/sujets/tout-votre-declaration-revenus/declaration-revenus/remplir-declaration-revenus/deductions-credits-depenses/ligne-31270-montant-achat-habitation.html) sur vos impts. Grce au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, vous ntes pas oblig dtre lacheteur dune premire maison. Il vous permet galement de demander un montant supplmentaire de 10000$.
4. Vous pouvez tre admissible au [crdit dimpt pour laccessibilit domiciliaire](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/programmes/a-propos-agence-revenu-canada-arc/budgets-gouvernement-federal/budget-2015-leadership-fort/credit-impot-accessibilite-domiciliaire.html) non remboursable pour les dpenses admissibles encourues pour des travaux effectus ou des biens acquis dans le cadre dune rnovation admissible dun logement admissible pour un particulier admissible.
5. Le crdit canadien pour aidants naturels est destin aux membres de votre famille qui vous soutiennent en vous fournissant nourriture, logement et vtements. Il sagit dun crdit dimpt non remboursable. Si vous avez un crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, le membre de votre famille na pas besoin dobtenir une lettre signe de votre mdecin pour recevoir le crdit.
6. Si vos revenus sont faibles et que vous ne devez pas dimpt, vous pouvez quand mme demander le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes dans votre dclaration de revenus et le transfrer  un aidant admissible. Celui-ci pourra lutiliser pour rduire ses propres revenus.
7. Vous trouverez dautres avantages  obtenir le CIPH sur cette [fiche daide sur le CIPH de la DABC (anglais seulement)](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/HS14.pdf).

###  qui puis-je transfrer le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes?

Si vous avez peu ou pas de revenu imposable, vous pouvez transfrer la totalit ou une partie du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes  un parent, un conjoint, un frre ou une sur ou un enfant qui participe activement  vos soins en vous apportant un soutien financier ou une aide pour la nourriture, les vtements ou le logement.

### Puis-je demander le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes pour les annes fiscales prcdentes?

Si vous aviez droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes au cours des annes prcdentes, mais que vous ne lavez pas demand dans vos dclarations de revenus, vous pouvez demander des ajustements pour un maximum de dix ans.

### Je ne sais pas si je bnficie dj du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Comment puis-je le savoir?

Connectez-vous  [Mon dossier](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/services-electroniques/services-electroniques-particuliers/dossier-particuliers.html) de lARC pour vrifier. Il sagit dun portail scuris qui vous permet de consulter vos renseignements personnels concernant les dclarations de revenus et les mesures daide et de grer vos affaires fiscales en ligne. Vous devrez peut-tre vous inscrire si vous ne lavez pas encore fait.

Les reprsentants (y compris les amis et les membres de la famille) peuvent accder  Mon dossier en votre nom en utilisant [reprsenter un client](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/services-electroniques/representer-client.html).

Vous pouvez aussi appeler lARC:

Du Canada ou des tats-Unis: [1-800-959-8281](tel:18009598281)
De nimporte o ailleurs: [613-940-8495](tel:6139408495).
Si vous utilisez un tlimprimeur, composez le 1-800-665-0354 pendant les heures de service habituelles.

### Je reois des mesures daide gouvernementale. Si je bnficie du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, cela affecte-t-il mon admissibilit ou les montants que je reois?

- Cela naffecte pas les prestations fdrales.
- Cela naffecte pas les prestations provinciales.
- Cela peut donner accs  dautres avantages.

### Other ways to plan for your future

The Disability Tax Credit is only one valuable support. Most people with disabilities will need supports from other federal and provincial programs. To learn about other benefits, you may be able to get, use the [Benefits wayfinder](https://benefitswayfinder.org/).

There are other supports for planning for the future like wills, trusts, estate planning, and supported decision-making. To learn more, visit Plan Institutes Workshops and Webinars.

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
A Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP) is a long-term savings plan that helps Canadians with disabilities save for the future. With an RDSP, you may be able to get up to $90,000 in government grants and bonds to help with your long-term savings.

To get the grants and bonds, you must open your RDSP before or by December 31 in the year in which you turn 49. You are not eligible for grants and bonds after age 49. You can open an RDSP up until the year you turn 59.

You and your loved ones can deposit up to $200,000 in the account without an impact on your eligibility for any federal, and most provincial, benefits.

If you have a low income and cannot save, the government will still save for you! Low income for 2023 means people living on less than $34,863 a year. The federal government will contribute up to $1000 each year for 20 years through a program called the Canada Disability Savings Bond.
content1.fr-CA:
Le rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit (REEI) est un rgime dpargne  long terme qui aide les Canadiens handicaps  pargner pour lavenir. Avec un REEI, vous pouvez obtenir jusqu 90000$ en subventions et bons du gouvernement pour vous aider  pargner  long terme.

Pour obtenir les subventions et les bons, vous devez ouvrir votre REEI avant ou au plus tard le 31dcembre de lanne de votre 49eanniversaire. Vous navez plus droit aux subventions et aux bons aprs 49ans. Vous pouvez ouvrir un REEI jusqu lanne de votre 59eanniversaire.

Vous et vos proches pouvez dposer jusqu 200000$ dans le compte sans que cela ait des rpercussions sur votre admissibilit aux prestations fdrales et  la plupart des prestations provinciales.

Si vous avez un faible revenu et ne pouvez pas pargner, le gouvernement pargnera quand mme pour vous! Pour 2023, on entend par bas revenus les personnes vivant avec moins de 34 863 dollars par anne. Le gouvernement fdral versera jusqu 1000$ par anne pendant 20ans dans le cadre dun programme appel Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit.

content2.en-CA:
### 7 great reasons why you should open an RDSP

1. You choose where to save and invest your money. Almost all financial institutions (such as banks or credit unions) offer RDSPs to Canadians.
2. The government contributes a lot! Depending on your family income, for every $1 saved, they will match up to $3, through a program called the Canada Savings Grant. For instance, if $1500 is deposited in an RDSP, the government could match with up to $3500 per year.
3. For people living on a low income (less than $31,120 in 2023), the government will invest $1000 each year for 20 years. This is through a program called the Canada Disability Savings Bond. People living on an income between $34,853 and $53,359 can still receive a partial bond.
4. In most cases, you can save money in an RDSP without affecting other government benefits you receive. To find out how your province treats the RDSP, go to [Provincial Resources - RDSP](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/).
5. Anyone can contribute to your RDSP -- family, friends, neighbours, charities, foundations, and organizations. This gives people who want to help a way to do so! All they need is your permission.
6. You can spend RDSP withdrawals as you wish. You can decide where and when to spend the money. Early RDSP withdrawals will result in penalties.
7. The RDSP can grow your savings a lot! If a person saves $1,500 a year for more than 30 years, they may find their RDSP worth nearly half a million dollars!  To see how your RDSP will grow based on what you put in, use the [RDSP Calculator](https://www.rdsp.com/calculator/).

Read about how other people use the RDSP at [RDSP Stories](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/is-the-rdsp-right-for-you/). You can enter their information into the RDSP Calculator to see how much each person could get.
content2.fr-CA:
### 7 bonnes raisons douvrir un REEI

1. Vous choisissez o pargner et investir votre argent. Presque toutes les institutions financires (comme les banques ou les coopratives de crdit) offrent des REEI aux Canadiens.
2. Le gouvernement contribue beaucoup! En fonction de votre revenu familial, pour chaque dollar pargn, ils verseront une somme quivalente, jusqu concurrence de 3$, dans le cadre dun programme appel la Subvention canadienne pour lpargne. Par exemple, si 1500$ sont dposs dans un REEI, le gouvernement pourrait verser une somme quivalente jusqu concurrence de 3500$ par anne.
3. Pour les personnes vivant avec un faible revenu (moins de 31120$ en 2023), le gouvernement investira 1000$ par anne pendant 20ans. Cela se fait grce  un programme appel le Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit. Les personnes vivant avec un revenu compris entre 34 863 et 53 359dollars peuvent encore recevoir un bon partiel.
4. Dans la plupart des cas, vous pouvez pargner de largent dans un REEI sans affecter les autres prestations gouvernementales que vous recevez. Pour savoir comment votre province traite le REEI, allez sur [Ressources provinciales  REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/).
5. Nimporte qui peut contribuer  votre REEI: famille, amis, voisins, organismes de bienfaisance, fondations et organisations. Cela donne aux personnes qui veulent aider un moyen de le faire! Tout ce dont ils ont besoin est votre permission.
6. Vous pouvez dpenser les retraits du REEI comme bon vous semble. Vous pouvez dcider o et quand dpenser largent. Les retraits anticips dun REEI entraneront des pnalits.
7. Le REEI peut faire fructifier votre pargne de faon considrable! Si une personne conomise 1500$ par anne pendant plus de 30ans, son REEI pourrait valoir prs dun demi-million de dollars! Pour voir comment votre REEI va crotre en fonction de ce que vous y mettez, utilisez la [calculatrice du REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/calculator/?lang=fr).

Pour savoir comment dautres personnes utilisent le REEI, consultez [Histoires de REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/is-the-rdsp-right-for-you/). Vous pouvez entrer leurs renseignements dans la calculatrice du REEI pour voir combien chaque personne pourrait recevoir.

content3.en-CA:
## I receive other government benefits. Will my RDSP affect my eligibility or amounts I receive?

- It does not affect any federal benefits.
- It affects some provincial benefits, but not others.

Federal benefits like the [Canada Pension Plan Disability Benefits (CPPD)](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/pension-plan-disability-benefits.html), [Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS)](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/old-age-security/guaranteed-income-supplement.html), and [Old Age Security (OAS)](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/old-age-security.html) are not affected by an RDSP. They do not look at the funds in an RDSP when assessing your income.

Almost all provinces and territories have exempted the money in an RDSP, even when it is withdrawn. This means that you can still get income assistance and disability benefits while saving for your future. If you live in Quebec, New Brunswick, or Prince Edward Island, look at [Provincial Resources-RDSP](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/) to see how your province treats money in an RDSP and money taken out. This will help you understand any impact.

For all benefits and programs, you should check directly with the organization who administers the benefit or program to see how the RDSP will affect the supports and services you get.

- Ceci na aucune incidence sur les prestations fdrales.
- Il affecte certaines prestations provinciales, mais pas dautres.

Les prestations fdrales telles que les [Prestations dinvalidit du Rgime de pensions du Canada (PPIRPC)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/regime-pensions-prestations-invalidite.html), le [Supplment de revenu garanti (SRG)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/services/prestations/pensionspubliques/rpc/securite-vieillesse/supplement-revenu-garanti.html) et la [pension de la Scurit de vieillesse (SV)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/services/prestations/pensionspubliques/rpc/securite-vieillesse.html) ne sont pas touches par un REEI. Elles ne tiennent pas compte des fonds dans un REEI lorsquelles valuent votre revenu.

Presque toutes les provinces et tous les territoires ont exempt largent dans un REEI, mme lorsquil est retir. Cela signifie que vous pouvez continuer  bnficier de lassistance au revenu et des prestations dinvalidit tout en pargnant pour votre avenir. Si vous vivez au Qubec, au Nouveau-Brunswick ou  lle-du-Prince-douard, consultez la page [Ressources provinciales-REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/) pour savoir comment votre province traite largent dans un REEI et largent retir. Cela vous aidera  comprendre tout impact.

Pour toutes les prestations et tous les programmes, vous devriez vrifier directement auprs de lorganisme qui administre la prestation ou le programme pour savoir comment le REEI affectera les soutiens et les services dont vous bnficiez.

content1.en-CA:
People with severe disabilities in British Columbia can get a Persons with Disabilities (PWD) designation. Having this status gives you access to money and programs under B.C.s Employment and Assistance Program for Persons with Disabilities Act. To get PWD status, you have to apply and meet the eligibility rules.

The process may take you several months from start to finish. This website helps you go through the application process step-by-step. You can take your time on each step. You can leave the site and come back later when you have more time, energy, and the documents you may need in a step.

En Colombie-Britannique, les personnes souffrant dun handicap grave peuvent obtenir la dsignation de personne handicape. Ce statut vous donne accs  de largent et  des programmes en vertu de la Loi sur le programme demploi et dassistance pour les personnes handicapes de la Colombie-Britannique. Pour obtenir le statut de personne handicape, vous devez en faire la demande et satisfaire aux rgles dadmissibilit.

La procdure peut prendre plusieurs mois du dbut  la fin. Ce site Web vous aide  suivre le processus de demande tape par tape. Vous pouvez prendre votre temps pour chaque tape. Vous pouvez quitter le site et y revenir plus tard, lorsque vous aurez plus de temps, dnergie et les documents dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour une tape.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved for Persons with Disabilities (PWD) status

- You will get up to $1,358 a month if you are a single person without dependents.
- You will get either a monthly bus pass or a $52 transportation supplement added to your monthly cheque.
- You will not be expected to look for work.
- If you work, you will be able to keep up to $15,000 a year in earned income. This is called your Annual Earnings Exemption.
- You will be able to get extra benefits for your health. Some examples include medical equipment and devices, medical supplies, medical transportation, and nutritional supplements, just to name a few.

If you are a non-status Indigenous person and do not have health coverage, you will be eligible for a range of health supplements.

For Indigenous people, the disability assistance rates on and off reserve are the same. There are some small differences in the supplements you can get.

- Vous recevrez soit une carte dabonnement dautobus mensuelle, soit un supplment de transport de 52dollars ajout  votre chque mensuel.
- On nattend pas de vous que vous cherchiez du travail
- Si vous travaillez, vous pourrez conserver jusqu 15000dollars par an de revenus gagns. Cest ce quon appelle votre exonration des gains annuelle.
- Vous pourrez bnficier davantages supplmentaires pour votre sant. Parmi les exemples, citons les quipements et dispositifs mdicaux, les fournitures mdicales, le transport mdical et les supplments nutritifs, pour nen citer que quelques-uns.

Si vous tes un autochtone non inscrit et que vous navez pas de protection en matire de sant, vous pourrez bnficier dune srie de supplments de sant.

Pour les autochtones, les taux daide aux personnes handicapes sont les mmes sur et hors rserve. Il existe quelques petites diffrences dans les complments que vous pouvez obtenir.

content3.en-CA:
## I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me? 

Indigenous Services Canada oversees the Persons with Disabilities (PWD) program for Indigenous people with disabilities in British Columbia.

On reserve, the British Columbia Aboriginal Network on Disability Society (BCANDS) administers the program on behalf of Indigenous Services Canada. Off reserve, the PWD program is administered by the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction. 

You can find more information at the [BCANDS Persons with Disabilities (PWD) Program Overview](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/bcands-persons-with-disabilities-pwd-program/).

## I already have the CPP-D or receive palliative care supports or support from Community Living BC. Is the journey different for me?

If you are in one of these groups below, there is a simplified application process.  You will not have to go to doctors to get a new diagnosis. You can use an easier PWD application process than the one we describe here. The groups are called prescribed classes and they apply to people receiving:  

- Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPP-D)
- Pharmacare Plan P (Palliative Care)
- Community Living BC (CLBC)
- The At Home Program (from the Ministry of Children and Family Development)  

Make sure to tell the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction if you are enrolled in one of these programs. [Contact the ministry](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/access-services) for help on how to begin the simplified application process.

You may also be able to use a simplified PWD application process if you are 17 to 19 years old, and you have a confirmed intellectual disability. This means you can submit an existing psychological assessment and diagnosis rather than completing a full PWD application.
content3.fr-CA:
## Je suis autochtone. Le processus est-il diffrent pour moi?

Services aux Autochtones Canada supervise le programme pour personnes handicapes destin aux autochtones handicaps de la Colombie-Britannique.

Dans les rserves, la British Columbia Aboriginal Network on Disability Society (BCANDS) administre le programme au nom de Services aux Autochtones Canada. Hors rserve, le programme pour personnes handicapes est administr par le ministre du Dveloppement social et de la Rduction de la pauvret.

Vous trouverez plus amples renseignements sur la page [Aperu du programme BCANDS pour les personnes handicapes](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/bcands-persons-with-disabilities-pwd-program/).

## Jai dj les PPIRPC ou je reois des soins palliatifs ou un soutien de Community Living BC. Le processus est-il diffrent pour moi?

Si vous faites partie de lun des groupes ci-dessous, il existe une procdure de demande simplifie. Vous naurez pas  vous rendre chez un mdecin pour obtenir un nouveau diagnostic. Vous pouvez utiliser un processus de demande pour personnes handicapes plus simple que celui que nous dcrivons ici. Ces groupes sont appels catgories rglementaires et sappliquent aux personnes qui reoivent des prestations:

- Programme de prestations dinvalidit du Rgime de pensions du Canada (PPIRPC)
- Pharmacare Plan P (soins palliatifs)
- Community Living BC (CLBC)
- Le programme At Home (du ministre de lEnfance et de la famille)

Veillez  informer le ministre du Dveloppement social et de la Rduction de la pauvret si vous tes inscrit  lun de ces programmes. [Contactez le ministre](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/access-services) pour savoir comment entamer le processus de demande simplifi.

Vous pouvez galement tre en mesure dutiliser un processus de demande simplifi pour les personnes handicapes si vous avez entre 17  et 19ans et si vous avez une dficience intellectuelle confirme. Cela signifie que vous pouvez soumettre une valuation ainsi quun diagnostic psychologique existant plutt que de remplir une demande complte pour personne handicape.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
You can get the CPPDisability benefit if:

- You are under age 65
- You contributed enough to the Canada Pension Plan while you were employed
- You have a severe mental or physical disability that regularly stops you from doing any type of substantially gainful work
- Your disability is long-term (unlikely to get much better) or is likely to result in death.
content1.fr-CA:
Vous pouvez obtenir les prestations du PPIRPC si:

- Vous avez moins de 65ans
- Vous avez suffisamment cotis au Rgime de pensions du Canada pendant que vous tiez employ
- Vous souffrez dun grave handicap mental ou physique qui vous empche rgulirement deffectuer tout type de travail rellement rmunrateur
- Votre handicap est de longue dure (il est peu probable quil samliore) ou est susceptible dentraner la mort.

content2.en-CA:
## Q & A

### I am already getting CPP retirement pension. Can I apply?

You can apply for a CPP post-retirement disability benefit if:

- You are age 60 to 65
- You have contributed enough to the CPP
- You have a mental or physical disability that regularly stops you from doing any type of substantially gainful work
- Your disability is long-term (unlikely to get much better) or is likely to result in death
- You have been receiving the CPP retirement pension for more than 15 months or became disabled after starting to receive the retirement pension.

### Eligibility for the childrens benefit

If you are getting CPP Disability, any of your dependent children can get a monthly payment. They must be:

- under 18, or
- between 18 and 25 and attending school full time.

To find out more about this benefit go to [CPP Childrens benefit](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/cpp-childrens-benefit.html).

### How do I get a disability benefit in Quebec?

You should apply for the[Quebec Pension Plan disability benefit](http://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/programmes/regime_rentes/prestations_invalidite/Pages/prestations_invalidite.aspx)if one of the following applies to you:

- You have worked only in the province of Quebec.
- You currently live in Quebec and have worked both in Quebec and in another province or territory.
- You have worked in Quebec, currently live outside Canada, and your last province of residence was Quebec.

### I am exempt from CPP contributions under section 87 of the Indian Act. Am I eligible to apply for CPP-Disability?

You can only apply if you have contributed to Canada Pension. If you would like to be eligible in the future, you and your employer can choose to contribute to the CPP. Use [Form CPT 124](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/forms-publications/forms/cpt124.html), Application for Coverage of Employment of an Indian in Canada under the Canada Pension Plan.

If your employer does not want to contribute, you can still make your own contributions. Use [Form CPT 20](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/forms-publications/forms/cpt20.html), Election to Pay Canada Pension Plan Contributions.

For information about contributing to the Quebec Pension Plan, contact the [Ministre de Revenue de Quebec](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/programmes/regime_rentes/Pages/regime_rentes.aspx).

### Can someone apply for CPP-Disability on my behalf?

Another person can help you apply, but you must make the application unless you are not able to manage your own affairs.

You can give your consent for your helper to communicate with Service Canada about your application. There are two ways to do this:

- You can provide consent through your [My Service Canada Account](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/services/my-account.html).
- You can complete the Consent to [Communicate Information to an Authorized Person form (ISP-1603)](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/CallForm.html?Lang=en&PDF=ISP-1603_CPP.pdf) and mail with the[ CPP-D application form to Service Canada](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/ReturningtheForm/IspCpp.html), or drop them off at a [Service Canada office](http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/tbsc-fsco/sc-hme.jsp?lang=eng).

### I need to apply on someones behalf. How do I get the authority to do that?

If someone cannot manage their own affairs, another person or agency may act on their behalf. Follow these steps:

1. Have a medical professional complete the [Certificate of Incapability form (ISP-3505)](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/Detail.html?Form=ISP3505CPP).
2. Complete __one__ of the following forms. Select the one that applies to you:
   - [Agreement to administer benefits under the Old Age Security Act and/or the Canada Pension Plan by a Private Trustee form](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/CallForm.html?Lang=en&PDF=ISP-3506_OAS.pdf) (ISP-3506) (for administration by an individual)
   - [Agreement to administer benefits under the Old Age Security Act and/or the Canada Pension Plan by an Agency or Institution form](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/CallForm.html?Lang=en&PDF=ISP-3507_OAS.pdf) (ISP-3507) (for administration by an agency, charitable organization, or municipality).
3. Mail the application form to [Service Canada](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/ReturningtheForm/IspCpp.html), or drop it off at a [Service Canada office](http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/tbsc-fsco/sc-hme.jsp?lang=eng).

__Note__: These forms do not give you the authority to submit the application through the persons My Service Canada account. You must submit a paper application. You also do not have the authority to change the recipients address or request withholding tax.

## Questions et rponses

### Je reois dj une pension de retraite du RPC. Puis-je faire une demande?

Vous pouvez demander une prestation dinvalidit aprs retraite du RPC si:

- Vous tes g de 60  65ans
- Vous avez suffisamment cotis au RPC
- Vous souffrez dun handicap mental ou physique qui vous empche rgulirement deffectuer tout type de travail rellement rmunrateur
- Votre handicap est de longue dure (il est peu probable quil samliore) ou est susceptible dentraner la mort
- Vous avez reu la pension de retraite du RPC pendant plus de 15mois ou vous tes devenu invalide aprs avoir commenc  recevoir la pension de retraite.

### Admissibilit  la prestation pour enfants

Si vous bnficiez du PPIRPC, nimporte lequel de vos enfants  charge peut recevoir un paiement mensuel. Ils doivent tre:

- g de moins de 18ans, ou
- entre 18 et 25ans et frquentant lcole  plein temps.

Pour en savoir plus sur cette prestation, consultez la page [Prestation pour enfants du RPC](https://www.canada.ca/fr/services/prestations/pensionspubliques/rpc/prestation-rpc-enfant.html).

### Comment obtenir une prestation dinvalidit au Qubec?

Vous devez demander la [prestation dinvalidit du Rgime des rentes du Qubec](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/fr/programmes/regime_rentes/prestations_invalidite/Pages/prestations_invalidite.aspx) si lune des situations suivantes sapplique  vous:

- Vous avez travaill uniquement dans la province de Qubec.
- Vous rsidez actuellement dans la province de Qubec et avez travaill  la fois au Qubec et dans une autre province ou un autre territoire.
- Vous avez travaill dans la province de Qubec, vous rsidez actuellement  lextrieur du Canada et votre dernire province de rsidence tait le Qubec.

### Je suis exempt des cotisations au RPC en vertu de larticle87 de la Loi sur les Indiens. Suis-je admissible  une demande de prestations du PPIRPC?

Vous ne pouvez prsenter une demande que si vous avez cotis au Rgime de pensions du Canada. Si vous souhaitez tre admissible dans le futur, vous et votre employeur pouvez choisir de cotiser au RPC. Utilisez le [formulaire CPT124](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/formulaires-publications/formulaires/cpt124.html), Demande dadmettre au Rgime de pensions du Canada, lemploi dun Indien au Canada.

Si votre employeur ne veut pas cotiser, vous pouvez toujours verser vos propres cotisations. Utilisez le [formulaire CPT20](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/formulaires-publications/formulaires/cpt20.html), Choix de verser des cotisations au Rgime de pensions du Canada.

Pour de linformation sur la faon de contribuer au Rgime de rentes du Qubec, communiquez avec le [ministre du Revenu du Qubec](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/fr/programmes/regime_rentes/Pages/regime_rentes.aspx).

### Quelquun peut-il prsenter une demande de prestations du PPIRPC en mon nom?

Une autre personne peut vous aider  faire la demande, mais cest vous qui devez la faire, sauf si vous ntes pas en mesure de grer vos propres affaires.

Vous pouvez consentir  ce que votre aide communique avec Service Canada au sujet de votre demande. Il existe deux manires de procder:

- Vous pouvez donner votre consentement au moyen de la plateforme [Mon dossier Service Canada](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/services/mon-dossier.html).
- Vous pouvez donner votre consentement avec le formulaire [Consentement  communiquer des renseignements  une personne autorise (ISP-1603)](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/CallForm.html?Lang=fr&PDF=ISP-1603_CPP.pdf) et le poster avec le formulaire de demande du [PPIRPC  Service Canada](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/retournerleformulaire/IspCpp.html), ou le dposer  un [bureau de Service Canada](https://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/tbsc-fsco/sc-hme.jsp?lang=fra).

### Je dois prsenter une demande au nom de quelquun. Comment puis-je obtenir lautorisation de le faire?

Si une personne nest pas en mesure de grer ses propres affaires, une autre personne ou un organisme peut agir en son nom. Suivez les tapes suivantes:

1. Demandez  un professionnel de la sant de remplir le [formulaire de Certificat dincapacit (ISP-3505)](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/Detail.html?Form=ISP3505CPP). 
2. Remplissez __un__ des formulaires suivants. Slectionnez celui qui vous concerne:
   - [Formulaire de Convention relative  ladministration des prestations aux termes de la Loi sur la scurit de la vieillesse ou du Rgime de pensions du Canada par un administrateur priv](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/CallForm.html?Lang=fr&PDF=ISP-3506_OAS.pdf) (ISP-3506) (pour ladministration par un particulier)
   - [Formulaire de Convention relative  ladministration des prestations aux termes de la Loi sur la scurit de la vieillesse ou du Rgime de pensions du Canada par un organisme ou tablissement](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/CallForm.html?Lang=fr&PDF=ISP-3507_OAS.pdf) (ISP-3506) (pour ladministration par une agence, un organisme de bienfaisance ou une municipalit).
3. Envoyez le formulaire de demande par la poste  [Service Canada](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/retournerleformulaire/IspCpp.html), ou dposez-le  un [bureau de Service Canada](https://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/tbsc-fsco/sc-hme.jsp?lang=fra).

__Remarques__: Ces formulaires ne vous donnent pas lautorisation de soumettre la demande au moyen du compte Mon Service Canada de la personne concerne. Vous devez prsenter une demande sur papier. Par ailleurs, vous navez pas le pouvoir de modifier ladresse du destinataire ou de demander une retenue dimpt.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
To get the Disability Tax Credit, you must be disabled in at least __1__ of these ways:

- You are [blind](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/vision.html). ([vision video and alternative formats and transcript](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/vision.html))
- You are [markedly restricted](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc.html) in at least 1 of the basic activities of daily living:
  -  [Speaking](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/speaking.html)
  -  [Hearing](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/hearing.html)
  -  [Walking](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/walking.html)
  -  [Eliminating](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/eliminating.html)
  -  [Feeding](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/feeding.html)
  -  [Dressing](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/dressing.html)
  -  [Mental functions needed for everyday life](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/mental-functions.html).
- You are [significantly restricted in 2 or more or the basic activities of daily living](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc.html) (can include a vision impairment).
- You need [life-sustaining therapy](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/eligible-dtc/life-sustaining-therapy.html).

To get the Disability Tax Credit, the impairment from your disability must be __both__: 

- prolonged, which means it has lasted, or is expected to last, for a continuous period of at least 12 months __and__
- present all, or substantially all (90%) of the time.

You __may__ qualify if your symptoms are recurring or episodic if they are present all or substantially all of the time.

Pour obtenir le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, vous devez tre en situation de handicap dau moins __1__ des faons suivantes:

- Vous tes atteint de [ccit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph.html). ([vido vision, formats alternatifs et transcription](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/information-medical-practitioners/vision-video-alternative-formats-transcript.html))
- Vous avez une [limitation marque](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph.html) dans au moins une des activits de la vie quotidienne:
  - [parler](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/parler.html)
  - [entendre](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/information-medical-practitioners/hearing.html)
  - [marcher](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/marcher.html)
  - [vacuer](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/evacuer.html)
  - [manger](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/nourrir.html)
  - [shabiller](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/habiller.html)
  - [fonctions mentales ncessaires aux activits de la vie courante](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph/fonctions-mentales.html).
- Vous avez [des limitations considrables dans deux ou plus de deux activits de la vie quotidienne](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph.html) (peut inclure une dficience visuelle).
- Vous avez besoin de [soins thrapeutiques essentiels](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/admissible-ciph.html).

Pour obtenir le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, la limitation de votre handicap doit tre __ la fois__:

- prolonge, ce qui signifie quelle a dur, ou quon sattend  ce quelle dure, pendant une priode continue dau moins douze mois __et___
- prsente tout le temps, ou presque (90%) tout le temps.

Vous __pouvez__ tre admissible si vos symptmes sont rcurrents ou pisodiques sils sont toujours ou presque toujours prsents.

## Tips

If you did not know about the Disability Tax Credit in previous ten tax years, you may be able to get some money back. Sometimes this can be as much as $15,000. Approval can take a few months. __Start now__ and get the ball rolling.

To get government benefits and credits on your taxes, you must keep your tax filing up to date.

content2.en-CA:
## Q & A

### Why do I have to get the Disability Tax Credit?

The Disability Tax Credit is the doorway to the RDSP and other federal disability related benefits.  Government rules say you must have the tax credit to open an RDSP.  It may take some effort to get the Disability Tax Credit, but it can help you and those who support you in many ways.

The Disability Tax Credit lowers the tax you have to pay. If you do not owe any tax, you do not get any money back, because it is non-refundable. But you can still claim the tax credit on your tax return. Then, you can transfer the tax credit to an eligible caregiver, such as a member of your family. They can use it to reduce their taxes. 

You can be approved for the Disability Tax Credit for up to 10 past years. That means you can claim the tax credit for previous tax returns when.

If you are not sure if you already have the Disability Tax Credit, contact Canada Revenue Agency:

- Toll-free: [1-800-959-8281](tel:18009598281) or  
- Log in to your [CRA My Account](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/e-services-individuals/account-individuals.html) to check.

### What happens to my RDSP if I lose my eligibility for the Disability Tax Credit?

Your RDSP will stay open, but with some limits. Take the[ Losing Disability Tax Credit (DTC) Tutorial](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/losing-disability-tax-credit-dtc-eligibility/) to learn more.

#### Tip: Get money back for past years when you were eligible

If you did not know about the Disability Tax Credit before, you may be able to get some tax money back. Sometimes this can be as much as $15,000. Approval can take a few months. Start now and get the ball rolling!

#### Tip: Getting the Disability Tax Credit can take time

It may take a few months to be approved. Some people receive the Disability Tax Credit easily  others have a harder time. [Learn more about the application process for the Disability Tax Credit](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/disability-tax-credit).

To learn more about this, contact Plan Institutes toll-free Disability Planning Helpline at [1-844-311-7526](tel:18443117526)  or email info@rdsp.com

### Why is it important to file my taxes?

Filing taxes is the only way to get the grants and bonds you are eligible for. Make sure you have filed taxes for all the years that you have been eligible for the Disability Tax Credit. The government will base your eligibility for grants and bonds on your family income from two years ago. For example, if you want to get the correct amount of grants and bonds in 2022, you should have your taxes filed for 2020 and previous years. 

If the beneficiary is a child, we recommend that you start filing their income taxes when they are 16. When they turn 19, they have the option to start using their personal income to receive grants and bonds.
content2.fr-CA:
## Questions et rponses

### Pourquoi dois-je bnficier du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes?

Le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes est la porte dentre au REEI et aux autres prestations fdrales lies  linvalidit. Les rgles gouvernementales stipulent que vous devez avoir le crdit dimpt pour ouvrir un REEI. Lobtention du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes peut demander quelques efforts, mais il peut vous aider, vous et ceux qui vous soutiennent, de nombreuses faons.

Le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes rduit limpt que vous devez payer. Si vous ne devez pas dimpt, vous ne rcuprez pas largent, car il est non remboursable. Mais vous pouvez toujours demander le crdit dimpt dans votre dclaration de revenus. Ensuite, vous pouvez transfrer le crdit dimpt  un aidant admissible, par exemple un membre de votre famille. Ils peuvent lutiliser en vue de rduire leurs impts.

Vous pouvez tre approuv pour le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes pour un maximum de 10annes antrieures. Cela signifie que vous pouvez demander le crdit dimpt pour les dclarations de revenus antrieures.

Si vous ne savez pas si vous bnficiez dj du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, contactez lAgence du revenu du Canada:

- Numro sans frais: [1800959-8281](tel:18009598281) ou
- Connectez-vous  [Mon dossier ARC](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/services-electroniques/services-electroniques-particuliers/dossier-particuliers.html) pour vrifier.

### Que se passe-t-il avec mon REEI si je perds mon droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes?

Votre REEI restera ouvert, mais avec certaines limites. Suivez le [Tutoriel sur la perte du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes (CIPH)](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/losing-disability-tax-credit-dtc-eligibility/) pour en savoir plus.

#### Petit conseil: Remboursement pour les annes antrieures o vous tiez admissible

Si vous ntiez pas au courant de lexistence du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, vous pouvez peut-tre rcuprer une partie de votre impt. Parfois, cela peut aller jusqu 15000dollars. Lapprobation peut prendre quelques mois. Commencez ds maintenant et faites tourner la machine!

#### Petit conseil: Obtenir le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes peut prendre du temps

Lapprobation peut prendre quelques mois. Certaines personnes bnficient facilement du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes, dautres ont plus de mal. [En savoir plus sur le processus de demande du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/disability-tax-credit).

Pour en savoir plus  ce sujet, contactez la ligne dassistance de Plan Institute pour la planification de linvalidit:

Numro de tlphone sans frais: [1844311-7526](tel:18443117526)  
Courriel: info@rdsp.com

### Pourquoi est-il important de dclarer mes impts?

La dclaration dimpts est le seul moyen dobtenir les subventions et les bons auxquels vous avez droit. Assurez-vous davoir rempli votre dclaration de revenus pour toutes les annes pendant lesquelles vous avez eu droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Le gouvernement basera votre admissibilit aux subventions et aux bons sur votre revenu familial dil y a deux ans. Par exemple, si vous voulez obtenir le bon montant de subventions et de bons en 2022, vous devez avoir vos impts de 2020 et des annes prcdentes.

Si le bnficiaire est un enfant, nous vous recommandons de commencer  dclarer ses impts sur le revenu lorsquil a 16ans. Lorsquils ont 19ans, ils ont la possibilit de commencer  utiliser leurs revenus personnels pour recevoir des subventions et des bons.

content3.en-CA:
## Tips

### Tip: Government grants and bonds end when you turn 49, so start early

After the calendar year in which you turn 49 years of age, you can no longer get government grants or bonds. This is true even if you were eligible for them in earlier years. It is better to open the RDSP as soon as you can. This maximizes both personal and government contributions. Starting early also allows your savings to grow more through investment and compounded interest. If the RDSP is opened early enough, you may be able to take out money at a younger age without any penalties.
content3.fr-CA:
## Petit conseil

### Petit conseil: Les subventions et les bons du gouvernement prennent fin lorsque vous atteignez 49ans, alors commencez tt

Aprs lanne civile au cours de laquelle vous avez atteint lge de 49ans, vous ne pouvez plus obtenir des subventions ou des bons du gouvernement. Cela est vrai mme si vous y avez eu droit au cours des annes prcdentes. Il est prfrable douvrir le REEI ds que possible. Cela permet de maximiser les contributions personnelles et gouvernementales. Commencer tt permet galement  votre pargne de crotre davantage grce aux investissements et aux intrts composs. Si le REEI est ouvert assez tt, vous pourrez peut-tre retirer de largent  un plus jeune ge sans aucune pnalit.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

To apply, you must be 18 or older. Children are not eligible for PWD status. You can start the PWD application process up to six months before your 18th birthday.

## Income assistance requirement

To apply for PWD status, you must either be receiving income assistance or if not, at least have a file open with the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction.

## Asset requirement

To apply for PWD, your assets (money and property) should not have a value over $100,000 for a single person. Your assets does not include your primary home and primary car. Even if you do not have any assets, you can still apply. For instance, if you have no income, you are living on your savings, and you expect your assets to be under $100,000 in a few months, then you should be allowed to apply for PWD.

## Disability requirements

### What disability means in terms of getting PWD status

You must have a severe mental or physical disability that impairs your ability to function in daily life. The impairment must meet all the criteria (rules) set out by the government:

#### 1. Your impairment is expected to last for at least two years.

This must be the written opinion of a[medical practitionerornurse practitioner](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/master-lists/definitions-master-list#nursepractitioner).

#### 2. Your impairment directly and significantly limits your daily living activities

Your impairment directly and significantly limits your [daily living activities](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/master-lists/definitions-master-list#dailylivingactivity).

This must be the written opinion of a prescribed professional. Depending on the section of the form, different professionals may complete the form.

Depending on your disability, different professionals can count. They include:

- Medical Doctor
- Registered Psychologist
- Registered Nurse, Psychiatric Nurse, or Nurse Practitioner
- Occupational Therapist
- Physical Therapist
- Social Worker
- Chiropractor
- School Psychologist

The rule says the impairment must directly and significantly restrict your ability to performdaily living activities. This could be either continuously (all the time) or periodically (some of the time, but for long periods).

Your impairments could limit your functional abilities, as well as daily living activities.

Daily living activities mean: 

- prepare your own meals
- manage your finances
- shop for personal needs
- use public or personal transportation
- do housework and keep your home reasonably clean
- move about indoors and outdoors
- perform personal hygiene and self-care
- manage your medications
- make decisions about personal activities, care, or finances (severe mental impairment)
- relate to, communicate, or interact with others effectively (severe mental impairment).

#### 3. You need significant help to be able to do daily living activities

This must be the written opinion of a prescribed professional. They must state that you need significant help from: 

- another person, such as a family member, friend, or care giver, or
- an assistive device, such as a cane or wheelchair, or
- a service animal, such as a guide dog.
content1.fr-CA:
## ge requis

Pour faire une demande, vous devez avoir 18ans ou plus. Les enfants ne peuvent pas bnficier du statut de personne handicape. Vous pouvez entamer la procdure de demande pour personne handicape jusqu six mois avant votre 18eanniversaire.

## Besoin dassistance au revenu

Pour demander le statut de personne handicape, vous devez soit recevoir une assistance au revenu, soit avoir au moins un dossier ouvert auprs du ministre du Dveloppement social et de la Rduction de la pauvret.

## Exigences relatives aux actifs

Pour faire une demande pour personne handicape, vos actifs (argent et biens) ne doivent pas avoir une valeur suprieure  100000dollars pour une personne seule. Vos actifs ne comprennent pas votre rsidence principale et votre voiture principale. Mme si vous navez pas dactifs, vous pouvez faire une demande. Par exemple, si vous navez aucun revenu, que vous vivez sur vos conomies et que vous pensez que vos actifs seront infrieurs  100000dollars dans quelques mois, vous devriez tre autoris  faire une demande pour personne handicape.

## Exigences relatives aux handicaps

### Quest-ce que le handicap signifie pour lobtention du statut de personne handicape?

Vous devez souffrir dun handicap mental ou physique grave qui altre votre capacit  fonctionner dans la vie quotidienne. La dficience doit rpondre  tous les critres (rgles) fixs par le gouvernement:

#### 1. Votre handicap devrait durer au moins deux ans

Il doit sagir de lavis crit dun [mdecin ou infirmier(re) praticien(ne)](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/master-lists/definitions-master-list#nursepractitioner).

#### 2. Votre dficience limite directement et considrablement vos activits de la vie quotidienne

Votre dficience limite directement et considrablement vos [activits de la vie quotidienne](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/master-lists/definitions-master-list#dailylivingactivity).

Il doit sagir de lavis crit dun professionnel prescrit. En fonction de la section du formulaire, diffrents professionnels peuvent remplir le formulaire.

En fonction de votre handicap, diffrents professionnels peuvent compter. Il sagit notamment de:

- Mdecin
- Psychologue agr
- Infirmier(re) autoris(e), infirmier(re) psychiatrique ou infirmier(re) praticien(ne)
- Ergothrapeute
- Physiothrapeute
- Travailleur et travailleuse social
- Chiropraticien(ne)
- Psychologue scolaire

La rgle stipule que la dficience doit restreindre directement et considrablement votre capacit  accomplir les activits de la vie quotidienne. Cela peut tre en continu (tout le temps) ou priodiquement (une partie du temps, mais pendant de longues priodes).

Vos dficiences pourraient limiter vos capacits fonctionnelles, ainsi que les activits de la vie quotidienne.

On entend par activits de la vie quotidienne:

- prparer vos propres repas
- grer vos finances
- faire des achats pour ses besoins personnels
- utiliser les transports publics ou personnels
- faire le mnage et garder votre maison raisonnablement propre
- se dplacer  lintrieur et  lextrieur
- assurer lhygine personnelle et les soins personnels
- grer vos mdicaments
- prendre des dcisions concernant les activits personnelles, les soins ou les finances (dficience mentale grave)
- dentrer en relation, de communiquer ou dinteragir efficacement avec les autres (dficience mentale grave).

#### 3. Vous avez besoin dune aide importante pour pouvoir effectuer les activits de la vie quotidienne

Il doit sagir de lavis crit dun professionnel prescrit. Ils doivent indiquer que vous avez besoin dune aide importante:

- une autre personne, telle quun membre de la famille, un ami ou une personne soignante,
- un dispositif dassistance, tel quune canne ou un fauteuil roulant,
- un animal dassistance, tel quun chien-guide.

content2.en-CA:
## Examples

### People who are directly and significantly restricted in their ability to perform daily living activities

__Matteo__ has degenerative disc disease, depression, and anxiety. He is in chronic pain and can only move slowly. He is very tired all the time. It is hard for him to do daily living activities like going to the grocery store or taking a bath without help. 

__Jamie__ has epilepsy, which causes seizures. He was also in a car accident and has long-term physical injuries. He has memory loss, brain fog, and pain. He is depressed and has low motivation to perform daily living activities. It is hard for him to manage finances, take the bus, and cook food without help.

__Vivian__ has severe mental illness caused by schizophrenia, depression, and PTSD. She is socially isolated and withdrawn. She has anxiety leaving her home. Her delusions restrict her ability to perform daily living activities. It is hard for her to keep her home clean or get groceries without help.

### People who need significant help from another person, device or animal

__Kais__ chronic pain, depression and anxiety makes it hard to complete daily living activities. Kai relies on a friend to help by buying groceries, preparing meals, picking up prescriptions from the pharmacy, giving rides to the doctor, and helping with household chores. 

__Priya__ has arthritis and carpal tunnel syndrome. She needs to use a cane whenever she leaves the house. She needs to use a wrist brace all of the time.

__Douglas__ has a visual impairment and needs a service guide dog.

## Exemples

### Les personnes dont la capacit daccomplir les activits de la vie quotidienne est directement et considrablement limite

__Matteo__ a une discopathie dgnrative, une dpression et de lanxit. Il souffre de douleurs chroniques et ne peut se dplacer que lentement. Il est trs fatigu tout le temps. Il lui est difficile de faire les activits de la vie quotidienne comme aller  lpicerie ou prendre un bain sans aide.

__Jamie__ est pileptique, ce qui provoque des crises. Il a galement eu un accident de voiture et souffre de blessures physiques  long terme. Il a des pertes de mmoire, un brouillard crbral et des douleurs. Il est dprim et a une faible motivation pour effectuer les activits de la vie quotidienne. Il lui est difficile de grer ses finances, de prendre le bus et de faire la cuisine sans aide.

__Vivian__ a une maladie mentale svre cause par la schizophrnie, la dpression, et le TSPT. Elle est socialement isole et replie sur elle-mme. Elle a peur de quitter sa maison. Ses dlires limitent sa capacit  effectuer les activits de la vie quotidienne. Il lui est difficile de garder sa maison propre ou de faire ses courses sans aide.

### Les personnes qui ont besoin dune aide significative dune autre personne, dun appareil ou dun animal

La douleur chronique, la dpression et lanxit de __Kai__ rendent difficile laccomplissement des activits de la vie quotidienne. Kai compte sur un ami pour laider en faisant les courses, en prparant les repas, en allant chercher les prescriptions  la pharmacie, en le conduisant chez le mdecin et en laidant dans les tches mnagres.

__Priya__ a de larthrite et un syndrome du canal carpien. Elle doit utiliser une canne chaque fois quelle quitte la maison. Elle doit tout le temps utiliser une attelle de poignet.

__Douglas__ a une dficience visuelle et a besoin dun chien-guide.

content1.en-CA:
Service Canada will review and process the application. It can take up to 8 months to hear back about their decision.

You should expect Service Canada to call you or send you a letter to confirm they have received your application. If you do not hear from them within three months, [contact the Canada Pension Plan](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/corporate/contact/cpp.html). They may call you again to ask for more information  for instance, a medical evaluation from another doctor. After they have reviewed the application, they will call you with a decision. They will follow up with a letter about the decision.

Aprs avoir examin la demande, ils vous contacteront pour vous faire part de leur dcision. Ils assureront le suivi en envoyant une lettre concernant la dcision.

content2Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is approved
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
You will get a decision letter from Service Canada to let you know that you have been approved to receive CPP disability benefits. Your decision letter will tell you the date and estimated amount of your first payment. It will also give information about any retroactive lump sum payment. 

### What you will get from CPP-Disability

The [basic payment amount from CPP disability benefits](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/cpp-disability-benefit/benefit-amount.html) is $558.74 monthly as of 2023. This is the flat rate that everyone who is eligible for CPP-Disability receives. Depending on how much you contributed into the Canada Pension Plan when you worked, you will receive an additional top up to the base rate. As of 2022, the average monthly amount people receive is $1,078.07. The maximum monthly payment amount is $1,538.67 in 2023. For more information, see [Canada Pension disability benefits: How much you could receive](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/cpp-disability-benefit/benefit-amount.html) on the governments website.

You will receive your first payment about 4 to 6 weeks after your application is approved. Your first payment will consist of a retroactive lump-sum and a monthly benefit payment cheque.

### Additional help you may get

#### CPP-Disability child benefit

For people who are receiving CPP disability benefits, the plan also provides a benefit for each child under the age of 18. In 2023, the amount is $281.72. This benefit is for the child and is paid to the custodial parent. In cases of shared custody, Service Canada will consider paying the child benefit to the person collecting CPP disability benefits. See [CPP Benefits for children](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/cpp-childrens-benefit.html) for more information.

If the child of a CPP disability recipient is between the ages of 18 and 25 and enrolled in full- time school at an accredited institution, the child portion of the CPP disability benefit can continue. The payments go directly to the adult child.

#### Top-up from the B.C. government

You may find that your monthly CPP-Disability rate is less than the provincial disability assistance rate. If so, you may be eligible for a top-up from the provincial government. For example, in B.C., [the maximum amount for a single person with the Persons with Disabilities designation](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/bc-employment-and-assistance-rate-tables/disability-assistance-rate-table) was $1,358 a month in 2021. You can learn more about the Persons with Disabilities designation in the [Disability Benefits Compass](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/). Contact your local [Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction office](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/access-services) for more information about this. 

### Taxes on CPP disability payments

CPP disability payments are taxable income. This means you will have to pay tax on the payments you receive. If you like, you can ask for income tax to be automatically deducted from your payments. To do this, complete the [Request for voluntary Federal Income Tax Deductions CPP/OAS (ISP-3520CPP) form](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/Detail.html?Form=ISP3520CPP).

The [Disability Tax Credit (DTC)](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit.html) is a non-refundable tax credit that can reduce the amount of tax that you need to pay. See the [Disability Benefits Compass](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/) for more information on how to apply.

Do you need help with preparing your tax return? Contact Tax AID DABC advocates for free help: [On-line Appointment](https://taxaid.janeapp.com/)booking site on Jane App. You can also call [236 477 1717](tel:2364771717) or [1 877 940 7797](tel:18779407797) to book an appointment.

### Disability income from other sources

You may be receiving disability income from other sources, such as a private insurer or a provincial or territorial program. The rules for getting income from these other sources may change your payments if you are approved for CPP-Disability. Contact your insurance company or social assistance program for details about your case. 

### How to maintain your benefits

Service Canada will review cases every so often to make sure only eligible people receive disability benefits. You must keep Service Canada informed if your life circumstances change. If Service Canada reviews your case, you will be asked to provide current information about your medical and life and circumstances. After your case is reviewed, you will get a letter to let you know if your disability benefits will continue. 

__Going to school__: You must notify Service Canada if you complete a school, university, trade, technical training, or rehabilitation program.

__Working and earning money__: After being approved for CPP-Disability, you can earn up to a certain amount each year without affecting your disability benefits. For 2023, this amount is $6,600 (before taxes). You must [contact Canada Pension Plan](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/corporate/contact/cpp.html) as soon as you make more than this amount. If you are late in contacting them, you may have to pay money back.

If your earnings are more than the allowed amount, it may trigger a review of your case. You might be asked if there have been changes to your medical condition and you will need to fill out and submit a questionnaire from your employer and your doctor. 

### Re-starting disability benefits for the same disability

You may try to return to work but find you are unable to keep working because of the same or a related disability. In this case, you can ask to have the benefit [automatically restarted](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/cpp-disability-benefit/reinstatement.html). You will not need to go through the usual application process if your benefits stopped less than 2 years ago because you returned to work.

### When you turn 65

When you turn 65 the disability benefit will automatically be changed to a CPP retirement pension.
