Vous devrez en parler  votre mdecin et lui demander de vous fournir des renseignements supplmentaires. Ils doivent dcrire clairement comment vos dficiences affectent vos activits de la vie quotidienne. Utilisez l[Outil pour le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/dtc-app/) dAccs REEI pour vous aider  dcrire votre dficience. Il compilera vos rponses dans un document que vous pourrez prsenter  votre mdecin.

__Si la dure ou la gravit de vos dficiences ne rpond pas aux exigences__: Vous navez pas droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes  lheure actuelle, mais vous pourriez faire une nouvelle demande  lavenir si votre tat persiste et saggrave.

__Si votre situation mdicale a chang ou si votre mdecin a chang__: Refaites une demande pour le CIPH. Vous devrez attendre un an avant de prsenter une nouvelle demande.

###### tape4: Faire une nouvelle demande, reconsidrer ou prsenter un avis dopposition

__Si vous dcidez de demander  lARC dexaminer votre demande__:

[Contactez lARC par crit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/organisation/coordonnees/bureaux-services-fiscaux-centres-fiscaux.html) et demandez une demande de nouvelle dtermination. Vous devrez fournir dautres documents  lappui de votre mdecin. Il doit sagir de documents que vous navez pas dj envoys, tels que des rapports mdicaux actualiss ou une lettre de votre mdecin traitant.

Vous avez __un an__ pour complter ce processus. Trouvez un reprsentant pour vous aider. Contactez le programme de services dassistance judiciaire de la Disability Alliance BC, [604872-1278](tel:6048721278) (numro sans frais[1800663-1278](tel:118006631278)). Ou visitez [le site Web de PovNet](https://www.povnet.org/). Cliquez sur Trouver un reprsentant.

__Si vous dcidez de dposer un avis dopposition formel__

Vous avez __90jours__  compter de la date figurant sur votre avis de dtermination pour prsenter un avis dopposition. Dans votre lettre au Chef des Appels, expliquez pourquoi vous vous opposez  la dcision prise dans votre avis de dtermination.

Vous devriez consulter un reprsentant, un comptable ou un juriste expriment afin de vous aider dans cette dmarche formelle. Demandez de laide en contactant un reprsentant du programme de services dassistance judiciaire  [Disability Alliance BC, [604872-1278](tel:6048721278) (numro sans frais1800663-1278](tel:18006631278)). Ou visitez [le site Web de PovNet](https://www.povnet.org/). Cliquez sur Trouver un reprsentant.

__Si vous dcidez de prsenter une nouvelle demande__

Obtenez un nouveau formulaire de demande de crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes et faites une nouvelle demande. Vous devrez __attendre un an__ avant de prsenter une nouvelle demande.

__Ne vous dcouragez pas si vous tes refus  nouveau__

Bien que vous deviez attendre un an avant de refaire une demande, il ny a pas de limite au nombre de fois o vous pouvez refaire une demande de crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes.

### Jai besoin daide pour mon refus

#### Disability Alliance BC

Trouvez un reprsentant pour vous aider. Contactez le programme dAccs REEI de la [Disability Alliance BC](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/).

Local [604872-1278](tel:6048721278) | Numro sans frais [1800663-1278](tel:18006631278) | courriel rdsp@disabilityalliancebc.org. Ou visitez [le site Web de PovNet](https://www.povnet.org/). Cliquez sur Trouver un reprsentant.

#### [BC Aboriginal Network on Disability Society](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/)

Si vous tes une personne autochtone en Colombie-Britannique, contactez BCANDS afin dobtenir un soutien individuel gratuit concernant le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes et le rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit.

Local [250381-7303](tel:2503817303) | Numro sans frais [1888815-5511](tel:18888155511) (Accessible par ATS) | bcands@bcands.bc.ca

#### [Plan Institute](https://planinstitute.ca/)

Vous pouvez contacter le Plan Institute pour obtenir un soutien individuel gratuit afin de vous guider dans le processus de demande du crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes.

Ligne dassistance gratuite [1844311-7526](tel:18443117526) | courriel info@rdsp.com

#### [Agence du revenu du Canada](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/organisation/coordonnees.html)  Ligne des demandes de renseignements sur limpt des particuliers

Il est possible de communiquer avec lARC pour poser des questions ou discuter de votre demande de crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes.

Au Canada ou aux tats-Unis, composez le [1800959-8281](tel:18009598281).

De partout ailleurs, appelez  frais virs en composant le [613940-8495](tel:6139408495). Communiquez avec votre fournisseur de services ou votre oprateur pour lancer lappel  frais virs. Vous pouvez entendre un bip et prouver un dlai de connexion normal.

Si vous utilisez un tlimprimeur, composez le [1800665-0354](tel:18006650354) pendant [les heures normales de service](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/organisation/coordonnees.html).

content1.en-CA:
## What to expect after you open a Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP)

You might not get any documents right after you open an RDSP, but your financial institution can give you email, mail, or verbal confirmation once the account has been opened. If you do online banking, you can check that way.  You will receive RDSP statements by mail, email, or through online banking. Ask your financial institution if statements come monthly, quarterly, or yearly.

__Investing__: After you have opened your [Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP)](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/topics/registered-disability-savings-plan-rdsp.html), you can use it to save for your retirement. Plan Institute offers information on [how to invest your RDSP](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/how-do-i-invest-my-rdsp/).

__Grants and bonds__: The RDSP is where the government will pay you [disability savings bonds and grants](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/disability/savings/grants-bonds.html), if you are eligible.

[Learn more about the Canada Disability Savings Grant](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/disability/savings/grants-bonds.html)

[Learn more about the Canada Disability Savings Bond](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/disability/savings/grants-bonds.html)
content1.fr-CA:
## Que se passe-t-il aprs louverture dun rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit (REEI)?

Il se peut que vous ne receviez pas de documents immdiatement aprs avoir ouvert un REEI, mais votre institution financire peut vous donner une confirmation par courriel, par la poste ou verbalement une fois le compte ouvert. Si vous faites des oprations bancaires en ligne, vous pouvez vrifier de cette faon. Vous recevrez les relevs de REEI par la poste, par courriel ou par lintermdiaire de vos oprations bancaires en ligne. Demandez  votre institution financire si les relevs sont mensuels, trimestriels ou annuels.

__Investissement__: Aprs avoir ouvert votre [Rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit (REEI)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/sujets/regime-enregistre-epargne-invalidite-reei.html), vous pouvez lutiliser pour pargner en vue de votre retraite. Le Plan Institute offre de linformation sur [comment investir dans votre REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/how-do-i-invest-my-rdsp/).

__Les subventions et les bons__: Le REEI est lendroit o le gouvernement vous versera des [bons et subventions dpargne-invalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/invalidite/epargne/montant.html), si vous tes admissible.

[En savoir plus sur la Subvention canadienne pour lpargne-invalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/invalidite/epargne/montant.html)

[En savoir plus sur le Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/invalidite/epargne/montant.html)

content2.en-CA:
### I receive other government benefits. Will my RDSP affect my eligibility or amounts I receive?

- It does not affect any federal benefits.
- It affects some provincial benefits, but not others.

Federal benefits like the [Canada Pension Plan Disability Benefits (CPPD)](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/pension-plan-disability-benefits.html), [Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS)](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/old-age-security/guaranteed-income-supplement.html), and [Old Age Security (OAS)](https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/publicpensions/cpp/old-age-security.html) are not affected by an RDSP. They do not look at the funds in an RDSP when assessing your income. 

Almost all provinces and territories have exempted the money in an RDSP, even when it is withdrawn. This means that you can still get income assistance and disability benefits while saving for your future. If you live in Quebec, New Brunswick, or Prince Edward Island, look at [Provincial Resources-RDSP](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/) to see how your province treats money in an RDSP and money taken out. This will help you understand any impact. 

For all benefits and programs, you should check directly with the organization who administers the benefit or program to see how the RDSP will affect the supports and services you get.

### Receiving Canada Disability Savings Bonds

The [Canada Disability Savings Bond](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/disability/savings/grants-bonds.html) is money that the government pays to people living with a disability on a low income. You can get up to $1,000 every year for up to 20 years. The amount you get depends on your family income.

Your financial institution will give you the application form for Canada Disability Savings Bonds at the same time you apply for the RDSP. You can also [print the form](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/en/Detail.html?Form=EMP5608) and take it with you to your financial institution.

To qualify for the bonds, you must:

- Apply for the RDSP, be approved, and have your RDSP account open.
- Open the account when you are younger than 49 or before the end of the year you turn 49. You are only eligible for grants and bonds until the year you turn 49.
- Have a family income that is less than the threshold. This was $53,359 in 2023. You can [get the current threshold amount](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/what-is-the-canada-disability-savings-bond/) from the Plan Institutes website.
- File tax returns for each year that you were eligible for the Disability Tax Credit. You can catch up on any missed bonds that you were entitled to in the last 10 years.
- Keep filing your taxes. If you do not, the government will assume you have a high income and stop putting bonds in your account.

#### When you should expect to receive the Canada Disability Savings Bond

It takes about six weeks from when you have opened your RDSP and applied for the bonds to start receiving them.

If it has been three months and you have not received bonds that you are eligible for, contact your financial institution or Employment of Social Development Canada. 

The first government deposit will catch up on any previous bonds you are eligible for plus the current year. After that, you will receive the bond once a year, automatically, as long as you file your taxes. This annual payment is usually made by the end of February.

### Receiving Canada Disability Savings Grants

The [Canada Disability Savings Grant](https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/programs/disability/savings/grants-bonds.html) is matching money that the government pays into your RDSP. It is meant to encourage you to save. For every $1 you put in, or someone puts in for you, the government may match with up to $3.

Your financial institution will give you the application form for Canada Disability Savings Grants at the same time you apply for the RDSP. You can also print the form and take it to your financial institution.

To qualify for the grant, you must:

- Apply for the RDSP, be approved, and open your account.
- Open the account when you are younger than 49 or before December 31 of the year you turn 49. You are only eligible for grants and bonds until the year you turn 49.
- File tax returns for each year that you were eligible for the Disability Tax Credit. You can catch up on any missed grants that you were entitled to in the last 10 years. 
- Keep filing your taxes. If you do not, the government will assume you have a high income. That means you will get less matching money.

#### What you will get

The grant amount you will get depends on your family income and how much you put into your RDSP. 

The family income threshold changes every year. The information below is for the year 2021. You can [get the current threshold amount](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/what-is-the-canada-disability-savings-bond/) from the Plan Institutes website.

If your family income is $106,717 or less:

- For the first $500 you put into your RDSP, you get $3 for every $1 you contribute.
- For the next $1,000 you put into your RDSP, you get $2 for every $1 you contribute.
- The most you can get in one year is $3,500.
- The lifetime maximum you can get is $70,000.

If your family income is more than $106,717:

- For the first $1,000 you put into your RDSP, you will get $1 for every $1 you contribute.
- You can get a maximum grant of $1,000 each year.
- The lifetime maximum is $70,000.

#### When you should expect to receive the grant money

It takes about six weeks from the date of a contribution to your RDSP for the government to deposit matching grants into your RDSP account.

If it has been three months and you have not received grants that you are eligible for, contact your financial institution or Employment of Social Development Canada.

### Catching up on past grants and bonds

When you open an RDSP, you can catch up on any missed grants or bonds that you were entitled to in the last 10 years. You must still be within the calendar year, by December 31, of the year you turn 49 years old or younger to get these grants or bonds. 

The government will put in a maximum of $10,500 in any one year for the grant, and up to $11,000 for the bonds. The way that they calculate the grants is quite complicated. Employment and Social Development Canada will give an Annual Statement of Grant Entitlement each year between January and March. This will let you know how much money you need to deposit to get the maximum grant in any given year. 

If you have just opened an RDSP, contact Employment and Social Development Canada to confirm how much grant entitlement you have for this year.

### What you need to update

If you are the beneficiary of an RDSP, you should have a will. If you already have a will, you should update it after you open an RDSP. Your will says what happens to the remaining money in your RDSP after you are gone. Learn more from the Plan Institute on [updating your will.](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/updating-your-will/) 

### How to maintain your benefits

File your taxes every year. This tells the government how much in bonds and grants you are eligible to receive. Learn more from the Plan Institute on [filing your income tax returns](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/filing-your-income-tax-returns/).

Set reminders for the year that your [Disability Tax Credit](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/disability-tax-credit) expires. You can re-apply for the tax credit up to one year before it expires. Start early to make sure that you have lots of time to deal with any problems that come up with your new application.

### Withdrawing money from your RDSP

#### Taxes 

When you take money out of your RDSP, some of it is taxable:

- The amount that you have put in, or someone has contributed on your behalf, is not taxable.
- The amount that the government has put in for Canada Disability Savings Grants and Bonds is taxable.
- The investment income earned in the plan is taxable.

When you take out money, the financial institution will tell you how much is taxable based on these rules. You must declare this amount as income when you file your taxes for the year that it was taken out. 

#### Minimum withdrawals after age 60 

When you turn 60, you have to start taking out minimum withdrawals. These withdrawals are called Lifetime Disability Assistance Payments (LDAPs). The LDAP amount is based on a government formula. You can choose to begin LDAPs before you turn 60. But once you start, you must continue for life, or until all the RDSP is withdrawn.

#### One-time withdrawals

One-time withdrawals, if allowed by your financial institution, can occur any time. You may have to pay back some grants and bonds unless they have been in the account for longer than 10 years. There are also limits on the amount you can take out based on a set formula. Learn more from the Plan Institute on How Do You Get Your Money Out.
content2.fr-CA:
### Je reois dautres prestations gouvernementales. Mon REEI aura-t-il une incidence sur mon admissibilit ou sur les montants que je reois?

- Ceci na aucune incidence sur les prestations fdrales.
- Il affecte certaines prestations provinciales, mais pas dautres.

Les prestations fdrales telles que les [Prestations dinvalidit du Rgime de pensions du Canada (PPIRPC)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/regime-pensions-prestations-invalidite.html), le [Supplment de revenu garanti (SRG)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/services/prestations/pensionspubliques/rpc/securite-vieillesse/supplement-revenu-garanti.html) et la [pension de la Scurit de vieillesse (SV)](https://www.canada.ca/fr/services/prestations/pensionspubliques/rpc/securite-vieillesse.html) ne sont pas touches par un REEI. Elles ne tiennent pas compte des fonds dans un REEI lorsquelles valuent votre revenu.

Presque toutes les provinces et tous les territoires ont exempt largent dans un REEI, mme lorsquil est retir. Cela signifie que vous pouvez continuer  bnficier de lassistance au revenu et des prestations dinvalidit tout en pargnant pour votre avenir. Si vous vivez au Qubec, au Nouveau-Brunswick ou  lle-du-Prince-douard, consultez la page [Ressources provinciales-REEI](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/provincial-resources/) pour savoir comment votre province traite largent dans un REEI et largent retir. Cela vous aidera  comprendre tout impact.

Pour toutes les prestations et tous les programmes, vous devriez vrifier directement auprs de lorganisme qui administre la prestation ou le programme pour savoir comment le REEI affectera les soutiens et les services dont vous bnficiez.

### Recevoir des bons dpargne-invalidit canadiens

Le [Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/invalidite/epargne/montant.html) est une somme que le gouvernement verse aux personnes handicapes  faible revenu. Vous pouvez obtenir jusqu 1000dollars par an pendant 20ans maximum. Le montant que vous recevez dpend de votre revenu familial.

Votre institution financire vous remettra le formulaire de demande de Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit en mme temps que votre demande de REEI. Vous pouvez galement [imprimer le formulaire](https://catalogue.servicecanada.gc.ca/content/EForms/fr/Detail.html?Form=EMP5608) et lapporter avec vous  votre institution financire.

Pour bnficier de ces bons, vous devez:

- Faire une demande de REEI, tre approuv, et avoir son compte REEI ouvert.
- Ouvrir le compte lorsque vous avez moins de 49ans ou avant la fin de lanne o vous atteignez 49ans. Vous navez droit aux subventions et aux bons que jusqu lanne de vos 49ans.
- Avoir un revenu familial infrieur au seuil. Ce montant tait de 53 359 $ en 2023. Vous pouvez [obtenir le montant de seuil actuel](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/what-is-the-canada-disability-savings-bond/) sur le site Web du Plan Institute.
- Dposer une dclaration de revenus pour chaque anne o vous avez eu droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Vous pouvez rattraper les bons manqus auxquels vous avez eu droit au cours des dix dernires annes.
- Continuer  dclarer vos impts. Si vous ne le faites pas, le gouvernement supposera que vous avez un revenu lev et cessera de placer des bons sur votre compte.

#### Quand devez-vous vous attendre  recevoir le Bon canadien pour lpargne-invalidit?

Il faut compter environ six semaines  partir du moment o vous avez ouvert votre REEI et demand les bons pour commencer  les recevoir.

Si cela fait trois mois et que vous navez pas reu les bons auxquels vous avez droit, contactez votre institution financire ou Emploi et Dveloppement social Canada.

Le premier dpt gouvernemental permet de rattraper tous les bons prcdents auxquels vous avez droit, plus lanne en cours. Par la suite, vous recevrez le bon une fois par an, automatiquement, pour autant que vous dclariez vos impts. Ce paiement annuel est gnralement effectu  la fin du mois de fvrier.

### Recevoir des bons et des subventions dpargne-invalidit canadiens

La [Subvention canadienne pour lpargne-invalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/emploi-developpement-social/programmes/invalidite/epargne/montant.html) est un montant de contrepartie que le gouvernement verse dans votre REEI. Il est destin  vous encourager  pargner. Pour chaque dollar que vous dposez, ou que quelquun dpose pour vous, le gouvernement peut verser jusqu 3dollars.

Votre institution financire vous remettra le formulaire de demande de Subvention canadien pour lpargne-invalidit en mme temps que votre demande de REEI. Vous pouvez galement imprimer le formulaire et lapporter avec vous  votre institution financire.

Pour bnficier de cette subvention, vous devez:

- Faire une demande de REEI, tre approuv et ouvrir votre compte.
- Ouvrir le compte lorsque vous avez moins de 49ans ou avant le 31dcembre de lanne o vous atteignez 49ans. Vous navez droit aux subventions et aux bons que jusqu lanne de vos 49ans.
- Dposer une dclaration de revenus pour chaque anne o vous avez eu droit au crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Vous pouvez rattraper les subventions manques auxquelles vous avez eu droit au cours des dix dernires annes.
- Continuer  dclarer vos impts. Si vous ne le faites pas, le gouvernement supposera que vous avez un revenu lev. Cela signifie que vous recevrez moins dargent de contrepartie.

#### Ce que vous obtiendrez

Le montant de la subvention que vous recevrez dpend de votre revenu familial et du montant que vous avez vers dans votre REEI.

Le seuil de revenu familial change chaque anne. Les renseignements ci-dessous concernent lanne2021. Vous pouvez [obtenir le montant de seuil actuel](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/what-is-the-canada-disability-savings-bond/) sur le site Web du Plan Institute.

Si votre revenu familial est de 106,717$ ou moins:

- Pour les premiers 500$ que vous versez dans votre REEI, vous recevez 3$ pour chaque dollar cotis.
- Pour la prochaine tranche de 1000$ que vous versez dans votre REEI, vous obtenez 2$ pour chaque dollar cotis.
- Le maximum que vous pouvez obtenir en une anne est de 3500$.
- Le maximum  vie que vous pouvez obtenir est de 70000$.

Si votre revenu familial est suprieur  106,717$:

- Pour les premiers 1000$ que vous versez dans votre REEI, vous recevrez 1$ pour chaque dollar cotis.
- Vous pouvez obtenir une subvention maximale de 1000dollars par anne.
- Le maximum viager est de 70000$.

#### Quand devez-vous vous attendre  recevoir largent de la subvention?

Il faut compter environ six semaines  partir de la date de la cotisation  votre REEI pour que le gouvernement dpose les subventions de contrepartie dans votre compte REEI.

Si cela fait trois mois et que vous navez pas reu les subventions auxquels vous avez droit, contactez votre institution financire ou Emploi et Dveloppement social Canada.

### Rattraper les subventions et bons passs

Lorsque vous ouvrez un REEI, vous pouvez rattraper les subventions ou les bons manqus auxquels vous avez eu droit au cours des dix dernires annes. Vous devez toujours tre dans lanne civile, au 31dcembre de lanne o vous avez 49ans ou moins, pour obtenir ces subventions ou bons.

Le gouvernement versera un maximum de 10500$ par anne pour la subvention, et jusqu 11000$ pour les bons. La faon dont ils calculent les subventions est assez complique. Emploi et dveloppement social Canada remet chaque anne, entre janvier et mars, un rapport annuel des droits aux subventions. Cela vous permettra de savoir combien dargent vous devez dposer afin dobtenir la subvention maximale pour une anne donne.

Si vous venez douvrir un REEI, communiquez avec Emploi et Dveloppement social Canada pour confirmer le montant de la subvention  laquelle vous avez droit pour cette anne.

### Ce que vous devez mettre  jour

Si vous tes le bnficiaire dun REEI, vous devriez avoir un testament. Si vous avez dj un testament, vous devriez le mettre  jour aprs avoir ouvert un REEI. Votre testament indique ce quil adviendra de largent restant dans votre REEI aprs votre dcs. Pour en savoir plus sur la mise  jour de votre testament, [consultez le site du Plan Institute](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/updating-your-will/).

### Comment maintenir vos prestations

Dclarez vos impts chaque anne. Cela indique au gouvernement le montant des bons et des subventions auxquelles vous avez droit. Pour en savoir plus, consultez le site du Plan Institute sur [la dclaration dimpt sur le revenu](https://www.rdsp.com/tutorial/filing-your-income-tax-returns/).

Dfinissez des rappels pour lanne o votre [crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/disability-tax-credit) expire. Vous pouvez faire une nouvelle demande de crdit dimpt jusqu un an avant son expiration. Commencez tt pour vous assurer davoir suffisamment de temps pour rgler les problmes qui pourraient survenir avec votre nouvelle demande.

### Retrait dargent de votre REEI

#### Taxes

Lorsque vous retirez de largent de votre REEI, une partie de cet argent est imposable:

- Le montant que vous avez vers, ou que quelquun a vers en votre nom, nest pas imposable.
- Le montant que le gouvernement a vers au titre des subventions et des bons canadiens pour lpargne-invalidit est imposable.
- Les revenus de placement obtenus dans le cadre du rgime sont imposables.

Lorsque vous retirez de largent, linstitution financire vous indique le montant imposable en fonction de ces rgles. Vous devez dclarer ce montant comme un revenu lorsque vous dclarez vos impts pour lanne o il a t retir.

#### Retraits minimums aprs 60ans

Lorsque vous atteignez 60ans, vous devez commencer  effectuer des retraits minimums. Ces retraits sont appels paiements viagers pour invalidit (PVI). Le montant du PVI est bas sur une formule gouvernementale. Vous pouvez choisir de commencer les PVI avant votre 60eanniversaire. Mais une fois que vous avez commenc, vous devez continuer  vie, ou jusqu ce que la totalit du REEI soit retire.

#### Retraits uniques

Les retraits uniques, sils sont autoriss par votre institution financire, peuvent tre effectus  tout moment. Vous devrez peut-tre rembourser certaines subventions et certains bons,  moins quils naient figur sur le compte pendant plus de 10ans. Il existe galement des limites au montant que vous pouvez retirer sur la base dune formule fixe. Pour en savoir plus, consultez le site du Plan Institute sur le thme Comment sortir votre argent.

content3Title.en-CA: If you are unable to open an RDSP
content3Title.fr-CA: Si vous ntes pas en mesure douvrir un REEI

content3.en-CA:
If you have trouble opening an RDSP, even if you meet all the eligibility criteria, it is usually because your financial institution is missing some information. Check with your financial institution to make sure they know that you have been approved for the Disability Tax Credit. You can show them your Notice of Determination letter, or the information in your Canada Revenue Agency [MyAccount](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/e-services-individuals/account-individuals.html).

If you are still having trouble, contact Employment and Social Development Canada.
content3.fr-CA:
Si vous avez du mal  ouvrir un REEI, mme si vous rpondez  tous les critres dadmissibilit, cest gnralement parce quil manque des renseignements  votre institution financire. Vrifiez auprs de votre institution financire que celle-ci est au courant que vous avez t approuv pour le crdit dimpt pour personnes handicapes. Vous pouvez leur montrer votre lettre davis de dtermination ou les renseignements contenus dans [Mon dossier] de lAgence du revenu du Canada(https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/services-electroniques/services-electroniques-particuliers/dossier-particuliers.html).

Si vous avez encore des difficults, communiquez avec Emploi et Dveloppement social Canada.

title.fr-CA: Aprs avoir prsent votre demande

content1.en-CA:
## What happens when your application is approved?

You will get a notice of determination letter saying you have been approved for PWD status.

You will also get:

- An information letter. Here is a  [Sample letter: Information to New Persons with Disabilities Designation](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr3220.pdf)
- A Persons with Disabilities brochure.
- A direct deposit brochure.
- A brochure explaining how to complete the Monthly Report Form.
- A My Self Serve client information sheet.

## Eligibility for Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPPD) benefits

You might also get a letter about applying for [Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPPD) benefits](https://disability.benefitswayfinder.org/canada-pension-plan-disability-benefit). Some people get this letter as soon as they have applied for PWD status. Others get it after they have been approved for PWD status. Some people might get this letter months or years after they have been approved for PWD status. Here is a [Sample letter: CPPD Information Letter for Approved PWD Applications  Initial Letter](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr3344.pdf).

## What you will get when you have Persons with Disabilities (PWD) status

If you are a single person without dependents, you will receive $983 in support plus up to $375 for shelter per month. Check the [Disability Assistance Rate Table](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/bc-employment-and-assistance-rate-tables/disability-assistance-rate-table) for the amounts you can expect to receive in your situation.

You will not be expected to look for work.

You will be able to keep up to $15,000 a year in earned income if you are a single person. Learn more about the [Annual Earnings Exemption](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/services-for-people-with-disabilities/disability-assistance/on-disability-assistance/annual-earnings-exemption) from the ministry website.

## Benefits and coverage you get

You are automatically eligible for other benefits when you have Persons Disabilities (PWD) status. You do not need to get pre-approval from the ministry. Here is a list of what you can get:

- [Services covered by Medical Services Plan (MSP)](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/health/health-drug-coverage/msp/bc-residents/benefits/services-covered-by-msp)
- *Prescription drugs covered by Pharmacare*: The ministry will send eligibility information to PharmaCare for you. You do not need to apply to PharmaCare for this coverage.
- [Dental coverage](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/supplements/dental) up to $1,000 every two calendar years (beginning on January 1 of every odd-numbered year). This is based on the dental fee schedules allowed by the ministry. You can check the [Dentist fee schedule](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/family-and-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/schedule-dentist.pdf),[ Denturist fee schedule](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/family-and-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/schedule-denturist.pdf), and [Hygienist fee schedule](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/family-and-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/schedule-hygienist.pdf). Give the dental service provider your CareCard or your BC Services Card. They will check your coverage.
- [Optical coverag](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/supplements/optical)e for routine eye exams every two years and eyeglasses every three years. This is based on the optical fee schedules allowed by the ministry. You can check the [Optometrist and ophthalmologist fee schedule](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/family-and-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/schedule-optometrist.pdf) and the [Optician fee schedule](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/family-and-social-supports/income-assistance/on-assistance/schedule-optician.pdf). Tell the eye clinic or optical supplier that you have coverage. Give them your CareCard or your BC Services Card. They will check your coverage. You can also [order eyeglasses online](https://www.clearly.ca/sdpr) from Clearly.ca.
- [B.C. Bus Pass](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/transportation/passenger-travel/buses-taxis-limos/bus-pass/people-with-disabilities) (Compass Card) for travel anywhere within the TransLink and B.C. Transit service areas or a transportation supplement of $52 per month. Apply for the BC bus pass by calling the ministry at 1-866-866-0800 or use your [My Self Serve account](https://myselfserve.gov.bc.ca/). If you decide not to apply for a bus pass, you will have a $52 transportation supplement added to your monthly assistance automatically. You can switch back and forth between a monthly bus pass and the transportation supplement month-by-month. You will need to contact the ministry by the 5th day of the month to start or stop the pass for the following month. Call 1-866-866-0800, email SDSIBUSPA@gov.bc.ca, or use [My Self Serve](https://myselfserve.gov.bc.ca/) to ask for a switch.

## Learn more

Disability Alliance BCs [Checklist for the Persons with Disabilities (PWD) Benefit](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs3/) help sheet 

Disability Alliance BCs [Health Supplements for People with Disabilities](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs7/) help sheet

## Other health supplements you may be able to get

When you have PWD status, you could get other health supplements if you meet certain requirements. Contact the ministry for details on applying for these health supplements:

- [Alternative Hearing Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/alternative-hearing-assistance-supplement) of $100 per month for people with permanent, profound hearing loss in both ears. To apply, your hearing health professional has to contact Pacific Blue Cross and submit an assessment form. Pacific Blue Cross will tell your hearing health professional what other documents are needed. Pacific Blue Cross will let you know in writing if you have been approved.
- [Diet supplements](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/diet-supplements) of $10 to $40 per month to help meet the cost for therapeutic diets. There is no special application form to fill out. Your doctor must state in writing: your medical condition, the kind of diet you need, and how long you need it. The ministry can ask you to renew the request every year or two. There are [nine diet supplements](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/bc-employment-and-assistance-rate-tables/health-supplements-and-programs-rate-table) available but you can only get one diet supplement at a time. It is best to apply for the highest diet allowance that you think you are eligible for. Here is a [Sample letter: Diet Supplement Review](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr3138.pdf). Here is a [Sample letter: Diet Supplement Denial](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr3139.pdf).
- [Drug and Alcohol Treatment](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/alcohol-and-drug-residential-treatment) of up to $500 a year. If you get treatment that is not a Ministry of Health service, you will need to get approval in advance from the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction.
- [Extended Medical Therapies](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/extended-medical-therapies) to pay for chiropractic, massage therapy, physiotherapy, acupuncture, naturopathy, and non-surgical podiatry visits. You must have already used up the 10 visits for the year covered under the Medical Services Plan (MSP) supplementary benefits. A doctor must confirm you have a strong (acute) need for the service.
- [Infant formula](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/nutritional-supplements) can be provided for a child under 12 months of age if the baby has a medical condition where special infant formula is needed. This is also available if the child is at risk of getting a disease from the mothers breast milk. Your health practitioner has to confirm that your baby needs this supplement.
- [Medical equipment and devices](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/medical-equipment-and-devices), including mobility aids. The ministry will ask for a prescription from a doctor or nurse practitioner. If the medical equipment or device you need is very specific, the ministry may ask for an additional assessment from a health professional such as an occupational therapist. The ministry must approve the cost in advance. Here is a [Sample form: Medical Equipment Request and Justification](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr2138.pdf).
- [Medical supplies](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/medical-supplies) to pay for disposable medical and surgical supplies. Supplies must be prescribed by a doctor or nurse practitioner.
- [Medical transportation](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/medical-transportation) supplement of 20 cents per kilometer to meet costs of travelling for essential medical treatment. The ministry must approve the costs in advance. To apply, your health practitioner must confirm your need to travel in writing. If the transportation is non-local, you must also submit a [Request for Non-Local Medical Transportation Assistance](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr3320.pdf).
- [Natal supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/natal-supplement) provides an allowance of $45 a month if you are pregnant with a child. Eligibility lasts up to six months following the date of the birth of your child. Your medical practitioner or midwife must say in writing that you are pregnant and the expected date of delivery. There may be fees to get this document and ministry will not cover those fees.
- [Nutritional Supplements](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/nutritional-supplements) (short-term) provides products such as Ensure or Boost for a three-month period. Your doctor must say in writing that you need this supplement to prevent critical weight loss while recovering from surgery, a severe injury, a serious disease, or side effects of medical treatment. Your doctor must also provide a written prescription
- [Nutritional Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/monthly-nutritional-supplement) (monthly) of $165 per month for food and $40 per month for vitamins or minerals. To apply, ask the ministry for application form HR2847. Review and sign Part B, and have a health professional complete and sign Part C. Here is a [Sample form: Application for Monthly Nutritional Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/british-columbians-our-governments/policies-for-government/bc-employment-assistance-policy-procedure-manual/forms/pdfs/hr2847.pdf). For help on how to apply and a letter to give to your health practitioner, use the [Monthly Nutritional Supplement (MNS) help sheet](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs4/).
- [Tube Feed Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/health-supplements-and-programs/tube-feed-supplement) provides liquid nutrition products, equipment, and supplies to those who cannot take food by mouth or process it through the gastrointestinal system. Your doctor must say in writing that your main source of nutrition must be through tube feeding. Your doctor must also provide a written prescription.

## Other ministry benefits

- [Crisis Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/general-supplements-and-programs/crisis-supplement?keyword=crisis&keyword=supplement) provides a one-time payment to those who face emergency needs. The supplement covers up to $40 for food per person per month, $100 for clothing per person per year, and the cost of shelter. Shelter support depends on family size and has a maximum.
- [Annual earnings exemption](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/family-social-supports/services-for-people-with-disabilities/disability-assistance/on-disability-assistance/annual-earnings-exemption)
- [Christmas Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/general-supplements-and-programs/christmas-supplement?keyword=christmas&keyword=supplement)
- [Guide Animal Supplement](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/bc-employment-and-assistance-rate-tables/general-supplements-and-programs-rate-table?keyword=guide&keyword=animal&keyword=supplement)
- [Moving, transportation, and living costs](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/general-supplements-and-programs/moving-transportation-and-living-costs?keyword=moving&keyword=costs)

## Additional benefits for Indigenous people 

- [Monthly Nutritional Supplement](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/bcands-monthly-nutritional-supplement-mns-client-bsdw-forms/) provides additional financial support to people who have PWD status and have special nutritional needs. Learn more from the [MNS information card](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/wp-content/uploads/MNS-Card-1.pdf) and [Monthly Nutritional Supplement Application instructions](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/wp-content/uploads/MNS-Application-Instructions-1.pdf).
- [Support for Indigenous Student Learning Program](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/isslp/) is a time-limited project for Indigenous students across Canada who have limited financial resources, including students living with disabilities.
- [Indigenous Employment Engagement Program](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/indigenous-employment-engagement-program/)

## More information on benefits:

Disability Alliance BCs [Checklist for Persons with Disabilities (PWD) Benefit help sheet](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs3/)

Disability Alliance BCs [HS10 | People with Disabilities on Reserve: The PWD Designation | DABC (disabilityalliancebc.org)](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs10/)

Disability Alliance BCs [Health Supplements for People with Disabilities help sheet](https://disabilityalliancebc.org/hs7/)

BCANDSs [BCANDS Persons with Disabilities (PWD) Client / BSDW Forms](http://www.bcands.bc.ca/bcands-persons-with-disabilities-pwd-program-2/)

Government of British Columbias [Health Supplements & Programs Rate Table](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/policies-for-government/bcea-policy-and-procedure-manual/bc-employment-and-assistance-rate-tables/health-supplements-and-programs-rate-table) lists the allowances of each supplement.
