content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to decide how you will apply for the AISH benefits

To decide if you will apply for the AISH, you can complete the brief questionnaire at [Is AISH right for you?](https://aish.alberta.ca/prescreen)

To complete your application for AISH benefits, you can download and fill out a [PDF application for AISH](https://www.alberta.ca/aish-how-to-apply.aspx) or you can complete the [online application](https://aish.alberta.ca/main). Once you have decided which method you will use, you can begin your application.

Pour complter votre demande de prestations du RAPGH, vous pouvez tlcharger et remplir un [Formulaire PDF de demande de RAPGH](https://www.alberta.ca/aish-how-to-apply.aspx) ou vous pouvez remplir une [demande en ligne](https://aish.alberta.ca/main). Une fois que vous avez dcid de la mthode que vous allez utiliser, vous pouvez commencer votre demande.

If you chose to complete the online application, follow the instructions carefully to ensure you have submitted your completed application and all necessary documentation.

If you chose to complete the PDF document, you can mail or fax your information to:

Fax: 1-877-969-3306  
Mail: AISH, PO Box 17000 Station Main, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 4B3

After you complete and submit your application, if additional information is required, an AISH staff member will contact you. If you have questions or want an update on the status of your application, you can call one of the following numbers:

- Alberta, toll free: [1877759-6810](tel:18777596810)

If you application is approved, you will receive a phone call and a letter that confirms that you are eligible to receive AISH benefits.

title.en-CA: Has the AISH Application  Medical Report form been submitted?
title.fr-CA: Le formulaire de demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical a-t-il t soumis?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to ensure the AISH Application  Medical Report form is submitted

As part of your AISH Application, your physician will need to complete the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). This report will include:

- Your basic information
- Your physicians relationship to you
- Your diagnosis(es) and relevant details about the diagnosis(es)
- Your medical history
- Your degree of impairment
- Your medications, if applicable
- Your treatment, if applicable
- Your prognosis
- Any additional comments or information
- Your physicians certification

### Submitting the Medical Report

If your doctor has provided the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf) to you, you can submit it with your online application. Your doctor can also submit your medical report by fax or mail to the following address:

Fax: 1-877-969-3306  

Mail: AISH, PO Box 17000 Station Main, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 4B3

If there is a charge to have your physician complete the Medical Report, you are responsible for paying it. If you are currently receiving Income Support, you may be eligible to have the cost covered. You can contact your Income Support worker to see if you are eligible to have this cost covered.

### Unique Situations

There are some unique situations that will not require you to complete the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). If you are in one of the following situations, you may be required to provide more specific medical documentation instead.

### End-of-Life or Palliative Care

If you are receiving end-of-life palliative care or have been diagnosed with a terminal illness, you will not need to provide the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Instead, you will need to provide medical documentation that shows you have a terminal illness or are receiving palliative care.

### Long-Term Care or Designated Supportive Living

If you were assessed as needing long-term care or designated supportive living, you will not need to provide the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Instead, you will need to provide medical documentation that shows you need long-term care or designated supportive living.

### Applied for Persons with Developmental Disabilities (PDD) Program

If you applied for the Persons with Developmental Disabilities (PDD) program, you will not need to provide the [AISH Application  Medical Report](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf) unless you are contacted by an AISH worker.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour assurer la soumission du formulaire de demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical

Dans le cadre de votre demande de RAPGH, votre mdecin devra remplir le formulaire de [demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Ce rapport comprendra:

- Vos renseignements de base
- Le lien entre votre mdecin et vous
- Votre (vos) diagnostic(s) ainsi que les dtails pertinents concernant le(s) diagnostic(s)
- Vos antcdents mdicaux
- Votre degr de dficience
- Vos mdicaments, le cas chant
- Votre traitement, le cas chant
- Votre pronostic
- Tout commentaire ou information supplmentaire
- Le certificat de votre mdecin

### Soumettre le rapport mdical

Si votre mdecin a fourni le formulaire de [demande de RAPGH - Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf), vous pouvez le soumettre avec votre demande en ligne. Votre mdecin peut galement envoyer votre rapport mdical par tlcopieur ou par la poste  ladresse suivante:  
Tlcopieur: 1877969-3306  
Adresse postale: RAPGH, Case postale17000, Station Main, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 4B3

Sil y a des frais pour que votre mdecin remplisse le rapport mdical, vous tes responsable de leur paiement. Si vous bnficiez actuellement dun soutien au revenu, vous avez peut-tre droit  une prise en charge des cots. Vous pouvez contacter votre agent de soutien au revenu pour savoir si vous avez droit  la prise en charge de ces frais.

### Situations uniques

Dans certaines situations uniques, vous naurez pas  remplir le formulaire de [demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Si vous tes dans lune des situations suivantes, il se peut que vous deviez fournir des documents mdicaux plus spcifiques  la place.  

### Soins palliatifs de fin de vie

Si vous recevez des soins palliatifs de fin de vie ou si lon vous a diagnostiqu une maladie en phase terminale, vous naurez pas  fournir le formulaire de [demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Au lieu de cela, vous devrez fournir des documents mdicaux montrant que vous souffrez dune maladie en phase terminale ou que vous recevez des soins palliatifs.

### Soins de longue dure ou hbergement supervis dsign

Si vous avez t valu comme ayant besoin de soins de longue dure ou dun hbergement supervis dsign, vous navez pas besoin de fournir la [demande de RAPGH  Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf). Au lieu de cela, vous devrez fournir des documents mdicaux montrant que vous avez besoin de soins de longue dure ou dun hbergement supervis dsign.

### Demande de participation au programme pour les personnes souffrant de troubles du dveloppement (PDD)

Si vous avez fait une demande pour le programme pour les personnes souffrant de troubles du dveloppement (PDD), vous naurez pas besoin de fournir la [demande de RAPGH - Rapport mdical](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444bPrint.pdf)  moins que vous ne soyez contact par un agent du RAPGH.

title.en-CA: Have you completed the AISH Application  General Information form or the online application?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rempli le formulaire de demande de RAPGH  Information gnrale ou la demande en ligne?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to complete the AISH Application  General Information form or the online application

Remember, you have the option to fill out the [PDF application for AISH](https://www.alberta.ca/aish-how-to-apply.aspx) or the [online application](https://aish.alberta.ca/main) to complete this portion of the AISH application.

This section of the application will ask you questions about some of the following information:

- Your personal information (example: you name, date of birth, address)
- Your spouses information (if applicable)
- Information about any dependent children you have
- If you have a trustee or power of attorney
- Employment history
- Education or training history
- Income
- Assets

Make sure to provide the most accurate information possible. If you need to collect more information or take a break, you can save your online application and exit at any point and return at a later date.

### Completing Your Application in Unique Situations

There are some cases where you will not be required to complete the entire application or you may need to provide additional documentation. See below for a list of unique situations that may impact how you complete your application. If none of these situations apply to you, you should complete all sections of the [PDF application](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444A) for AISH or the [online application](https://aish.alberta.ca/prescreen).

### End-of-Life Palliative Care or Terminal Illness

If you are receiving end-of-life palliative care or have been diagnosed with a terminal illness, you can skip Section 5: Employment History and Section 6: Education and Training History. You will also need to provide medical documentation that shows you have a terminal illness or are receiving palliative care. This medical documentation will replace the Medical Report described in Step 3.

### Long-Term Care or Designated Supportive Living

If you require long-term care or designated supportive living, you can skip Section 5: Employment History and Section 6: Education and Training History. You will also need to provide medical documentation that shows you need to live in a long-term care facility or a designated supportive living facility. This medical documentation will replace the Medical Report described in Step 3.

### Currently Receiving Income Support Benefits

If you are currently receiving income support benefits from Alberta Works, you will not need to provide your financial information again. This means you can skip Section 7: Income Information and Section 8: Asset Information.

### Applied for Persons with Developmental Disabilities (PDD) Program

If you have applied for the Persons with Developmental Disabilities (PDD) program, you will not need to have the Medical Report explained in Step 3 completed unless you are contacted by a AISH worker.

### Left the AISH Program Less than Two Years Ago

If you left the AISH program less than two years ago, you should contact an [AISH office](https://www.alberta.ca/contact-aish.aspx) to see which sections of the application you will need to complete.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour remplir le formulaire de demande de RAPGH - Information gnrale ou la demande en ligne

Noubliez pas que vous avez la possibilit de remplir le [formulaire PDF de demande de RAPGH](https://www.alberta.ca/aish-how-to-apply.aspx) ou une [demande en ligne](https://aish.alberta.ca/main) pour remplir cette partie de la demande de RAPGH.

Cette section de la demande vous posera des questions sur certains renseignements:

- Vos renseignements personnels (exemple: votre nom, votre date de naissance, votre adresse)
- Information sur votre conjoint (le cas chant)
- Information sur les enfants  charge que vous avez
- Si vous avez un fiduciaire ou une procuration
- Antcdents professionnels
- Historique de lducation ou de la formation
- Revenu
- Actifs

Veillez  fournir de linformation aussi prcise que possible. Si vous avez besoin de recueillir davantage de renseignements ou de faire une pause, vous pouvez sauvegarder votre demande en ligne, quitter  tout moment et revenir  une date ultrieure.

### Remplir votre demande dans des situations uniques

Dans certains cas, vous ne serez pas tenu de remplir la totalit du formulaire ou vous devrez fournir des documents supplmentaires. Vous trouverez ci-dessous une liste de situations uniques qui peuvent avoir des rpercussions sur la manire de remplir votre demande. Si aucune de ces situations ne sapplique  vous, vous devez remplir toutes les sections du [formulaire PDF de demande RAPGH](https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/form/DS2444A) ou de la [demande en ligne](https://aish.alberta.ca/prescreen).

### Soins palliatifs de fin de vie ou maladie en phase terminale 

Si vous recevez des soins palliatifs de fin de vie ou si on vous a diagnostiqu une maladie en phase terminale, vous pouvez sauter la section5: Antcdents professionnels et section6: Historique de lducation et de la formation Vous devrez galement fournir des documents mdicaux attestant que vous souffrez dune maladie en phase terminale ou que vous recevez des soins palliatifs. Cette documentation mdicale remplacera le rapport mdical dcrit  ltape3.

### Soins de longue dure ou hbergement supervis dsign

Si vous avez besoin de soins de longue dure ou dun hbergement supervis dsign, vous pouvez sauter la section5: Antcdents professionnels et section6: Historique de lducation et de la formation Vous devrez galement fournir des documents mdicaux montrant que vous avez besoin de vivre dans un tablissement de soins de longue dure ou dans un tablissement dhbergement supervis dsign. Cette documentation mdicale remplacera le rapport mdical dcrit  ltape3.

### Recevoir actuellement des prestations de soutien au revenu

Si vous recevez actuellement des prestations de soutien au revenu dAlberta Works, vous naurez pas  fournir de nouveau vos renseignements financiers. Cela signifie que vous pouvez sauter la section7: Information sur les revenus et Section8: Information sur les actifs.

### Demande de participation au programme pour les personnes souffrant de troubles du dveloppement (PDD)

Si vous avez fait une demande pour le programme pour les personnes souffrant de troubles du dveloppement (PDD), vous naurez pas besoin de faire remplir le rapport mdical expliqu  ltape3, sauf si vous tes contact par un agent du RAPGH.

### A quitt le programme de RAPGH il y a moins de deux ans

Si vous avez quitt le programme de RAPGH depuis moins de deux ans, vous devriez contacter un [Bureau de RAPGH](https://www.alberta.ca/contact-aish.aspx) pour voir quelles sections du formulaire vous devrez remplir.

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in Ontario and who meet the necessary age, financial, and medical eligibility requirements may be eligible for the Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP). The ODSP provides financial assistance to those who qualify.

Each step involved in the application process for the ODSP will be described in detail in this guide. You can leave the site and come back later when you have more time, energy, and the documents you may need in a step.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes en situation de handicap qui vivent en Ontario et qui rpondent aux critres dadmissibilit relatifs  lge,  la situation financire,  ltat de sant et  la capacit de travailler peuvent tre admissibles au Programme ontarien de soutien aux personnes handicapes (POSPH). Le POSPH fournit une aide financire aux personnes admissibles.

Chaque tape du processus de demande du POSPH sera dcrite en dtail dans ce guide. Vous pouvez quitter le site et y revenir plus tard lorsque vous aurez plus de temps, dnergie et les documents dont vous pourriez avoir besoin  une tape.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved for the Ontario Disability Support Program (OSPD)

- You will get up to $1,308 per month for a single person without dependents
- You may qualify for additional benefits such as money for transportation to medical appointments
- You may qualify for health benefits including prescription drugs and vision care
- You may receive employment support

### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

If you are Indigenous, you can apply for the ODSP. As with non-Indigenous persons, you are required to apply for any other benefits you may be eligible for, such as benefits from the federal government.

### I am in a prescribed class. Is the journey different for me?

People who belong to a prescribed class can skip some steps involved with the process of applying for ODSP. If you belong to one of these groups, you will not need to complete the disability determination package (DDP). When you reach that step, you will be instructed to skip it if you belong to a prescribed class.

Members of prescribed class include people who:

- Receive benefits under theFamily Benefits Act, 1992
- Receive the Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPP-D)
- Receive the Quebec Pension Plan Disability (QPP-D)
- Are 65+ years old and who are not eligible for Old Age Security (OAS)
- Receive awards under theEnglish and Wabigoon River Systems Mercury Contamination Settlement Agreement Act, 1986
- Were a resident of a Schedule 1 facility under the formerDevelopment Service Act(DSA), who ceased to be resident of that facility on or after June 1, 1998
- Receive services, supports, and funding under the[Services and Supports to Promote the Social Inclusion of Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act, 2008](https://www.ontario.ca/laws/statute/08s14)(SIPDDA)
- Currently lives in a[home under theHomes for Special Care Act](http://www.connexontario.ca/)
- Lived in a [home under theHomes for Special Care Act](http://www.connexontario.ca/) on or after January 1, 2018, but has since left that home
- Lives or used to live in a home that is part of the Community Homes for Opportunity program
- Currently live in:
  - A facility that was a Provincial Psychiatric Hospital
  - The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (in Toronto)
  - The Homewood Health Centre (in Guelph)

content3.en-CA:
### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

If you are Indigenous, you can apply for the ODSP. As with non-Indigenous persons, you are required to apply for any other benefits you may be eligible for, such as benefits from the federal government.

### I am in a prescribed class. Is the journey different for me?

People who belong to other groups can skip some steps involved with the process of applying for ODSP. Members of prescribed class includes people who:

- Receive benefits under theFamily Benefits Act, 1992
- Receive the Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPP-D)
- Receive the Quebec Pension Plan Disability (QPP-D)
- Are 65+ years old and who are not eligible for Old Age Security (OAS)
- Receive awards under theEnglish and Wabigoon River Systems Mercury Contamination Settlement Agreement Act, 1986
- Were a resident of a Schedule 1 facility under the formerDevelopment Service Act(DSA), who ceased to be resident of that facility on or after June 1, 1998
- Receive services, supports, and funding under the[Services and Supports to Promote the Social Inclusion of Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act, 2008](https://www.ontario.ca/laws/statute/08s14)(SIPDDA)
- Currently lives in a[home under theHomes for Special Care Act](https://www.connexontario.ca/en-ca/)
- Lived in a [home under theHomes for Special Care Act](http://www.connexontario.ca/) on or after January 1, 2018, but has since left that home
- Lives or used to live in a home that is part of the Community Homes for Opportunity program
- Currently live in:
  - A facility that was a Provincial Psychiatric Hospital
  - The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (in Toronto)
  - The Homewood Health Centre (in Guelph)

If you belong to one of these groups, you will not need to complete the disability determination package (DDP). When you reach that step, you will be instructed to skip it if you belong to a prescribed class.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

To receive ODSP you must be above the age of 18. If you are about to turn 18, there must be no more than six months between the day you start your application and the day you turn 18.

## Financial requirements

To be eligible to receive ODSP, you must meet the financial requirements. This will involve assessing your income, assets, current living expenses, and if you have any additional family members.

## Income

Income can come from a variety of sources. You must report all types of income. Some sources of income include:

- Employment
- Tax benefits
- Canada Pension Plan (CPP) or Qubec Pension Plan (QPP) benefits
- Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) benefits
- Profit from a farm or business, including self-employment
- Spousal support
- Sponsorship support
- Guaranteed Annual Income Supplement (GAINS)
- Old Age Security (OAS) and Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS)
- Employment Insurance (EI)
- Other government programs
- Loans

## Exempt Income

Some types of income do not impact your eligibility towards receiving ODSP. These types of income are called Exempt Income. Even if they will not impact your eligibility to receive ODSP, you still need to report all types of income. Exempt Income includes:

- Child support
- Certain federal tax benefits, like the Canada Child Tax Benefit
- Certain provincial tax benefits, like the Ontario Child Benefit
- Payments from a Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP)
- Ontario Student Assistance Program (OSAP) loans and grants used for education costs

## Assets

In addition to reporting all forms of income you receive, you must report all forms of assets you own. Generally, you can have up to $40,000 is assets, not including Exempt Assets. However, there are some circumstances where you can get approval to save money and/or assets above the general limit. One example is if you are saving for an item that would support your health or disability. If you are in this situation, you can discuss your options with your ODSP caseworker.  

Assets can include things such as:

- Cash
- Money you have in bank accounts
- Stocks and bonds
- Registered Retirement Savings Plans (RRSP)
- Vehicles
- Property (for example, land or a house)
- Trust funds

## Exempt Assets

Specific types of assets will not impact your ability to receive ODSP. These assets are called Exempt Assets. Even if they will not impact your eligibility to receive ODSP, you still need to report all assets.

Exempt Assets include things such as: 

- The home you own and live in
- Your primary vehicle (the one you use the most, if you have more than one)
- Trust funds derived from an inheritance or life insurance policy, up to allowable limits
- The cash surrender value of life insurance policies, up to allowable limits
- Pre-paid funerals
- Registered Education Savings Plans (RESP)
- Registered Disability Savings Plans (RDSP)
- Necessary household and personal items, such as furniture and clothing

## Gifts and Voluntary Payments

Each year, you can receive up to $10,000 in gifts and voluntary payments without it impacting your eligibility to receive ODSP.

Gifts and voluntary payments include money received through:

- Gifts
- Payments from trusts
- Payments from life insurance
- Inheritances
- Honorariums
- Windfalls, such as lottery winnings

## Other Financial Exemptions

Some specific types of income and assets can be exempt from impacting your eligibility to receive ODSP. This includes:

- Up to $100,000 of the cash surrender value of a life insurance policy. A cash surrender value is the money the insurance company pays you if your policy is terminated or cancelled early.
- Dividends or interest earned on a life insurance policy that are reinvested into the policy
- Money held in a trust for you or your family member.

Determining whether these types of income and assets will be impact your eligibility to receive ODSP can be complicated and often depends on other sources of income or assets you have. You should discuss all types of income or assets with your ODSP caseworker to ensure you are still eligible to receive ODSP.

## Medical Eligibility

In order to be eligible to receive ODSP, you must qualify as a person with a disability. To qualify as a person with a disability, you must meet the following criteria:

- You have a substantial mental and/or physical impairment that is continuous or recurrent
- Your impairment must be expected to last one year or more
- Your impairment results in a substantial restriction in your ability to work, care for yourself, or take part in community life
- Your impairment, the duration of your impairment, and the restrictions due to your impairment must be verified by an approved health care professional

## Ability to work	 

If you qualify as a person with a disability, you will not be required to look for work while receiving ODSP if your disability prevents you from being able to find and keep employment. You will be required to find other sources of income and apply for any sources you are eligible for. This includes:

- The Ontario Child Benefit
- Support from a sponsor or co-signer
- Canada Pension Plan (CPP)
- Employment Insurance (EI) benefits
- Worker Safety and Insurance Benefits (WSIB)

## Adult Family Members Work Requirements

If you have adult family members who are living with you, they will be required to participate in activities that will prepare them to find employment. Employment services can assist your family member(s) find appropriate programs to prepare to find a job or to find a job with the skills they currently have. This could include:

- Placing your family member(s) in a paid job
- Working with your family member(s) and their current employer to make sure their current job is a good fit
- Helping your family member(s) resolve any problems or conflict they have with their employer or co-worker
- Helping your family member(s) become self-employed

## Reporting Income

If you or your member(s) are working, you will need to report the amount you earn each month. You can do this by:

- Reporting it online using [MyBenefits](https://mybenefits.mcss.gov.on.ca/auth/login?lang=en-CA)
- Phoning the [Interactive Voice Response (IVR)](https://www.ontario.ca/page/interactive-voice-response-ivr-system-social-assistance-clients)
- Filling out the Employment/Training Income Report form you will receive with you ODSP cheque

title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs votre demande  approuve ou refuse

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Congratulations, you are eligible to receive ODSP! You will be contacted by a caseworker, who will schedule an appointment with you to develop a plan of how best to help you. You will also be informed of when you can expect your first payment. You will also be required to meet with ODSP staff occasionally while you are receiving support from ODSP.

Based on your financial and health needs, it will be determined which benefits you qualify for. Once you are approved for ODSP you could receive:

- Up to $1,308 per month for a single person without dependents
- Additional benefits such as money for transportation to medical appointments
- Health benefits including prescription drugs and vision care
- Employment support

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

You and your family members may be eligible for additional supports once you are approved for ODSP. Your caseworker will help you determine if you meet the necessary criteria. Some of the possible additional benefits include:

- Prescription drug coverage
- Dental coverage
- Vision coverage and glasses
- Mandatory Special Necessities Benefit
- Transportation for medical appointments and treatment
- Pregnancy and Breastfeeding Nutritional Allowance
- Coverage for assistive devices
- Hearing aids and devices
- Batteries and repairs for mobility devices
- [Special Diet Allowance](https://www.ontario.ca/document/ontario-disability-support-program-policy-directives-income-support/64-special-diet)
- Guide Dog benefit
- Health benefits for people leaving ODSP
- Extended Health Benefit (if you are no longer eligible for ODSP but still have high health costs)
- Transitional Health Benefit (if you have a job, dont qualify for the Extended Health Benefit, and do not receive health benefits from your employer)

For complete details on these additional benefits, you can see the [detailed list of the Ontario Disability Support Program health and disability benefits](https://www.ontario.ca/page/ontario-disability-support-program-health-and-disability-benefits).

You may also be eligible for a [Special diet allowance](https://www.ontario.ca/document/ontario-disability-support-program-policy-directives-income-support/64-special-diet) if you have a medical condition that requires you to eat specific foods and that has been confirmed by a health care professional. This allowance can be up to $250 per month.

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

To make sure you are receiving the correct amount you are eligible for, it is important to keep your information up-to-date and report any changes that could impact your eligibility for ODSP. This includes reporting changes such as:

- If you move or there are changes to your living arrangements
- There are changes to the cost of your housing
- There are changes in your family arrangement such as having an additional family member living with you
- You start a job or start attending post-secondary school
- You or one of your family members are admitted to a medical institution such as a hospital or rehabilitation facility
- You or one of your family members is detained in custody
- There is a change in your income
- You or one of your family members will be leaving Ontario for more than 30 days (approximately a month)

### Reporting Changes

There are a number of ways you can report changes to your situation to ensure you receive the correct support from ODSP. For each option, you will need your nine-digit member ID, which you will receive when you approved for ODSP and will be on your monthly statements. Your options to report changes include:

- Online through [MyBenefits](https://mybenefits.mcss.gov.on.ca/auth/login?lang=en-CA)
- By phoning your [local ODSP office](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca/?lang=en)
- By mailing your [local ODSP office](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca/?lang=en)

### Repaying Overpayments

If you receive an overpayment, you will be responsible for repaying it. If you are still receiving financial assistance from ODSP, deductions will be made from your monthly income support until your overpayment is paid in full. If you are no longer receiving financial assistance from ODSP, arrangements will be made for you to pay back the amount you owe.

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse?

content3.en-CA:
Your application to receive ODSP may be denied for a variety of reasons. If you disagree with a decision on your case, you may consider asking for an internal review. If you disagree with the Internal Review decision, you also have the option to appeal the decision to the Social Benefits Tribunal.

### Internal Reviews

To request an internal review of your ODSP, you can fill out and submit the [Request for Internal Review form](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/en/dataset/006-2878).  You can choose to write a letter instead, with the following information:

- Your name
- Your member ID number (the number that is on the letter you received fromODSP)
- Your date of birth (day, month, year)
- The reason why you are asking for a review
- If you requesting an internal review because your disability did not qualify under ODSP, include any information you think would help with your request
- Any additional information or documents that you think will help the review.

Please note that this request should be submitted within 30 days of the decision about your case. Otherwise you will need to provide a reason that your request was late that was beyond your control.

### Submitting an Internal Review

Once you have completed the [Request for Internal Review form](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/en/dataset/006-2878), you must mail, fax, or email it to your local office. If you re requesting a review of a decision about your financial eligibility, you can send your completed form or letter to your [local ODSP office](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca).

If you are asking for a review of a decision about your disability status, you must send your completed form or letter to the Disability Adjudication Unit at the address below:

Ontario Disability Support Program  
Disability Adjudication Unit  
Ministry of Children, Community and Social Services  
P.O. Box B18  
Toronto, Ontario  
M7A 1R3  
Fax:416-326-3374

Once you send your request for an Internal Review, you will receive a letter of the results of the Internal Review within 30 days.

### Cancelling an Internal Review

You can cancel an internal review at any point before you receive your decision. Please note, if you cancel an Internal Review, you cannot appeal the same decision to the Social Benefits Tribunal at a later date.

If you want to cancel an internal review, you can either fill out the [Request for a Withdrawal of Internal Review form](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/en/dataset/006-2879) or write a letter including the following information:

- Your name
- Request to cancel your Internal Review
- Member ID number (this is the number that is on your benefit statement or the letter you received fromODSPor Ontario Works)
- Date of birth (day, month, year)

If you are cancelling an Internal Review of a financial decision, you can submit your request to your [local ODSP office](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca).

If you are cancelling an Internal Review of a decision about your disability status, you must send your completed form or letter to the Disability Adjudication Unit at the address below:

Ontario Disability Support Program  
Disability Adjudication Unit  
Ministry of Children, Community and Social Services  
P.O. Box B18  
Toronto, Ontario  
M7A 1R3  
Fax:416-326-3374

### Appealing to the Social Benefits Tribunal

The Social Benefits Tribunal is separate from the ODSP office and may be able to appeal decisions about your application to receive ODSP. You may be able to request an appeal to the Social Benefits Tribunal if you:

- Disagree with a decision made through an Internal Review
- Havent received a decision from an Internal Review within 30 days of your request

Not all decisions can be appealed to the Social Benefits Tribunal. To determine if a decision can be appealed to the Social Benefits Tribunal, check the letter you received about the decision from the Internal Review.

Please note, you must request an appeal of a decision made by the Internal Review within 30 days of when you received the decision.

### Requesting an Appeal to the Social Benefits Tribunal

To request an appeal through the Social Benefits Tribunal, you will need to complete an Appeal Form. You can get an Appeal Form from your [local ODSP office](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca) or the [Social Benefits Tribunal](https://tribunalsontario.ca/sbt/). Once your form is completed, you can mail or fax it to:

Social Benefits Tribunal  
15 Grosvenor Street, Ground Floor  
Toronto, Ontario  
M7A 2G6  
Fax:416-326-5135

### Appeals to the Social Benefits Tribunal Process

If you request an appeal, the Social Benefits Tribunal will schedule a hearing. During the hearing, you can explain why you disagree with the decision made. A representation from ODSP office that made the decision may be there to explain why the decision was made. A member of the Social Benefits Tribunal will listen to both sides to make a decision.

If you have questions, or need help filling out the form, you can contact the[Social Benefits Tribunal](https://tribunalsontario.ca/sbt/contact/).

If you would like advice from a community legal clinic, you can contact[Legal Aid Ontario](https://www.legalaid.on.ca/).

### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:     | Then take this step:     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.       | Wait until you are 17   years old and reapply.       |
| You do not meet the financial requirements         | Wait until your financial situation changes and reapply.          |
| You do not meet the criteria to be qualified as a person with a disability        | Request that your health professional provide additional information about how your disability impacts your functioning and ability to work, then reapply.         |
content3.fr-CA:
Votre demande dinscription au POSPH peut tre refuse pour diverses raisons. Si vous ntes pas daccord avec une dcision concernant votre cas, vous pouvez envisager de demander une rvision interne. Si vous ntes pas daccord avec la dcision de la rvision interne, vous avez galement la possibilit de faire appel de la dcision auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale.

### Rvision interne

Pour demander une rvision interne de votre demande pour le POSPH, vous pouvez remplir et [soumettre le formulaire de demande de rvision interne](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/fr/dataset/006-2878). Vous pouvez choisir dcrire une lettre  la place, avec les renseignements suivants :

- votre nom;
- votre numro didentification de membre (le numro qui figure sur la lettre que vous avez reue du POSPH);
- votre date de naissance (jour, mois, anne);
- la raison pour laquelle vous demandez une rvision;
- si vous demandez une rvision interne parce que votre handicap nest pas admissible au titre du POSPH, incluez tout renseignement qui, selon vous, pourrait vous aider dans votre demande;
- tout renseignement ou document supplmentaire qui, selon vous, pourrait faciliter la rvision.

Veuillez noter que cette demande doit tre soumise dans les 30 jours suivant la dcision concernant votre cas. Sinon, vous devrez fournir une raison indpendante de votre volont pour expliquer le retard de votre demande.

### Soumettre une demande de rvision interne

Lorsque vous avez rempli le [formulaire de demande de rvision interne](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/fr/dataset/006-2878), vous devez lenvoyer par la poste, par tlcopieur ou par courriel  votre bureau local. Si vous demandez la rvision dune dcision concernant votre admissibilit financire, vous pouvez envoyer votre formulaire ou votre lettre dment rempli  votre [bureau local du POSPH](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca/?lang=fr).

Si vous demandez la rvision dune dcision concernant votre statut dinvalidit, vous devez envoyer votre formulaire ou lettre dment rempli  lUnit des dcisions sur ladmissibilit des personnes handicapes  ladresse ci-dessous :

Programme ontarien de soutien aux personnes handicapes  
Unit des dcisions sur ladmissibilit des personnes handicapes  
Ministre des Services  lenfance et des Services sociaux et communautaires  
C.P. B18  
Toronto (Ontario)  
M7A 1R3  
Tlcopieur :416-326-3374

Une fois que vous aurez envoy votre demande de rvision interne, vous recevrez une lettre indiquant les rsultats de la rvision interne dans les 30 jours.

### Annuler une rvision interne

Vous pouvez annuler une demande de rvision interne  tout moment avant de recevoir votre dcision. Veuillez noter que si vous annulez une demande de rvision interne, vous ne pourrez pas faire appel de la mme dcision auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale par la suite.

Si vous souhaitez annuler une rvision interne, vous pouvez soit remplir le [formulaire de demande de retrait de la demande de rvision interne](https://forms.mgcs.gov.on.ca/fr/dataset/006-2879), soit crire une lettre incluant les renseignements suivants :

- votre nom;
- la demande dannulation de votre rvision interne;
- le numro didentification du membre (il sagit du numro qui figure sur votre relev de prestations ou sur la lettre que vous avez reue du POSPH ou dOntario au travail);
- votre date de naissance (jour, mois, anne).

Si vous annulez une demande de rvision interne dune dcision financire, vous pouvez soumettre votre demande  votre [bureau local du POSPH](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca/?lang=fr).

Si vous annulez une demande de rvision interne d'une dcision concernant votre statut d'invalidit, vous devez envoyer votre formulaire ou votre lettre dment rempli  lUnit des dcisions sur ladmissibilit des personnes handicapes  ladresse ci-dessous :

Programme ontarien de soutien aux personnes handicapes  
Unit des dcisions sur ladmissibilit des personnes handicapes  
Ministre des Services  lenfance et des Services sociaux et communautaires  
C.P. B18  
Toronto (Ontario)  
M7A 1R3  
Tlcopieur :416-326-3374

### Appels auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale

Le Tribunal de laide sociale est distinct du bureau du POSPH et peut tre en mesure de faire appel des dcisions concernant votre demande de prestation au POSPH. Vous pouvez faire appel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale si :

- vous tes en dsaccord avec une dcision prise dans le cadre dune rvision interne;
- vous navez pas reu de dcision  la suite dune demande de rvision interne dans les 30 jours suivant votre demande.

Toutes les dcisions ne peuvent pas faire lobjet dun appel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale. Pour dterminer si une dcision peut faire lobjet dun appel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale, vrifiez la lettre que vous avez reue au sujet de la dcision de la rvision interne.

Veuillez noter que vous devez faire appel dune dcision prise par la rvision interne dans les 30 jours suivant la rception de la dcision.

### Demande dappel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale

Pour faire une demande dappel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale, vous devez remplir un formulaire dappel. Vous pouvez obtenir un formulaire dappel auprs de votre [bureau local du POSPH](http://www.officelocator.mcss.gov.on.ca/?lang=fr) ou du Tribunal de laide sociale. Une fois le formulaire rempli, vous pouvez lenvoyer par la poste ou par tlcopieur  ladresse suivante :

Tribunal de laide sociale  
15, rue Grosvenor, rez-de-chausse  
Toronto (Ontario)  
M7A 2G6  
Tlcopieur :416-326-5135

### Processus dappel auprs du Tribunal de laide sociale

Si vous demandez un appel, le tribunal des prestations sociales fixera une audience. Au cours de laudience, vous pourrez expliquer pourquoi vous ntes pas daccord avec la dcision prise. Un reprsentant du bureau du POSPH qui a pris la dcision peut tre prsent pour expliquer pourquoi la dcision a t prise. Un membre du Tribunal de laide sociale coutera les deux parties pour prendre une dcision.

Si vous avez des questions ou si vous avez besoin daide pour remplir le formulaire, vous pouvez contacter le Tribunal de laide sociale.

Si vous souhaitez obtenir des conseils auprs dune clinique juridique communautaire, vous pouvez contacterAide juridique Ontario.

### Choisir la meilleure option en cas de refus

Voici quelques raisons frquentes pour lesquelles les gens se voient refuser ainsi que des conseils sur la prochaine tape  suivre :

| Si votre demande a t refuse parce que :     | Alors, faites cette dmarche :     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| Vous navez pas lge requis.       | Attendez davoir 17  ans pour refaire une demande.       |
| Vous ne remplissez pas les conditions financires.       | Attendez que votre situation financire change et refaites une demande.       |
| Vous ne remplissez pas les critres pour tre qualifi de personne handicape.       | Demandez  votre professionnel de la sant de fournir des renseignements supplmentaires sur limpact de votre handicap sur votre fonctionnement et votre capacit  travailler, puis faites une nouvelle demande.      |

title.fr-CA: Questions frquemment poses

content1.en-CA:
## Do members of a prescribed class need to complete the Disability Determination Package (DDP)?

No, if you are a member of a prescribed class you will not need to complete the DDP.

## Do I need to work while I am receiving ODSP?

If you qualify as a person with a disability and your disability prevents you from finding and keeping a job, you will not need to work. However, if you live with adult family members they will need to be employed or engaging in activities that can help them find employment.

## If I receive an overpayment, am I required to repay it?

An overpayment occurs when you receive additional financial assistance that you are not eligible to receive. If you receive an overpayment, you will be required to repay any additional financial support you received.

## How do I prevent an overpayment?

To prevent an overpayment, ensure that you report all forms of income and assets you receive. If there are any changes that would impact your eligibility for ODSP or the amount of financial assistance you receive, ensure that you report the changes as soon as they occur.
content1.fr-CA:
## Les membres dune catgorie prescrite doivent-ils remplir la Trousse de dtermination du handicap (DDH)?

Non, si vous tes membre dune catgorie prescrite, vous navez pas besoin de remplir la Trousse de DDH.

## Dois-je travailler pendant que je reois le POSPH?

Si vous tes considr comme une personne ayant un handicap et que votre handicap vous empche de trouver et de conserver un emploi, vous navez pas besoin de travailler. Toutefois, si vous vivez avec des membres adultes de votre famille, ceux-ci devront avoir un emploi ou participer  des activits susceptibles de les aider  trouver un emploi.

## Si je reois un trop-peru, suis-je tenu de le rembourser?

Un trop-peru se produit lorsque vous recevez une aide financire supplmentaire  laquelle vous navez pas droit. Si vous recevez un trop-peru, vous devrez rembourser laide financire supplmentaire que vous avez reue.

## Comment viter un trop-peru?

Pour viter un trop-peru, assurez-vous de dclarer toutes les formes de revenus et dactifs que vous recevez. Sil y a des changements qui pourraient avoir une incidence sur votre admissibilit au POSPH ou sur le montant de laide financire que vous recevez, assurez-vous de signaler ces changements ds quils se produisent.

content1.en-CA:

- [Liste dtaille des prestations de sant et dinvalidit du Programme ontarien de soutien aux personnes handicapes](https://www.ontario.ca/fr/page/prestations-de-sante-et-dinvalidite-du-programme-ontarien-de-soutien-aux-personnes-handicapees)

title.en-CA: Has ODSP reviewed your disability determination package (DDP)?
title.fr-CA: Le POSPH a-t-il examin votre Trousse de dtermination du handicap (DDH)?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to have ODSP review your disability determination package (DDP)

Specialized staff will review your disability determination package (DDP) to determine if you meet the legislative definition of a person with a disability. You will receive a letter from the Disability Adjudication Unit within 90 business days to let you know if your disability qualified.

If your disability does qualify, it means you meet the disability criteria and can receive ODSP.

If you disability does not qualify, it means you did not meet the disability criteria and you cannot receive ODSP. For information about next steps you can take, see the section titled, After you apply - approved or denied: What happens if your application is denied?.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour que le POSPH examine votre Trousse de dtermination du handicap (DDH)

Un personnel spcialis examinera votre Trousse de dtermination du handicap (DDH) afin de dterminer si vous rpondez  la dfinition lgislative dune personne ayant un handicap. Vous recevrez une lettre de lUnit des dcisions sur ladmissibilit des personnes handicapes dans les 90 jours ouvrables pour vous faire savoir si votre invalidit est admissible.

Si votre handicap est admissible, cela signifie que vous rpondez aux critres dinvalidit et que vous pouvez recevoir le POSPH.

Si votre handicap nest pas admissible, cela signifie que vous ne rpondez pas aux critres dinvalidit et que vous ne pouvez pas recevoir le POSPH. Pour obtenir des renseignements sur les prochaines tapes que vous pouvez entreprendre, consultez la section intitule Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse.

title.en-CA: Have you submitted a disability determination package?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous soumis une Trousse de dtermination du handicap?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to submit a disability determination package

Once you have met the financial eligibility to receive ODSP, you must demonstrate that you meet the criteria to be considered a person with a disability. You will do this by completing the disability determination package (DDP). The DDP will be filled out by a health care professional. A health care professional can be a doctor, a nurse practitioner, or a psychologist.

### Prescribed Classes

Please note, if you belong to a prescribed class, you will not need to complete the DDP. Members of prescribed classes include:

- A person who, on May 31, 1998, was a recipient of benefits under specific case classes under theFamily Benefits Act, 1992
- A person who is 65+ years old and who is not eligible for[Old Age Security](http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/eng/services/pensions/oas/index.shtml) (OAS)
- People who receive [Canada Pension Plan Disability (CPP-D) benefits](http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/eng/services/pensions/cpp/disability/index.shtml)
- People who receive [Quebec Pension Plan Disability (QPP-D) benefit](http://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/programmes/regime_rentes/prestations_invalidite/Pages/prestations_invalidite.aspx)s
- A person who receives an award under theEnglish and Wabigoon River Systems Mercury Contamination Settlement Agreement Act, 1986
- A person who was a resident of a Schedule 1 facility under the formerDevelopment Service Act(DSA), who ceased to be resident of that facility on or after June 1, 1998
- A person who is already determined eligible for services and supports and funding under the[Services and Supports to Promote the Social Inclusion of Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act, 2008](https://www.ontario.ca/laws/statute/08s14)(SIPDDA)
- A person who currently resides in a[home under theHomes for Special Care Act](http://www.connexontario.ca/) or a person who resided in a home under that Act on or after January 1, 2018, but has since left that home
- A resident or former resident of homes that are part of the Community Homes for Opportunity program
- Persons currently residing in:
  - A facility that was a Provincial Psychiatric Hospital
  - The Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (in Toronto)
  - The Homewood Health Centre (in Guelph)

### Included in the Disability Determination Package

The DDP will be provided to you and will include the following sections:

- An instruction sheet with information on who can complete the forms and how to fill them out
- A health status report that asks for information about your medical information. This includes information about your impairment, its restrictions, treatments you are receiving, and the duration of the impairment.
- An activities of daily living index, which asks for information about how your medical condition impacts your daily life. This includes your ability to work, care for yourself, and participate in your community.
- A self report, which gives you the opportunity to describe how your disability impacts your daily life
- A consent form to release your medical information, which you will complete and sign.
- You and your health care professional can submit other documentation you think could provide necessary additional information.

Once the application is completed, it can be sent digitally by your health care professional to the Disability Adjudication Unit or mailed to the Disability Adjudication Unit using the addressed envelope, which will be included in the DDP package.

title.en-CA: Have you met the financial eligibility requirements to receive ODSP?
title.fr-CA: Rpondez-vous aux critres dadmissibilit financire pour recevoir le POSPH?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need if you do not meet the financial eligibility requirements to receive ODSP

If you meet the financial eligibility for receive ODSP, you will be contacted within 15 business days. If you do not meet the financial eligibility to receive ODSP, you will have 30 days to ask ODSP to review your application again. For more details about how to have your application reassessed, see the section titled, After you apply - approved or denied: What happens if your application is denied?
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin si vous ne remplissez pas les critres dadmissibilit financire pour recevoir le POSPH

Si vous rpondez aux critres dadmissibilit financire du POSPH, vous serez contact dans les 15 jours ouvrables. Si vous ne rpondez pas aux critres dadmissibilit financire du POSPH, vous disposerez de 30 jours pour demander au POSPH de rviser votre demande. Pour plus de dtails sur la manire de faire rviser votre demande, consultez la section intitule Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse.

title.en-CA: Have you met with the ODSP office to sign and verify your application?
title.fr-CA: tes-vous all au bureau du POSPH pour signer et vrifier votre demande?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to meet with the ODSP office to sign and verify your application

When your local ODSP office contacts you about your ODSP application, you will schedule an appointment to meet with an intake caseworker for your verification appointment. During the verification appointment, the intake caseworker may ask you to provide more information to verify the information you provided in your online application, such as copies of bills or other types of documentation.

You will also need to sign your application package and complete a consent form. The consent form will allow ODSP to access information about you from other government programs to determine if you qualify to receive ODSP, such as the Ministry of Transportation, or Employment Insurance.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour prendre rendez-vous avec le bureau du POSPH afin de signer et de vrifier votre demande

Lorsque le bureau du POSPH de votre localit vous contactera au sujet de votre demande au POSPH, vous prendrez rendez-vous avec un charg de cas pour une vrification. Pendant le rendez-vous de vrification, le charg de cas peut vous demander de fournir des renseignements supplmentaires pour vrifier les renseignements que vous avez fournis dans votre demande en ligne, comme des copies de factures ou dautres types de documents.

Vous devrez galement signer votre trousse de demande et remplir un formulaire de consentement. Le formulaire de consentement permettra au POSPH daccder  des renseignements  votre sujet provenant dautres programmes gouvernementaux afin de dterminer si vous tes admissible au POSPH, comme le ministre des Transports ou lassurance-emploi.

title.en-CA: Has ODSP reviewed your online application?
title.fr-CA: Le POSPH a-t-il examin votre demande en ligne?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to have ODSP review your online application

Once you submit you submit your online application with all of the required information, ODSP will review your application. Your local ODSP office will call you within 15 business days to schedule an appointment.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour que le POSPH examine votre demande en ligne

Une fois que vous aurez soumis votre demande en ligne avec tous les renseignements requis, le POSPH examinera votre demande. Le bureau du POSPH situ dans votre localit vous appellera dans les 15 jours ouvrables pour prendre un rendez-vous.

title.en-CA: Have you entered the personal information about yourself and your family members into your online application?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous saisi vos renseignements personnels et ceux des membres de votre famille dans votre demande en ligne?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to enter the personal information about yourself and your family members into your online application

For each family member that lives with you, you will need to enter the following information into your online application:

- Their full legal names
- Their date of birth
- Their status in Canada (example: Canadian citizen, permanent resident, etc.)
- Their address
- Their email address (for everyone above the age of 18 years)
- Total monthly income and available assets
- Housing costs
- Other expenses, including child care and disability related expenses
- Bank account information to receive your payment

title.en-CA: Have you collected all of the information about yourself and your family members you will need to complete your online application?

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in New Brunswick who meet the necessary age and financial requirements may be eligible for Income Assistance. Income Assistance provides financial assistance to those who qualify.

Each step involved in the application process for Income Assistance will be described in detail in this guide.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes qui vivent au Nouveau-Brunswick et qui rpondent aux critres dadmissibilit selon leur ge et leur situation financire peuvent avoir droit  laide au revenu. Laide au revenu fournit une aide financire aux personnes admissibles.

Chaque tape du processus de demande daide au revenu est dcrite en dtail dans ce guide.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved for to receive the Income Assistance

- You will receive $786 per month for a single person without dependents
- You could be eligible for additional supports such as:
  - Health Cards
  - Emergency Fuel Benefit
  - Emergency Special Benefits
  - Medical Transportation

### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

If you are a resident of a reserve, you are not eligible to apply for Income Assistance. If you are an Indigenous person living off reserve, you will be required to apply for all other benefits you may receive, such as benefits from the federal government.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

You must be at least 18 years old to apply for Income Assistance.

## Financial requirements

To determine your financial eligibility to receive Income Assistance, your household total income will be calculated. This means that if you are living with family members, their income will also be considered when determining if you are eligible to receive Income Assistance.

### Assets

To determine if you are eligible to receive Income Assistance, you must report all forms of assets you own. Typically, individuals who receive Income Assistance can have up to 1,000 in liquid assets or up to $2,000 for a household. If you are eligible for Income Assistance in the Blind, Deaf, or Disabled categories, you can have liquid assets up to $10,000 per individual or family unit.

- Any capital or interest accumulated from a registered trust fund above $200,000 for people who qualify as Blind, Deaf, or Disabled
- Life insurance when an applicant or client applies for the funeral benefit.
- Interest earned from:
  - Compensation payments under Federal or Provincial agreements
  - HIV infected haemophiliacs and their survivors
  - Thalidomide victims and their survivors
  - Japanese Canadians
  - Hepatitis C Victims and their survivors
- Compensation benefits under $50,000 made to abuse victims of:
  - Kingsclear Youth Training School
  - Dr. William F. Roberts Hospital
  - Boys Industrial Home
- Liquid assets
  - Cash
  - Money in bank accounts
  - Investments that can be cashed, even if there is a penalty
  - Items in security boxes that would be considered liquid assets otherwise
- Student aid, scholarships, and/or bursaries that are above the amount that would cover relevant educational costs (tuition, books, etc.)

### Exempt Assets

Although you must report all forms of assets you own, some types of assets will not influence your eligibility to receive Income Assistance. These types of assets are called exempt assets.

Exempt assets include:

- Up to $200,000 in a registered trust fund for people who qualify as Blind, Deaf, or Disabled
- Up to $290,000 in funds invested in a Registered Disability Saving Plan (RDSP) for units with a Blind, Deaf or Disabled person
- Up to $800 per month from income generated from Trust Funds or RDSPs
  - Special amounts may be allowed when it allows an individual to stay in the community or helps buy health supports
- Up to $50,000 in funds invested in RRSPs per unit with a Blind, Deaf or Disabled person
- Any funds invested in Registered Education Savings Plan (RESP's)
- All funds from a life insurance policy if the policy is dissolved
- Pre-arranged funeral that arrange prior to or at the time of their application
- Business assets for people who are self-employed
- Childrens Registered Education Savings Plan (RESPs)
- Learning Accounts awarded through the Futures to Discover pilot project
- Investments that cannot be liquidated
- Student aid, scholarships, and/or bursaries that are used to cover educational costs (tuition, books, etc.)

### Fixed Assets

Much like exempt assets, fixed assets will be noted in your application, but will not impact your eligibility to receive Income Assistance. If after 90 days the assets are no longer being used to generate income, they are no longer considered fixed assets.

Fixed assets include:

- Your primary vehicle, which is used for routine transportation, work, medical appointments, or other necessary travel
- Your place of residence
- Property and assets that are necessary to maintain your livelihood

title.fr-CA: Prsenter une demande

content1.en-CA:
Here are the steps you can follow to apply for Income Assistance. Click Start step 1 at the bottom of this page. This will take you to step one.  At the bottom of each page there will be a Next button you can click once you have completed that step. If you have already completed a step, you can skip it. Go ahead and start by clicking on the step where you would like to start.

You can go through the steps at your own pace. If you need help at any step, go to the Help page to find out where you can get support with your application.

## Steps in the application process

- Gather information to contact the Department of Social Development
- Contact the Department of Social Development
- Arrange appointment to complete the application package
- Complete application package and provide required documentation
- Apply to be certified as Blind, Deaf, or Disabled

title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs votre demande  approuve ou refuse

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Congratulations! Your application for Income Assistance has been approved! Now that you have been approved, you:

- Will get up to $786 per month as a single person without dependents
- May get additional benefits as deemed necessary

For a full list of the amount you will receive if you have additional people in your household, you can see the [Rate Schedule](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/dam/gnb/Departments/sd-ds/pdf/SocialAssistance/ScheduleA-AnnexeA.pdf).

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

Once you are approved to receive Income Assistance, you may also be eligible to receive other benefits based on your situation. This could include benefits such as:

- Health Cards
- Emergency Fuel Benefit
- Emergency Special Benefit
- Medical Transportation

To see a full list of benefits you may be eligible for and how to apply for them, you can see the [Social Development Policy Manual: Benefits](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/gnb/en/departments/social_development/policy_manual/benefits.html).

#### Disability Support Program

As a person with a disability, you may require additional supports. The [Disability Support Program](https://socialsupportsnb.ca/en/program/disability-support-program) can offer flexible, person centered approaches to planning and designing disability supports. The Disability Support Program is a separate application that can be completed online, including the [pre-screening tool for the Disability Support Program](https://healthcloudtrialmaster-15a4d-17aa7e6197e.force.com/applications/s/?language=en_US&origin=disability-support-program) to determine if you would be eligible to receive support through this program.

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

The amount you receive in Income Assistance is determined based on your income and the cost of your basic needs. If your situation changes, you will need to inform the Department of Social Development of the change within 15 days. Some potential changes include:

- You receive income or other financial resources that were not initially reported
- You living arrangements changed
- You added or removed members from your household 

If you do not report changes that occur to your situation that could impact the amount you receive in Income Assistance, you could receive more money than you are eligible to receive. This is called an overpayment. You will be required to pay back the overpayment. This will be done by deducting a specific amount from your Income Assistance each month until you have paid back the entire amount you owe.

#### Compensatory Benefits

In some instances, you may receive compensatory benefits to cover the cost of your basic needs. This includes payments from sources such as:

- A settlement or payment of an insurance claim
- Unemployment insurance
- Workers compensation
- Pension benefit
- Any other compensatory benefit that are intended to cover the cost of your basic needs

You should not receive these types of compensatory benefits and Income Assistance at the same time because they are both intended to cover your basic needs. If you receive both types of benefits at the same time, you will be required to pay back the amount you receive from Income Assistance.

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse?

content3.en-CA:
If your application is denied, you may be able to request a review or appeal the decision. There are two steps that may be necessary to have the decision appealed: the request for review and the request for appeal.

### Request for Review

You have a right to request a review for a variety of reasons, some of which include:

- Your application was denied
- The amount of financial assistance you have been approved for will not meet your needs, within the limit of the [Rate Schedule](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/dam/gnb/Departments/sd-ds/pdf/SocialAssistance/ScheduleA-AnnexeA.pdf).
- Your financial assistance has been discontinued.
- Your financial assistance has been reduced.
- There has been an unreasonable delay in making a decision that affects your financial assistance

### The Request for Review Process

To request a review, you will need to submit a Request for Review form to your local office of Social Development within 30 working days. You can ask your screener, needs assessor, or case manager for the Request for Review form.

Your form will be considered by an area reviewer. The area reviewer will make a decision within 15 days of receiving your request for review. The area reviewer may decide:

- In your favour. This means the original decision will be overturned.
- In agreement with the original decision. This means the original decision will not be overturned.

You will receive a letter will the decision, the reasons for the decision, and if you have the right to appeal the decision. If you have the right to appeal the decision, a Notice of Appeal form will be included in the letter.

### Request for Appeal

If you do not agree with the area reviewers decision, you may be able to appeal their decision. There are some specific decisions that __cannot__ be appealed, including: 

- Your eligibility for Income Assistance if you have not completed the application process in full
- Emergency benefits of special need
- Non-financial issues such as planning decisions
- Decisions of the Medical Advisory Board

### Submitting the Request for Appeal

To request an appeal, you will need to complete and submit the Notice of Appeal form to the address included in your letter from the area reviewer within 20 working days. A hearing will be held by the Family Income Security Appeal Board within 20 working days of your submitted request.

### Preparing for the Appeal Hearing

On the day of the appeal hearing, you, the area reviewer, the chairperson or vice-chairperson of the Appeal Board, and two other Appeal Board members will be present. The chairperson will introduce you to the members of the Appeal Board and explain the process of the Appeal Hearing.

The Board members will ask you questions about your monthly expenses, the area reviewer will share the information on your file, and then you will have the opportunity to share any other information you feel is relevant. Once the Appeal Board members have all of the information they need, both you and the area reviewer will leave.

### After the Appeal Hearing

You and the area reviewer will receive a letter with the Appeal Boards decision within 15 working days. This letter will include the decision they made and the reasons for their decision. The Appeal Boards decision is final and conclusive.

If you would like additional information about the appeal process, you can see the [Income Assistance Review/Appeal Process: A How To Guide](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/dam/gnb/Departments/sd-ds/pdf/SocialAssistance/ReviewAppealProcess.pdf) or you can contact your regional office of the Department of Social Development by calling [1-833-733-7835](tel:1-833-733-7835).

### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:     | Then take this step:     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.       | Wait until you are at least 18 years old and reapply.      |
| You do not meet the financial criteria.         | Wait until you meet the necessary requirements and reapply.        |
 | Your application for Blind, Deaf or Disabled Category was rejected by the Medical Advisory Board        |   Your case manager can request a review of the decision by contacting the Secretary of the Board. |
content3.fr-CA:
Si votre demande est refuse, vous pouvez demander une rvision ou faire appel de la dcision. Deux tapes peuvent tre ncessaires pour faire appel de la dcision : la demande de rvision et la demande dappel.

### Demande de rvision

Vous avez le droit de demander une rvision pour diverses raisons, si :

- votre demande a t refuse;
- le montant de laide financire qui vous a t accord ne rpondra pas  vos besoins, dans les limites de l[annexe des taux](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/dam/gnb/Departments/sd-ds/pdf/SocialAssistance/ScheduleA-AnnexeA.pdf);
- votre aide financire a t interrompue;
- votre aide financire a t rduite;
- il y a eu un retard draisonnable dans la prise dune dcision qui a une incidence sur votre aide financire.

### Le processus de demande de rvision

Pour demander une rvision, vous devez soumettre un formulaire de demande de rvision au bureau local de Dveloppement social de votre collectivit dans un dlai de 30 jours ouvrables. Vous pouvez demander  votre examinateur,  votre valuateur des besoins ou  votre charg de cas le formulaire de demande de rvision.

Votre formulaire sera examin par un examinateur rgional. Lexaminateur rgional rendra une dcision dans les 15 jours suivant la rception de votre demande de rvision. Lexaminateur rgional peut dcider :

- En votre faveur : cela signifie que la dcision initiale sera annule.
- En accord avec la dcision initiale : cela signifie que la dcision initiale ne sera pas annule.

Vous recevrez une lettre indiquant la dcision, les motifs de la dcision et votre droit de faire appel de la dcision. Si vous avez le droit, un formulaire davis de droit dappel sera joint  la lettre.

### Demande dappel

Si vous ntes pas daccord avec la dcision de lexaminateur rgional, vous pourriez faire appel de sa dcision. Certaines dcisions prcises __ne peuvent pas__ faire lobjet dun appel, notamment :

- votre admissibilit  laide au revenu si vous navez pas termin le processus de demande;
- les prestations durgence pour besoins spciaux;
- les questions non financires comme les dcisions  propos de la planification;
- les dcisions de la Commission consultative mdicale.

### Soumettre la demande dappel

Pour demander un appel, vous devez remplir le formulaire davis dappel et le soumettre  ladresse indique dans votre lettre de lexaminateur rgional dans un dlai de 20 jours ouvrables. La Commission dappel sur la scurit du revenu familial tiendra une audience dans les 20 jours ouvrables suivant votre demande.

### Prparation de laudience relative  lappel

Le coordonnateur de la Commission dappel vous enverra un avis daudience pour vous informer de la date, de lheure et du lieu de laudience. Vous pouvez demander une copie de la documentation auprs de votre examinateur rgional au moins cinq jours avant laudience relative  lappel.

Vous pouvez tre accompagn dune personne lors de laudience pour parler en votre nom. Il peut sagir dun membre de la famille, dun ami ou dun avocat. Vous pouvez galement apporter tout renseignement que vous jugez important pour votre appel.

### Pendant laudience relative  lappel

Le jour de laudience, vous, lexaminateur rgional, le prsident ou le vice-prsident de la Commission dappel et deux autres membres de la Commission dappel seront prsents. Le prsident vous prsentera les membres de la Commission dappel et vous expliquera le processus de laudience relative  lappel.

Les commissaires vous poseront des questions sur vos dpenses mensuelles, lexaminateur rgional vous communiquera les renseignements contenus dans votre dossier, puis vous aurez loccasion de partager tout autre renseignement que vous jugez pertinent. Une fois que les membres de la Commission dappel auront tous les renseignements dont ils ont besoin, vous et lexaminateur rgional partirez.

### Aprs laudience relative  lappel

Vous et lexaminateur rgional recevrez une lettre contenant la dcision de la Commission dappel dans un dlai de 15 jours ouvrables. Cette lettre comprendra la dcision quils ont prise et les raisons de leur dcision. La dcision de la Commission dappel est dfinitive.

Pour obtenir de plus amples renseignements sur la procdure de rvision et dappel, consultez le [guide pratique de la procdure de rvision et dappel de laide au revenu](https://www2.gnb.ca/content/dam/gnb/Departments/sd-ds/pdf/SocialAssistance/ProcedureRevisionDappel.pdf) ou vous pouvez communiquer avec votre bureau rgional du ministre du Dveloppement social en composant le [1-833-733-7835](tel:18337337835).

### Choisir la meilleure option en cas de refus

Voici quelques raisons frquentes pour lesquelles les gens se voient refuser ainsi que des conseils sur la prochaine tape  suivre :

| Si votre demande a t refuse parce que :     | Alors, faites cette dmarche :     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| Vous navez pas lge requis.       | Attendez davoir 18 ans pour refaire une demande.       |
| Vous ne remplissez pas les conditions financires.        | Attendez de remplir les conditions requises et faites une nouvelle demande.       |
| Votre demande pour la catgorie des personnes aveugles, sourdes ou ayant un handicap a t rejete par la Commission consultative mdicale.       | Votre charg de cas peut demander une rvision de la dcision en communiquant avec la secrtaire de la Commission.       |
