title.en-CA: Have you called the toll-free number to apply for Income Assistance?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous appel le numro sans frais pour faire une demande daide au revenu?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to call the toll-free number to apply for Income Assistance

To start the application process, you will need to call the toll-free number [1-877-424-1177](tel:18774241177). This service is available Monday to Friday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm. It is also available on Tuesday and Thursday evenings from 4:30 pm to 7:00 pm. You can also call the toll-free line from a [Community Services office](https://novascotia.ca/coms/department/contact/index.html).

When you call the toll-free number, tell the caseworker that would like to apply for Income Assistance. They will ask you questions about you and your current situation. Make sure to have the following information when you make the call:

- Your Social Insurance Number (SIN)
- Bank statements for your account
- Any other information that could help explain your situation to the caseworker

They will then make arrangements for you to meet with a caseworker to complete your application.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour appeler le numro sans frais pour faire une demande daide au revenu

Pour commencer le processus de demande, vous devrez appeler le numro sans frais [1-877-424-1177](tel:18774241177). Ce service est disponible du lundi au vendredi de 8h30  16h30. Il est galement disponible le mardi et le jeudi soir de 16h30  19h. Vous pouvez galement appeler la ligne sans frais  partir dun [bureau des services communautaires (anglais seulement)](https://novascotia.ca/coms/department/contact/index.html).

Lorsque vous appelez le numro sans frais, dites au travailleur social que vous souhaitez prsenter une demande daide au revenu. Il vous posera des questions sur vous et votre situation actuelle. Assurez-vous davoir les renseignements suivants avant dappeler :

- votre numro dassurance sociale (NAS);
- les relevs bancaires de votre compte;
- tout autre renseignements qui pourrait aider  expliquer votre situation au travailleur social.

Ils prendront ensuite les dispositions ncessaires pour que vous rencontriez un travailleur social afin de prsenter votre demande.

title.en-CA: Have you collected the documentation required for your first meeting with a caseworker?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rassembl les documents requis pour votre premire rencontre avec un travailleur social?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to collect the required documentation for your first meeting with a caseworker

To complete your application with a caseworker, you will need to provide copies of specific types of documentation. The caseworker will make photocopies of your documentation to keep in your file. The required documentation could include:

- Your Social Insurance Number (SIN)
- Drivers license or photo ID
- Bank account statements
- Income tax assessment forms
- A copy of your lease
- Bills or receipts for utilities
- A medical report from a physician or nurse practitioner who is familiar with your medical history

You should collect this documentation prior to your first meeting and bring it with you when you meet with your caseworker.

title.en-CA: Have you attended your first meeting with a caseworker?
title.fr-CA: tes-vous all  votre premier rendez-vous avec un travailleur social?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to attend your first meeting with a caseworker

When you attend the first meeting with a caseworker, they will ask you for information about yourself to determine if you are eligible for Income Assistance. They will also ask you to provide the documentation they have requested and may take photocopies for your file.

After your meeting with a caseworker, it typically takes three to seven business days to determine if you are eligible to receive Income Assistance. After that time, you will receive a phone call or a letter stating if you are approved, and if you are, the amount you will receive each month.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour votre premier rendez-vous avec un travailleur social

Lors de votre premire rencontre avec un travailleur social, celui-ci vous demandera des renseignements sur vous-mme afin de dterminer si vous avez droit  laide au revenu. Il vous demandera galement de fournir les documents quil a demands et pourra en faire des photocopies pour votre dossier.

Aprs votre rencontre avec un travailleur social, il faut gnralement trois  sept jours ouvrables pour dterminer si vous tes admissible  laide au revenu. Aprs cette priode, vous recevrez un appel tlphonique ou une lettre vous indiquant si votre demande est approuve et, le cas chant, le montant que vous recevrez chaque mois.

title.en-CA: Have you informed your caseworker that you have a disability?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous inform votre travailleur social que vous avez un handicap?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to inform your caseworker that you have a disability

If you have a disability and it impacts your ability to find or keep a job, you should inform your caseworker. You may be eligible for additional financial supports through Income Assistance.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour informer votre travailleur social que vous avez un handicap

Si vous avez un handicap et que celui-ci a une incidence sur votre capacit  trouver ou  conserver un emploi, vous devez le signaler  votre travailleur social. Vous pouvez avoir droit  des aides financires supplmentaires dans le cadre du programme daide au revenu.

title.en-CA: Are you eligible for Income Assistance?
title.fr-CA: tes-vous admissible  laide au revenu?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need if you are not eligible for Income Assistance

If you have not been approved for Income Assistance and you believe you should be eligible, you have to the right to request an appeal. You can see more about the appeal process under the section titled, After you apply - approved or denied: What happens if you application is denied?
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin si vous ntes pas admissible  laide au revenu

Si votre demande daide au revenu na pas t approuve et que vous pensez que vous devriez tre admissible, vous avez le droit de faire appel. Pour en savoir plus sur la procdure dappel, consultez la section intitule Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse?.

title.en-CA: You are at the end of the steps
title.fr-CA: Flicitations!

content.en-CA:
## Congratulations!

Congratulations! You can now read the section titled, After you apply  approved or denied to see any additional steps you need to complete.
content.fr-CA: Flicitations! Vous pouvez maintenant consulter la section intitule Aprs votre demande  approuve ou refuse pour connatre toutes les prochaines tapes que vous devez accomplir.

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in Nunavut and who meet the necessary age, financial, and ability to work requirements may be eligible to receive Income Assistance.

Each step involved in the application process for Income Assistance will be described in detail in this guide.  There is not a separate application for persons with disabilities, but if you qualify you may be able to receive an additional [Disabled incidental Allowance](https://gov.nu.ca/family-services/information/incidental-allowances). You can leave the site and come back later when you have more time, energy, and the documents you may need to complete a step.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes handicapes qui vivent au Nunavut et qui rpondent aux exigences relatives  lge,  la situation financire et  la capacit de travailler peuvent tre admissibles  lassistance au revenu.

Chaque tape du processus de demande dassistance au revenu sera dcrite en dtail dans ce guide. Il ny a pas de demande distincte pour les personnes handicapes, mais si vous remplissez les conditions requises, vous pourrez peut-tre recevoir une [allocation accessoire supplmentaire aux personnes handicapes](https://gov.nu.ca/fr/bienvenue-sf/information/allocation-accessoire). Vous pouvez quitter le site et y revenir plus tard, lorsque vous aurez plus de temps, dnergie et les documents dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour complter une tape.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved for to receive the Income Assistance, you could receive

- Food allowance
- $50 in miscellaneous allowance if you or your dependent are staying in a medical or treatment facility
- Room and board allowance
- Accommodation allowance
- Fuel allowance
- Utilities allowance

To see a full list of allowances and amounts you could receive, you can see Schedule A on page 24 of the [Income Assistance Act: Consolidation of Income Assistance Regulations](https://www.nunavutlegislation.ca/en/consolidated-law/income-assistance-regulations-consolidation).

### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

If you are Indigenous, you can apply for Income Assistance. As with non-Indigenous persons, you are required to apply for any other benefits you may be eligible for, such as benefits from the federal government.

If you are First Nations or Inuit and you are considered a status Indian under the Indian Act or are recognized by the Inuit land claim organization, you may inquire about the [Non-Insured Health Benefits program](https://www.sac-isc.gc.ca/eng/1574187596083/1576511384063).
content2.fr-CA:
### Si votre demande dassistance au revenu est approuve, vous pourriez recevoir

- Allocation alimentaire
- 50$ dindemnits diverses si vous ou votre personne  charge sjournez dans un tablissement mdical ou de soins
- Allocation de logement et de nourriture
- Allocation de loyer
- Allocation de carburant
- Allocation de services publics

Pour voir la liste complte des allocations et des montants que vous pourriez recevoir, vous pouvez consulter lannexe A  la page24 de la [Loi sur lassistance au revenu: Codification du rglement sur lassistance au revenu](https://www.nunavutlegislation.ca/fr/consolidated-law/assistance-au-revenu-codification-du-reglement-sur-l).

### Je suis autochtone. Le processus est-il diffrent pour moi?

Si vous tes autochtone, vous pouvez demander une assistance au revenu. Comme pour les personnes non autochtones, vous tes tenu de faire une demande pour toute autre prestation  laquelle vous pourriez avoir droit, comme les prestations du gouvernement fdral.

Si vous tes un membre des Premires Nations ou un Inuit et que vous tes considr comme un Indien inscrit en vertu de la Loi sur les Indiens ou que vous tes reconnu par lorganisation sur les revendications territoriales des Inuits, vous pouvez vous renseigner au sujet du [programme des services de sant non assurs](https://www.sac-isc.gc.ca/fra/1574187596083/1576511384063).

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

To be eligible to receive Income Assistance (IA) you must be 18 years of age or older.

## Financial requirements

To receive Income Assistance, you must meet the criteria to be considered a person in need based on an assessment with an Income Assistance Worker. To qualify as a person in need, your basic living expenses must cost more than your monthly income. Your basic living expenses include things such as food, shelter, and utilities.

### Earned Income

Your earned income is your net salary. This includes income from sources such as employment, self-employment, as well as income from hunting, trapping, and fishing. Earned income will be considered in your net monthly income when determining if you are eligible to receive Income Assistance.

### Net Monthly Income

Your net monthly income is the amount that will be used to determine your eligibility to receive Income Assistance. This will be your total income (including your earned income and your unearned income) minus the allowable income inclusions.

### Allowable Income

You will be able to keep a certain amount of the income you earn from earned income, such as having paid employment. This is called your allowable income. For a single person without dependents, the allowable income includes:

- The first $200 of earned income
- 50% of the next $600 of earned income

### Unearned Income 

Unearned income will also be considered when determining if you are eligible to receive Income Assistance. Unearned income can come from a variety of sources including:

- A portion of the income received from roomers, lodgers, and boarders
- Income from annuity, pension plans, or insurance benefits
- Benefits from benevolent organizations or other agencies
- Payments received under mortgage, agreement for sale, or loan agreement
- Money that is held in trusts for a child
- Money that is under the terms of maintenance or support orders, parents maintenance or support orders, separation agreements, court orders, divorce decrees, inheritance settlements, or other types of settlements/agreements
- Income received from:
  - Pension Act (Canada)
  - Canada Pension Plan
  - Employment Insurance Act (Canada)
  - Old Age Security Act (Canada)

### Income that will not be included in the net income

Some types of income will not be included in the calculation of your net income. This means that you can receive these types of income without it impacting your eligibility to receive Income Assistance. This includes money from sources such as:

- Child tax benefits
- Child disability benefit
- Casual gifts of small value
- Payments made by the Director for maintenance of a dependent adult
- The value of any Indian Treaty money or good received in accordance with the provisions of Treaty No. 8 and Treaty No. 11.
- The value of the property that is your primary residence
- The value of real property that is necessary for the operations of a business
- For a person who is disabled, assets to a total of $5,000
- Funds accumulated or received from a Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP)

## Ability to work

To be eligible to receive Income Assistance, typically you must demonstrate that you are trying to find employment. If you are a person with a disability, you will need to provide documentation that shows that your disability impacts your ability to work.

To be considered a person with a disability that qualifies for Income Assistance, you must have physical or mental impairments that limit your ability to perform daily living activities on a permanent or temporary basis, which requires you to have assistance with your activities of daily living. A temporary disability is a disability that lasts for at least six months. You may also qualify if you have a medical treatment that would not heal.
content1.fr-CA:
## ge requis

Pour avoir droit  lassistance au revenu (AR), vous devez tre g de 18ans ou plus.

## Exigences financires

Pour bnficier de lassistance au revenu, vous devez remplir les critres pour tre considr comme une personne dans le besoin, sur la base dune valuation avec un agent de lassistance au revenu. Pour tre considre comme une personne dans le besoin, vos frais de subsistance de base doivent tre suprieurs  votre revenu mensuel. Vos frais de subsistance de base comprennent des lments tels que la nourriture, le logement et les services publics.

### Revenus gagns 

Votre revenu gagn reprsente votre salaire net. Cela inclut les revenus provenant de sources telles que lemploi, le travail autonome, ainsi que les revenus de la chasse, du pigeage et de la pche. Les revenus gagns seront pris en compte dans votre revenu mensuel net pour dterminer si vous avez droit  lassistance au revenu.

### Revenu mensuel net

Votre revenu mensuel net reprsente le montant qui sera utilis pour dterminer votre admissibilit  lassistance au revenu. Il sagit de votre revenu total (y compris votre revenu gagn et votre revenu non gagn) moins les inclusions de revenu autorises.

### Revenu admissible 

Vous pourrez conserver un certain montant de vos revenus provenant dun revenu gagn, par exemple en ayant un emploi rmunr. Cest ce quon appelle votre revenu admissible. Pour une personne seule sans personne  charge, le revenu admissible comprend:

- Les premiers 200dollars de revenus gagns
- 50% des 600prochainsdollars de revenu gagn

### Revenu non gagn 

Les revenus non gagns seront galement pris en compte pour dterminer si vous tes admissible  lassistance au revenu. Les revenus non gagns peuvent provenir de diverses sources:

- Une partie des revenus perus par les locataires, les logeurs et les pensionnaires
- Revenus de rentes, de rgimes de retraite ou de prestations dassurance
- Prestations dorganismes de bienfaisance ou dautres organismes
- Paiements reus en vertu dune hypothque, dun contrat de vente ou dun contrat de prt
- Argent dtenu en fiducie pour un enfant
- Largent qui est sous les termes dune ordonnance dentretien ou de soutien, dune ordonnance dentretien ou de soutien dun parent, dun accord de sparation, dune ordonnance du tribunal, dun jugement de divorce, dun rglement dhritage ou dautres types de rglements ou entente
- Revenu reu de:
  - Loi sur les pensions (Canada)
  - Rgime de pensions du Canada
  - Loi sur lassurance-emploi (Canada)
  - Loi sur la scurit de la vieillesse (Canada)

### Les revenus qui ne seront pas inclus dans le revenu net 

Certains types de revenus ne seront pas pris en compte dans le calcul de votre revenu net. Cela signifie que vous pouvez recevoir ces types de revenus sans que cela ait des rpercussions sur votre droit  laide au revenu. Cela inclut largent provenant de sources telles que:

- Prestations fiscales pour les enfants
- Prestation pour enfants handicaps
- Cadeaux occasionnels de faible valeur
- Paiements effectus par le directeur pour lentretien dun adulte  charge
- La valeur de toute somme dargent ou de tout bien reu en vertu dun trait avec les Indiens, conformment aux dispositions du trait no8 et du trait no11.
- La valeur de la proprit qui est votre rsidence principale
- La valeur des biens immobiliers ncessaires  lexploitation dune entreprise
- Pour une personne handicape, les actifs jusqu un total de 5000$
- Fonds accumuls ou reus dun rgime enregistr dpargne-invalidit (REEI)

## Capacit  travailler 

Pour avoir droit  lassistance au revenu, vous devez gnralement dmontrer que vous essayez de trouver un emploi. Si vous tes une personne handicape, vous devrez fournir des documents prouvant que votre handicap a des rpercussions sur votre capacit  travailler.

Pour tre considr comme une personne handicape remplissant les conditions requises pour bnficier de lassistance au revenu, vous devez prsenter des dficiences physiques ou mentales qui limitent votre capacit  accomplir les activits de la vie quotidienne de manire permanente ou temporaire, ce qui vous oblige  bnficier dune assistance pour les activits de la vie quotidienne. Une invalidit temporaire est un handicap qui dure au moins six mois. Vous pouvez galement tre admissible si vous avez un traitement mdical qui ne vous permettrait pas de gurir.

title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs votre demande  approuve ou rejete

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il quand votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Once your application is approved, an Income Assistance Officer will determine the amount of financial support you will receive each month. The amount you receive in Income Assistance will depend on a number of factors including:

- Your living expenses
- Which zone you live in
- The number of people in your family, including dependent children

### Categories of the Basic Allowance

The amount you receive from Income Assistance will be categorized based on categories that are included in the basic allowance. You can receive:

- A food allowance
- $50 in miscellaneous allowance if you or your dependent are staying in a medical or treatment facility
- Room and board allowance
- Accommodation allowance
- Fuel allowance
- Utilities allowance

To see a full list of allowances and amounts you could receive, you can see Schedule A on page 24 of the [Income Assistance Act: Consolidation of Income Assistance Regulations](https://www.nunavutlegislation.ca/en/consolidated-law/income-assistance-regulations-consolidation).

### Employment Expectations

When you are approved for Income Assistance, you are typically expected to participate in activities that could help you find employment. If you meet the criteria to qualify as a person with a disability, you will be exempt from participating in these activities.

These activities can include:

- Wage employment
- Education or training
- Parenting or caring for family members
- Counselling or treatment
- Community Service

### Productive Choices

Productive Choices is a program designed to help individuals gain financial independence. Productive Choices can include participating in career or wellness activities.

Career activities include:

- Upgrading
- Career support
- Employment
- Training
- Harvesting
- Community work/volunteer activities
- Parenting

Wellness activities include:

- Alcohol and drug counselling
- Mental health counselling
- Family support
- Medical Assistance
- Community justice

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

In addition to the basic allowance you will receive each month, you may also be eligible to receive other extended benefits.

Some examples of supplemental benefits include the following:

- Clothing allowance
- Incidental allowance of $250 for a person who is disabled permanently or temporarily for more than a year
- Incidental allowance of $175 for a person who has attained the age of 60 years
- An allowance of $125 for a person who is disabled temporarily for at least six months
- Allowance for expenses related to education and training such as:
  - Transportation
  - Text books and supplies
  - Special clothing
  - Activity fees
  - Tuition
- Household furnishings and equipment allowance
- Damage deposits
- Emergency Assistance
- Day care subsidy allowance

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

While you are receiving Income Assistance, you must inform your Income Assistance worker of any changes to your situation that could impact your eligibility to receive Income Assistance or may change the amount of Income Assistance you are eligible for. This could include:

- Changes in your number of dependents
- Changes in your income
- Changes in your assets
- Changes in your place of residence

### Overpayments

If you do not inform your Income Assistance worker of the changes in your situation, you may receive an overpayment. An overpayment means you received more money than you are eligible to receive. If you receive an overpayment, you will need to pay the amount back.

Typically, a portion of the overpayment amount you owe will be deducted from your monthly Income Assistance until you have paid back the total overpayment amount you received. If you are no longer receiving Income Assistance but owe money due to an overpayment, you will need to make a payment plan arrangement to pay back the full amount you owe.

Une fois votre demande approuve, un agent dassistance au revenu dterminera le montant de laide financire que vous recevrez chaque mois. Le montant que vous recevez en guise dassistance au revenu dpend dun certain nombre de facteurs, dont les suivants:

- Vos frais de subsistance
- Dans quelle zone vous habitez
- Le nombre de personnes dans votre famille, y compris les enfants  charge

### Catgories de lallocation de base

Le montant que vous recevez de lassistance au revenu sera class en fonction des catgories qui sont incluses dans lallocation de base. Vous pouvez recevoir:

- Une allocation alimentaire
- 50$ dindemnits diverses si vous ou votre personne  charge sjournez dans un tablissement mdical ou de soins
- Allocation de logement et de nourriture

Pour voir la liste complte des allocations et des montants que vous pourriez recevoir, vous pouvez consulter lannexe A  la page24 de la [Loi sur lassistance au revenu: Codification du rglement sur lassistance au revenu](https://www.nunavutlegislation.ca/fr/consolidated-law/assistance-au-revenu-codification-du-reglement-sur-l).

### Attentes en matire demploi

Lorsque votre demande dassistance au revenu est approuve, on attend gnralement de vous que vous participiez  des activits susceptibles de vous aider  trouver un emploi. Si vous remplissez les critres pour tre considr comme une personne handicape, vous serez exempt de la participation  ces activits.

Ces activits peuvent inclurent:

- Emploi salari
- ducation ou formation
- Lducation des enfants ou soccuper de membres de la famille
- Conseil ou traitement
- Service communautaire

### Choix productifs

Choix productifs est un programme conu pour aider les personnes  acqurir une indpendance financire. Les choix productifs peuvent inclure la participation  des activits professionnelles ou de bien-tre.

Les activits professionnelles comprennent:

- Mise  niveau
- Soutien  la carrire
- Emploi
- Formation
- Rcolte
- Travail communautaire et activits de bnvolat
- Lducation des enfants

Les activits de bien-tre comprennent:

- Conseils en matire dalcool et de drogues
- Conseil de sant mentale
- Soutien aux familles
- Assistance mdicale
- Justice communautaire

### Autres prestations complmentaires que vous pouvez recevoir

En plus de lallocation de base que vous recevrez chaque mois, vous pouvez galement bnficier dautres prestations complmentaires.

Voici quelques exemples de prestations complmentaires:

- Allocation vestimentaire
- Allocation accessoire de 250$ pour une personne atteinte dun handicap permanent ou temporaire de plus dun an
- Allocation accessoire de 175$ pour une personne ayant atteint lge de 60ans
- Une allocation de 125$ pour une personne souffrant dun handicap temporaire dau moins six mois
- Allocation pour les dpenses lies  lducation et  la formation telles que:
  - Transport
  - Livres et fournitures scolaires
  - Vtements spciaux
  - Frais dactivit
  - Frais de scolarit
- Allocation pour lameublement et lquipement du foyer
- Dpts en cas de dommages
- Aide durgence
- Allocation de subvention pour la garde de jour

### Pour que vos renseignements soient  jour et pour viter les trop-perus

Pendant que vous recevez lassistance au revenu, vous devez informer votre agent dassistance au revenu de tout changement de votre situation qui pourrait avoir des rpercussions sur votre admissibilit  lassistance au revenu ou qui pourrait modifier le montant de lassistance au revenu auquel vous avez droit. Cela peut inclure:

- Changements du nombre de personnes  charge
- Changements dans vos revenus
- Changements dans vos actifs
- Changements dans votre lieu de rsidence

### Trop-perus

Si vous ninformez pas votre agent dassistance au revenu des changements survenus dans votre situation, vous pouvez recevoir un trop-peru. Un trop-peru signifie que vous avez reu plus dargent que ce  quoi vous avez droit. Si vous recevez un trop-peru, vous devrez rembourser ce montant.  

En gnral, une partie du montant du trop-peru que vous devez sera dduite de votre assistance au revenu mensuel jusqu ce que vous ayez rembours le montant total du trop-peru. Si vous ne bnficiez plus de lassistance au revenu, mais que vous devez de largent en raison dun trop-peru, vous devrez conclure un accord de plan de paiement pour rembourser la totalit du montant que vous devez.

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est rejete?

content3.en-CA:
### Filing An Appeal

If your application is denied you have the option of filing an appeal. You can file an appeal within seven days of receiving a decision on your application for Income Assistance.

#### How to File an Appeal

To file an appeal, you must provide written notification to the chairperson of the Appeal Committee and the Director that describes the reason(s) you are filing the appeal and the solution you are looking for.

#### Seeking Assistance Filing Your Appeal

If you are not able to provide a written notification, someone can assist you. If nobody else is able to, the Income Assistance Officer can assist you. If someone helps you provide the written notification, they must only include the information you request and must act in an impartial manner.

#### Meeting with the Appeal Committee

Within 30 days of the day they receive your notification to request an appeal, the chairperson of the Appeal Committee will hold a meeting with the Appeal Committee, you (the applicant), and/or your representative.

You and the Appeal Committee will receive at least three days notice before the hearing of the appeal. During the appeal, the Appeal Committee may request you and the Income Assistance Officer to provide documents or other information.

#### Outcome of the Appeal

After reviewing the documents and any other information you and/or the Income Assistance Officer supply, the Appeal Committee will decide on the outcome of the appeal, which they will provide in writing.

### Appeals to the Appeal Board

If you have reason to appeal the Appeal Committees decision, you can file an appeal with the Appeal Board within seven days of the day you received written notification of the Appeal Committees decision.

#### Before the Appeal

To file this appeal you will need to send written notification to the chairperson of the Appeal Board describing the reason(s) you are appealing the decision and the solution you are looking for.

Once the chairperson of the Appeal Board receives the notification of your appeal, they will be provided a copy of the ruling being appealed, any documents that are necessary to determine your eligibility, and the reasons for the appeal. The chairperson of the Appeal Board will then designate three to five members of the Appeal Board to sit on a panel of the Appeal Board to hear the appeal.

#### During the Appeal

Within 30 days of the day they receive your notification to request an appeal, the chairperson of the Appeal Board will hold a meeting with the panel they appointed, the Director, you (the applicant), and/or your representative. You and the Appeal Committee will receive at least three days notice before the hearing of the appeal.

During the appeal, the panel may request that you, the Income Assistance Officer, the chairperson of the Appeal Committee, or the Director provide documents or other information.

#### After the Appeal

After reviewing the documents and any other information provided, the panel will decide on the outcome of the appeal, which they will provide in writing. Copies of this decision will be provided to you, the Income Assistance Officer, the Director, and the chairperson of the Appeal Committee.

#### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:     | Then take this step:     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.       | Wait until you are at least 18 years old and reapply.       |
| You did not provide all of the necessary information or provided inconsistencies.        | Make sure all the information including any dates, documentation, or medical details are accurate.       |
| You do not meet the financial criteria       | Reapply when the costs of your monthly basic needs are greater than your monthly income.       |
| You do not meet the criteria to receive the Disabled incidental Allowance.       | You may still be eligible to receive Income Assistance without the Disabled incidental Allowance if you meet all of the other necessary criteria.       |
content3.fr-CA:

Si votre demande est rejete, vous avez la possibilit de dposer un appel. Vous pouvez dposer un appel dans les sept jours suivant la rception de la dcision relative  votre demande dassistance au revenu.

#### Comment dposer un appel

#### Demander de laide pour dposer votre appel

#### Runion avec le comit dappel

### Recours auprs de la commission dappel

Si vous avez des raisons de faire appel de la dcision du comit dappel, vous pouvez dposer un recours auprs de la commission dappel dans les sept jours suivant la date  laquelle vous avez reu la notification crite de la dcision du comit dappel.

#### Avant lappel

Pour introduire cet appel, vous devrez envoyer une notification crite au prsident du comit dappel en dcrivant la ou les raisons pour lesquelles vous faites appel de la dcision et la solution que vous recherchez.

Une fois que le prsident du comit dappel aura reu la notification de votre appel, il recevra une copie de la dcision faisant lobjet de lappel, tout document ncessaire pour dterminer votre admissibilit ainsi que les raisons de lappel. Au cours de lappel, le comit peut vous demander,  vous,  lagent dassistance au revenu, au prsident du comit dappel ou au directeur, de fournir des documents ou dautres renseignements.

title.fr-CA: Foire aux questions

lead.en-CA: Frequently asked questions about Income Assistance

content1.en-CA:
## Do I need to file income taxes to qualify for Income Assistance?

Yes, in order to qualify for Income Assistance you will need to apply for income taxes. To learn more about think process, you can see the [Videos on Income Taxes, Benefits, and Credits](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/news/cra-multimedia-library/individuals-video-gallery.html).

## Which forms am I required to complete to determine if my disability qualifies for the Disabled incidental Allowance?

You will need to complete the [Certificate of Disability form](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/tax/individuals/segments/tax-credits-deductions-persons-disabilities/disability-tax-credit/how-apply-dtc.html) to determine if your disability qualifies.

## Am I required to pay back overpayments?

Yes, if you receive an overpayment, you will be required to repay the excess amount you received.

## Am I required to report all forms of income, even those that will not impact my eligibility?

Yes, you must report ALL forms of income, regardless of whether they will impact your eligibility to receive Income Assistance.

## As a person with a disability, am I required to participate in activities that could help me gain employment?

No, you will not need to participate activities that could help you gain employment. You will receive an exemption if your disability qualifies.
content1.fr-CA:
## Dois-je remplir une dclaration dimpts sur le revenu pour bnficier de lassistance au revenu?

Oui, pour avoir droit  lassistance au revenu, vous devez faire une dclaration dimpt sur le revenu. Pour en savoir plus sur le processus de rflexion, vous pouvez voir les [Vidos sur limpt sur le revenu, les prestations et les crdits](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/nouvelles/bibliotheque-multimedia-arc/galerie-videos-particuliers.html).

## Quels formulaires dois-je remplir pour dterminer si mon handicap donne droit  lallocation accessoire aux personnes handicapes?

Vous devrez remplir le [formulaire de certificat dinvalidit](https://www.canada.ca/fr/agence-revenu/services/impot/particuliers/segments/deductions-credits-impot-personnes-handicapees/credit-impot-personnes-handicapees/comment-demande-ciph.html) pour dterminer si votre handicap est admissible.

## Suis-je oblig de rembourser les trop-perus?

Oui, si vous recevez un trop-peru, vous devrez rembourser le montant excdentaire que vous avez reu.

## Suis-je tenu de dclarer toutes les formes de revenus, mme celles qui nont pas de rpercussions sur mon admissibilit?

Oui, vous devez dclarer TOUTES les formes de revenu, quelles aient ou non des rpercussions sur votre admissibilit  lassistance au revenu.

## En tant que personne handicape, suis-je tenu de participer  des activits qui pourraient maider  obtenir un emploi?

Non, vous ne devrez pas participer  des activits qui pourraient vous aider  trouver un emploi. Vous recevrez une exemption si votre handicap y donne droit.

Typically, people who receive Income Assistance are required to look for employment and participate in programs that could help them find employment. As a person with a disability, you may be exempt from this requirement.

En gnral, les personnes qui bnficient de lassistance au revenu sont tenues de chercher un emploi et de participer  des programmes qui pourraient les aider  trouver un emploi. En tant que personne handicape, vous pouvez tre exempt de cette exigence.

title.fr-CA: Foires aux questions

lead.en-CA: Frequently asked questions about Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports

content1.en-CA:
## What is the difference between Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports?

Assured Income provides financial support for those who qualify. AccessAbility Supports provides personalized assistance to those who qualify based on their disability needs.

## Do I need to qualify for both Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports to receive help?

No! You can receive personalized support through AccessAbility Supports even if you do not qualify for Assured Income. However, you will need to pay for a portion of the services you receive.

## Do I need to complete separate applications for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports?

You will be assessed for both types of support at the same time.

## Will AccessAbility Supports assist with paying for physiotherapy or chiropractor appointments?

No, AccessAbility Supports will not assist with the cost of medical services such as physiotherapy or chiropractor appointments. AccessAbility Supports will assist with supports or devices that directly assist you with basic activities of daily living.

Examples of devices that directly assist with basic activities of daily living:

- Orthotics
- Walker
- Assistive technology
- Cleaning services
- Snow removal
- Meals on wheels

## Will Accessibility Supports assist with paying for my medical supplies such as diabetic supplies or bandages for wound care?

Medical Supplies are not covered under Accessibility Supports. Based on your income, medical supplies may be covered as expenses under the Assured Income program if you qualify.

## If I have a job, can I keep the money I earn?

If you are employed while receiving Assured Income, you can keep a portion of your income. You can keep the first $500 plus 30% of any amount earned above $500.
content1.fr-CA:
## Quelle est la diffrence entre le Revenu assur et le Programme d'accessibilit?

Le Revenu assur offre un soutien financier aux personnes qui y ont droit. Le Programme d'accessibilit fournit une assistance personnalise aux personnes qui remplissent les critres d'admissibilit en fonction de leurs besoins en matire de handicap.

## Dois-je tre admissible  la fois au Revenu assur et au Programme d'accessibilit?

Non! Vous pouvez bnficier d'un soutien personnalis par le biais du Programme d'accessibilit mme si vous n'avez pas droit au Revenu assur. Cependant, vous devrez payer une partie des services que vous recevrez.

## Dois-je remplir des demandes distinctes pour le Revenu assur et le Programme d'accessibilit?

Vous serez valu pour les deux types d'aide en mme temps

## Le Programme d'accessibilit aidera-t-il  payer les rendez-vous chez le physiothrapeute ou le chiropraticien?

Non, le Programme daccessibilit ne prend pas en charge le cot des services mdicaux tels que les rendez-vous chez le physiothrapeute ou le chiropraticien. Le Programme d'accessibilit fournira du soutien ou des appareils qui vous aideront directement  accomplir les activits de base de la vie quotidienne.

Exemples d'appareils qui aident directement aux activits de base de la vie quotidienne : 

- science de l'orthse;
- dambulateur;
- technologie d'aide;
- service de nettoyage;
- dneigement;
- repas livrs  domicile.

## Le Programme d'accessibilit aidera-t-il  payer mes fournitures mdicales, comme les fournitures pour diabtiques ou les bandages pour le soin des plaies?

Les fournitures mdicales ne sont pas couvertes par le Programme d'accessibilit. En fonction de vos revenus, les fournitures mdicales peuvent tre prises en charge dans le cadre du programme de Revenu assur si vous y avez droit.

## Si j'ai un emploi, puis-je garder l'argent que je gagne?

Si vous travaillez tout en bnficiant du Revenu assur, vous pouvez conserver une partie de votre revenu. Vous pouvez garder les premiers 500 $ plus 30 % de tout montant gagn au-del de 500 $.

title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs avoir dpos une demande - approuve ou refuse

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Congratulations, you have been approved to receive Assured Income and/or AccessAbility Supports!

If you are approved for Assured Income, you will receive:

- $342 for a food benefit
- $83 for essentials such as clothing and household supplies
- Up to $794 for accommodations for a single person without dependents

If you are approved for AccessAbility Supports, you will receive:

- Additional financial supports as deemed necessary
- Person supports to enable you to continue living at home

During the development of your Support Plan, you and your Support Coordinator will have identified your currently unmet needs and how those needs will be met. Your financial assessment will have determined if you are responsible for paying for a portion of the resources provided through AccessAbility Supports, and if so, the amount you are responsible for paying.

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

If you are approved for Assured Income, you will also be eligible for additional benefits including:

- [Transportation](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.6_transportation.pdf) to help provide transportation to non-disability specific needs such as travel to your workplace
- [Special Needs](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.7_special_needs.pdf) to cover the cost of special needs items such as:
  - [School allowance](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.12_school_age_allowance.pdf)
  - Repairs to property
  - [Furniture and appliances](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.10_furniture_applicances_final_1.pdf)
  - Damage and security deposits
  - [Funeral expenses](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.14_funeral_expenses_final.pdf)
- [Medical Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.8_medical_supports.pdf)
- [Employment and Transitional Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.5_employment_transition_allowance_final_002.pdf) to eliminate unnecessary barriers in the workplace

As part of AccessAbility Supports, you can receive a wide range of supports. With your Supports Coordinator, you will identify which supports will help you meet your currently unmet needs. This could include:

- [Personal Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.1_personal_supports_policy.pdf) to supplement your natural supports and existing personal supports
- [Community Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.3_community_supports_policy.pdf) to increase your ability to participate in your community
- [Caregiver Support](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.4caregiver_supports_policy.pdf)s to supplement your natural supports and existing caregiver supports
- [Employment and Vocational Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.5_employment_and_vocational_supports.pdf) to help you prepare for, obtain, or maintain employment
- [Technical Aids and Assistive Devices Supports](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.6_technical_aids_and_assitive_devices.pdf) to provide technical aids or assistive devices to improve your ability to perform activities of daily living or instrumental activities of daily living
- [Home Modifications](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.7_home_modification.pdf)
- [Vehicle Modifications](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.8_vehicle_modification.pdf)

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

To remain eligible for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports, it is expected that you report any changes that could impact the amount of support you receive and/or the portion you are required to pay for AccessAbility Supports. You must inform your Support Coordinator if:

- You have a dramatic change in your income or your expenses
- Your family situation has changes, such as the birth of a child or a divorce
- You have been sentenced to a correctional facility
- You are hospitalized for more than 30 days in a row

#### Overpayments

If you do not report these changes, it is possible that you will receive more financial support than you are eligible to receive. This is called an overpayment. If you receive an overpayment, it will be recorded in your file with the reason for the overpayment. You will then be required to complete an Acknowledgement of Overpayment Form.

#### Paying Overpayments

It is required that you repay any overpayments. If you are still receiving Assured Income and/or AccessAbility Supports, the overpayment will be paid back through one of the following options:

- Repayment in a lump sum
- A withhold from your monthly entitlement, typically between $25 - $100 per month
- Suspension of supports until the amount is repaid
- A combination of the above options

If you are no longer receiving Assured Income and/or AccessAbility Supports or stop receiving Assured Income and/ore AccessAbility Supports while you still owe an overpayment, the Overpayment Coordinator will send you an Out-of-Pay Overpayment Letter. You will have 30 days to complete the terms of you repayment that have already been decided or to contact the department.

The Overpayment Coordinator can take additional steps if necessary, such as:

- Recovery by the Overpayment Coordinator
- Filing of judgment against your property
- Registering your debt with the [CRA Set-Off Program](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/about-canada-revenue-agency-cra/protecting-your-privacy/privacy-impact-assessment/individual-refund-set-off-program.html)
content2.fr-CA:
Flicitations, vous avez t approuv au Programme d'accessibilit et/ou du Revenu assur!

Si votre demande de Revenu assur est approuve, vous recevrez :

- 342$ pour une prestation offrant un montant pour de la nourriture;
- 83$ pour les besoins de base tels que les vtements et les fournitures pour la maison;
- un montant allant jusqu 794$ pour le loyer dune personne seule sans personnes  charge;

Aprs avoir reu lapprobation au Programme daccessibilit, vous recevrez:

- de laide financire supplmentaire juge ncessaire;
- de laide personnalise pour vous permettre de continuer de vivre  votre domicile;

Au cours de l'laboration de votre plan de soutien, votre agent de liaison et vous aurez identifi vos besoins actuels non satisfaits et la manire dont ces besoins seront satisfaits. Votre valuation financire aura dtermin si vous tes responsable du paiement d'une partie des ressources fournies par le Programme d'accessibilit, et si tel est le cas, le montant que vous devez payer.

### Autres prestations supplmentaires que vous pourriez recevoir

Si votre demande de Revenu assur est approuve, vous serez galement admissible  ces prestations supplmentaires suivantes :

- [Transport (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.6_transportation.pdf) pour offrir un transport rpondant  des besoins spcifiques non lis  un handicap, tels que les dplacements vers votre lieu de travail.
- [Besoins spciaux (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.7_special_needs.pdf) pour couvrir le cot des articles pour des besoins spciaux tels que :
  - [Allocation aux tudes (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.12_school_age_allowance.pdf)
  - Rparations de la proprit
  - [Meubles et appareils mnagers (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.10_furniture_applicances_final_1.pdf)
  - Dpts de garantie et de dommages
  - [Frais funraires (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/6.14_funeral_expenses_final.pdf)
- [Soutien mdical (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.5_employment_transition_allowance_final_002.pdf)
- [Soutien  la transition et  l'emploi (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/3.5_employment_transition_allowance_final_002.pdf) liminer les contraintes inutiles en milieu du travail.

Dans le cadre du Programme d'accessibilit, vous pouvez bnficier d'un large ventail d'aides. Votre agent de liaison et vous identifierez le soutien qui vous aidera  rpondre  vos besoins qui sont actuellement non satisfaits. Ceci pourrait comprendre:

- [Soutien personnel (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.1_personal_supports_policy.pdf)pour renforcer votre soutien naturel et votre soutien personnel actuel.
- [Soutien communautaire (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.3_community_supports_policy.pdf) pour accrotre votre capacit  participer  la vie de votre communaut.
- [Soutien aux aidants (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.4caregiver_supports_policy.pdf) pour renforcer votre soutien naturel et le soutien actuel des aidants.
- [Soutien  l'emploi et  la formation professionnelle (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.5_employment_and_vocational_supports.pdf) pour vous aider  vous prparer pour obtenir un emploi ou pour conserver un emploi.
- [Aides techniques et dispositifs d'assistance (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.6_technical_aids_and_assitive_devices.pdf) fournir des aides techniques ou des appareils d'assistance pour amliorer votre capacit  effectuer des activits de la vie quotidienne ou des activits instrumentales de la vie quotidienne.
- [Modifications du domicile (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.7_home_modification.pdf).
- [Modifications du vhicule (en anglais seulement)](https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/sites/default/files/publications/2.8_vehicle_modification.pdf).

### Conserver vos renseignements  jour et viter les trop-perus

Pour demeurer admissible au Revenu assur et au Programme d'accessibilit, vous devez dclarer tout changement qui pourrait avoir une incidence sur le montant de l'aide que vous recevez et/ou sur la partie que vous devez payer pour le Programme d'accessibilit. Vous devez informer votre agent de liaison si :

- vous subissez un changement radical dans vos revenus ou vos dpenses;
- votre situation familiale a chang, comme la naissance d'un enfant ou un divorce;
- vous avez t condamn  une peine de prison;
- vous tes hospitalis pendant plus de 30 jours d'affile.

#### Trop-perus

Si vous ne dclarez pas ces changements, il est possible que vous receviez une aide financire suprieure  celle  laquelle vous tes admissible. Cela sappelle un trop-peru. Si vous recevez un trop-peru, celui-ci sera enregistr dans votre dossier ainsi que la raison de ce trop-peru. Vous devrez alors remplir un formulaire d'accus de rception du trop-peru.

#### Paiement des trop-perus

Vous tes tenu de rembourser tout paiement excdentaire. Si vous recevez toujours de l'aide du Revenu assur et/ou du Programme d'accessibilit, le trop-peru sera rembours selon l'une des options suivantes :

- remboursement en un seul versement;
- une retenue sur vos droits mensuels, gnralement comprise entre 25 $ et 100 $ par mois;
- suspension de l'aide jusqu' ce que le montant soit rembours;
- une combinaison des options ci-dessus.

Si vous ne recevez plus d'aide du Revenu assur et/ou du Programme d'accessibilit ou si vous cessez de recevoir de l'aide du Revenu assur et/ou du Programme d'accessibilit alors que vous devez encore un trop-peru, le coordonnateur des trop-perus vous enverra une lettre  cet effet. Vous aurez 30 jours pour effectuer les modalits de remboursement qui ont dj t dcides ou pour contacter le dpartement.

Le coordonnateur des trop-perus peut prendre des mesures supplmentaires si ncessaire, par exemple :

- recouvrement par le coordonnateur des trop-perus;
- dpt d'un jugement contre votre proprit;
- enregistrement de votre dette auprs du [Programme de compensation de dettes du CRA](https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/about-canada-revenue-agency-cra/protecting-your-privacy/privacy-impact-assessment/individual-refund-set-off-program.html).

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est refuse?

content3.en-CA:
If your application is denied and you disagree with a decision that was made about your application, you have the right to appeal the decision. You can request an appeal up to 30 days from the day you receive written notice that your application is denied. In some cases you may receive verbal notification that your application has been denied before you receive written notification. In these cases, you must request written notification before you can begin the appeal process.

### Starting the Appeal Process

To start the appeal process, you or someone on your behalf must write a letter to the Social Assistance Appeal Board and send it or drop it off to the following address:

Social Assistance Appeal Board  
P.O. Box 2000  
11 Kent Street, Jones Building  
Charlottetown, P.E.I.  
C1A 7N8

The Appeals Administrative Assistant will review your letter and will forward a Notice of Appeal and your letter to the Chairperson of the Appeal Board.

### Scheduling the Appeal Hearing

The Chairperson will schedule a hearing within 15 calendar days after receiving the Notice of Appeal. You will receive a letter containing the date, time, and place of the appeal hearing. The Appeals Administrative Assistant will also call you to verbally confirm the date, time, and place of the appeal hearing.

### The Appeal Hearing

During the appeal hearing you will have the opportunity to provide information that is relevant to the decision you think was incorrectly made. Once all the information has been provided, the appeal hearing will end and you will be told when to expect a final decision from the Social Assistance Appeal Board.

### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:    | Then take this step:     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.       | Ensure that you are below 65 years of age.        |
| Your medical condition is not expected to last 12 months or more.       | Reapply when your condition is expected to last at least 12 months. If you believe your condition will last more than 12 months, ask your doctor if it will and if they are willing to provide documentation to show this.       |
| It is determined you have no restrictions in basic activities of daily living that require supports.        | Determine if you have restrictions in basic activities of daily living. If you do, provide medical proof of restrictions and appeal the decision.        |
content3.fr-CA:
Si votre demande est refuse et que vous n'tes pas d'accord avec la dcision qui a t prise  son gard, vous avez le droit de faire appel de cette dcision. Vous pouvez faire un appel dans un dlai de 30 jours  compter de la date de rception de l'avis crit du refus de votre demande. Dans certains cas, vous pouvez recevoir un avis verbal du refus de votre demande avant de recevoir un avis crit. Dans ce cas, vous devez demander un avis crit avant de pouvoir entamer la procdure d'appel.

### Dbut de la procdure d'appel

Pour entamer la procdure d'appel, vous ou une personne en votre nom devez crire une lettre  la Commission d'appel de l'assistance sociale et l'envoyer ou la dposer  l'adresse suivante :

Commission d'appel de l'assistance sociale

11, rue Kent, difice Jones  
Charlottetown, .-P.-E.  
C1A 7N8

L'assistant administratif charg des appels examinera votre lettre, il transmettra un avis d'appel et votre lettre au prsident de la commission d'appel.

### Fixer la date de l'audience d'appel

Le prsident fixera une audience dans les 15 jours civils suivant la rception de l'avis d'appel. Vous recevrez une lettre indiquant la date, l'heure et le lieu de l'audience d'appel. L'assistant administratif charg des appels vous appellera galement pour confirmer verbalement la date, l'heure et le lieu de l'audience d'appel.

### L'audience d'appel

Au cours de l'audience d'appel, vous aurez l'occasion de fournir des renseignements pertinents sur la dcision qui, selon vous, a t prise  tort. Une fois que tous les renseignements ont t fournis, l'audience d'appel prendra fin et on vous dira quand vous pouvez vous attendre  recevoir la dcision finale de la Commission d'appel de l'assistance sociale.

### Choisir la meilleure option si votre demande est refuse

Voici quelques raisons courantes pour lesquelles les gens se voient refuser des conseils sur la prochaine tape  suivre :

| Si votre demande a t refuse  cause des raisons suivantes:     | Alors, faites cette dmarche :     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| Vous n'avez pas l'ge requis.       | Assurez-vous davoir moins de 65 ans        |
| Votre tat de sant ne devrait pas durer 12 mois ou plus.       | Faites une nouvelle demande lorsque vous pensez que votre maladie durera au moins 12 mois. Si vous pensez que votre maladie durera plus de 12 mois, demandez  votre mdecin si c'est le cas et s'il est prt  fournir des documents pour le prouver.        |
| Il est dtermin que vous n'avez pas de restrictions dans les activits de base de la vie quotidienne qui ncessitent du soutien.       | Dterminez si vous avez des restrictions dans les activits de base de la vie quotidienne. Dans ce cas, fournissez une preuve mdicale des restrictions et faites appel de la dcision.        |

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in Prince Edward Island and who meet the necessary age, financial, and medical eligibility requirements may be eligible to receive financial assistance through the Assured Income program. In addition, people with disabilities who require personal supports may be eligible to receive support through AccessAbility Supports.

Each step involved in the application process for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports will be described in detail in this guide.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes ayant un handicap qui rsident  lle-du-Prince-douard qui remplissent les critres dge, financiers et mdicaux admissibles pourraient tre en mesure de recevoir de laide de la part du programme du Revenu assur. De plus, les personnes ayant un handicap qui ncessitent un support personnel pourraient recevoir de laide de la part du Programme daccessibilit.

Le guide dcrira en dtail chaque tape du processus de demande pour le Programme daccessibilit et du Revenu assur.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved to receive Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports you could receive

- $342 for a food benefit
- $83 for essentials such as clothing and household supplies
- Up to $850 for accommodations for a single person without dependents
- Additional financial supports as deemed necessary
- Personalized supports to enable you to continue living at home

### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

You can apply for Assured Income if you are an Indigenous person living off Reserve. You are not eligible for Assured Income if you live on Reserve. If you need assistance and live on Reserve, you should contact your Band.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

To be eligible to receive support through the Assured Income program and/or AccessAbility Supports, you must be under 65 years of age on the day you submit your application.

## Financial requirements

To determine if you are eligible to receive support through the Assured Income program, you will complete a financial assessment. The financial assessment will consider all types of income and assets you or your co-applicants have. For both programs, a co-applicant is a spouse, common-law partner, or any adult in your household above the age of 18 who has an income.

Applicants who qualify for Assured Income or who are under the age of 18 are not required to pay for their supports received through AccessAbility Supports. If you do not qualify for Assured Income but are eligible to receive personal supports through AccessAbility Supports, you will be expected to pay for a portion of the support. The portion you will need to pay is determined through the financial assessment.

### Assets

Assets are possessions or property you own. During the financial assessment, you must report all assets you own. To be eligible to receive financial support through the Assured Income program, a a single person without dependents can have up to $5,000 in assets.

#### Assets that do not impact your eligibility

Some specific types of assets are not considered when determining if you are eligible for Assured Income. This means you can own these types of assets without it influencing your eligibility for Assured Income or AccessAbility Supports. These types of assets include:

- Your principle residence
- One vehicle, which is not used primarily for recreational purposes
- Life insurance with a cash surrender value up to $5,000
- A prepaid funeral with a value up to $5,000
- A registered educational savings plan (RESP)
- A registered disability savings plan (RDSP)
- Personal belongings
- Property that is essential to operate a business that generates your income

### Earned Income

Some types of income can be earned through employment. This type of income is called Earned Income. Earned Income is partially exempt, which means you can keep a certain amount of Earned Income while receiving Assured Income. The first $500 is fully exempt plus 30% of any additional money earned above $500.

### Exempt Income

Some types of income are exempt from being considered when determining if you are eligible to receive Assured Income. These types of income are called Exempt Income. Exempt Income includes money earned from the following sources:

- Money withdrawn from a registered disability savings plan (RDSP)
- Money withdrawn from a registered education savings plan (RESP) when used for educational purposes
- Goods and services tax (GST) or harmonized sales tax (HST) rebate
- Child benefits received from the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) for dependent children of disabled or deceased CPP contributors
- Income tax refunds up to $5,000 for a single person without dependents

## Medical requirements

To be eligible to receive AccessAbility Supports and specific portions of the Assured Income program, you must meet the criteria to be considered a person with a disability. For the purposes of these supports, a person with a disability is an individual who:

- Has a substantial physical, intellectual, sensory, neurological, or mental impairment that is continuous or recurrent
- Has an impairment that is expected to last for at least one year
- Is limited in their ability to perform personal care, function in their community or a workplace, and perform activities of daily living due to their impairment

title.fr-CA: Prsenter une demande

content1.en-CA:
Here are the steps you can follow to apply for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports. Although they are two separate programs, you will complete the application process for both programs at the same time. Click Start step 1 at the bottom of this page. This will take you to step one.  At the bottom of each page there will be a Next button you can click once you have completed that step. If you have already completed a step, you can skip it. Go ahead and start by clicking on the step where you would like to start.

You can go through the steps at your own pace. If you need help at any step, go to the Help page to find out where you can get support with your application.

Please note: if you are in dire financial need, your Support Coordinator may follow a slightly different protocol so that you can receive financial support more quickly. These cases are rare, but if you are in this situation your Support Coordinator will work with you to ensure you complete all of the necessary steps.

title.en-CA: Have you completed the general screening?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous fait l'examen gnral?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to complete the general screening

To start the process of applying for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports, you must call the toll-free number at [1-877-569-0546](tel:18775690546). You will answer questions to determine if you meet the general eligibility criteria for Assured Income and AccessAbility Supports.

You will also schedule an appointment with a Support Coordinator and be instructed of the documents you need to bring with you for the in-person appointment.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour faire l'examen gnral

Pour entamer le processus de demande du Revenu assur et du Programme d'accessibilit, vous devez appeler au numro sans frais [1-877-569-0546](tel:18775690546) Vous rpondrez  des questions visant  dterminer si vous rpondez aux critres gnraux d'admissibilit au Revenu assur et au Programme d'accessibilit.

Vous prendrez galement rendez-vous avec un agent de liaison et serez inform des documents que vous devez apporter pour le rendez-vous en personne.

title.en-CA: Have you met with a Support Coordinator to complete a Support Needs Assessment?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rencontr un agent de liaison afin de remplir une valuation des besoins en matire de soutien?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to meet with a Support Coordinator to complete a Support Needs Assessment

During your appointment with a Support Coordinator, they will ask you questions about the supports you currently have and discuss your unmet needs. The Support Coordinator will explain details about the program funding. If you are approved by the Support Coordinator, a referral will be made to a program Assessor to complete a Functionality Assessment.

If you are not approved by the Support Coordinator, you have the option to appeal the decision. You can learn more about the appeals process in the section titled, After you apply - approved or denied, What happens if your application is denied?
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour rencontrer un agent de liaison pour remplir une valuation des besoins en matire de soutien

Lors de votre rendez-vous avec un agent de liaison, celui-ci vous posera des questions sur les soutiens dont vous bnficiez actuellement et discutera de vos besoins non satisfaits. Lagent de liaison vous expliquera en dtail le financement du programme.  Si vous tes approuv par l'agent de liaison, vous serez orient vers un valuateur de programme qui effectuera une valuation des capacits fonctionnelles.

Si vous n'tes pas approuv par lagent de liaison, vous avez la possibilit de faire appel de la dcision. Vous pouvez obtenir de plus amples renseignements au sujet du processus dappel dans la section qui sintitule: Que faire si votre demande est refuse?

title.en-CA: Have you completed the Capability Assessment?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous effectu lvaluation des capacits?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to complete the Capability Assessment

The Support Coordinator will schedule your appointment for the Capability Assessment once they have ensured that you meet the eligibility criteria to receive Assured Income and/or AccessAbility Supports. The Capability Assessment will be done at your home. Based on your functionality and your current unmet needs, the support you will require through AccessAbility Supports will be decided.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour raliser lvaluation des capacits.

La personne responsable de la coordination en matire de soutien vous donnera rendez-vous pour lvaluation des capacits aprs stre assure que vous remplissez les critres requis pour bnficier dun revenu assur ou du Programme daccessibilit. Lvaluation des capacits se fera  votre domicile. En se basant sur votre fonctionnalit et vos besoins actuels non satisfaits, une dcision sera prise au sujet du soutien dont vous aurez besoin par le biais du Programme d'accessibilit.

title.en-CA: Have you developed the Support Plan?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous labor le plan de soutien?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to develop the Support Plan

Based on your Capability Assessment and your current unmet needs, you and your Support Coordinator will develop a Support Plan. Your Support Plan can include supports that are funded, such as respite hours, or unfunded, such as referrals. Your Support Plan will be tailored to you and your needs.

Medical costs typically are not covered through the AccessAbility Supports program, but they may be covered by the Assured Income program, if you qualify.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour laborer le plan de soutien

En fonction de votre valuation des capacits et de vos besoins actuels non satisfaits, vous et la personne responsable de la coordination laborerez un plan en matire de soutien. Votre plan de soutien peut comprendre du soutien financ, tel que des heures de rpit, ou non financ, tel que des recommandations. Votre plan de soutien sera adapt  vous et  vos besoins.

Les frais mdicaux ne sont gnralement pas couverts par le Programme d'accessibilit, mais ils peuvent l'tre par le programme du Revenu assur, si vous y tes admissible.

title.en-CA: Have you completed the financial assessment?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rempli l'valuation financire?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to complete the financial assessment

During the financial assessment, it is necessary for you to report all sources of income for your household and all assets you own. This step will determine if you meet the financial requirements for Assured Income and if you are required to pay for a portion of any services you receive through AccessAbility Supports.

If you qualify for Assured Income or are under the age of 18, you will be exempt and will not have to pay for a portion of the resources provided through AccessAbility Supports.

If you are eligible to receive AccessAbility Supports but do not meet the financial requirements for Assured Income, you will be required to pay for a portion of the resources provided. The amount you will need to pay will be determined through a financial assessment calculation for you and the members of your household.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour remplir l'valuation financire

Pendant l'valuation financire, vous devez dclarer toutes les sources de revenus de votre mnage et tous les biens que vous possdez. Cette tape permettra de dterminer si vous rpondez aux exigences financires du Revenu assur et si vous devez payer une partie des services que vous recevez dans le cadre du Programme d'accessibilit.

Si vous avez droit au Revenu assur ou si vous avez moins de 18 ans, vous serez exempt et n'aurez pas  payer pour une partie des ressources fournies par le Programme d'accessibilit.

Si vous tes admissible au Programme d'accessibilit mais que vous ne remplissez pas les critres financiers du Revenu assur, vous devrez payer une partie des ressources fournies. Le montant que vous devrez payer sera dtermin par un calcul d'valuation financire pour vous et les membres de votre foyer.

title.en-CA: You are at the end of the steps

content.en-CA:
## Congratulations!

Congratulations! You have completed all the steps.  If your application has been approved or denied, please see the next section titled After you apply - approved or denied for next steps.

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in Quebec and who meet the necessary age, financial, and ability to work requirements may be eligible to receive disability benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan.

Each step involved in the application process for disability benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan will be described in detail in this guide. You can leave the site and come back later when you have more time, energy, and the documents you may need to complete a step.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes ayant un handicap rsidant au Qubec qui remplissent les critres d'ge, de situation financire et de capacit  travailler peuvent tre admissibles  des prestations d'invalidit en vertu du Rgime de rentes du Qubec.

Le guide dcrira en dtail chaque tape du processus de demande pour les prestations d'invalidit en vertu du Rgime de rentes du Qubec. Vous pouvez quitter le site et y revenir plus tard lorsque vous aurez plus de temps, d'nergie et les documents dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour finaliser cette tape.

content2.en-CA:
### If you are approved to receive disability benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan you could receive

- If you are under age 60: A fixed amount of $583.29 per month, plus an additional amount that depends on your employment earnings and contributions to the Quebec Pension Plan
- If you are between 60 and 65: A disability pension in the amount of $583.29 (2024), plus a retirement pension under theQPP. The amount of your retirement pension depends on your employment earnings and the age at which you begin receiving your pension.

### I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

Indigenous persons are also eligible for Disability Benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan. You will follow the same steps to apply as non-Indigenous individuals.
content2.fr-CA:
### Si votre demande de prestations dinvalidit du Rgime de rentes du Qubec est accepte, vous pourriez recevoir

- Si vous avez moins de 60ans: un montant fixe de 583,29$ par mois, plus un montant supplmentaire qui dpend de vos revenus demploi et de vos cotisations au Rgime de rentes du Qubec.
- Si vous avez entre 60 et 65ans: une rente dinvalidit de 583,29$ (2024), plus une rente de retraite du RRQ. Le montant de votre rente de retraite dpend de vos revenus demploi et de lge auquel vous commencez  recevoir votre rente.

### Je suis autochtone. Le processus est-il diffrent pour moi?

Les personnes autochtones sont galement admissibles aux prestations d'invalidit du Rgime de rentes du Qubec. Vous suivrez les mmes tapes de candidature que les personnes non autochtones.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

You can file an application for disability pension if you are under the age of 65 years old. The amounts that you can receive will depend on your age.

__If you are under age60__, the disability pensionthat you will receive each month will be made up of:

- A fixed amount of $583.29
- A variableamount depending on your employment earnings.

__If you are between ages 60 and 65__, each month you willreceive:

- a disability pension. For2024, the amount is $583.29.
- a retirement pension under theQPP. Amounts are calculatedbased on employment earnings you have had since you turned18 and varies based on the age at which you begin receiving your retirement pension.

## Financial requirements

To be eligible for QPP disability benefits, you must have contributed to the QPP during your contributory period. The contributory period begins the month after your 18th birthday. The contributory benefits ends at the end of the month that you become disabled.

If you are under the age of 60,you are eligible to receive a disability pension if either:

- You contributed for at least two of the last three years in your contributoryperiod,
- You contributed for at least five of the last 10 years in your contributoryperiod, OR
- You contributed for half of the years in your contributory period and for at least twoyears.

If you are between ages 60 and 65, you could receive a disability pension if you contributed at least three of the last six years in your contributoryperiod.

While receiving disability benefits under the QPP, you can have a gross annual employment income that is not greater than $20,746. If you employment income is greater than the amount, you must [contact Retraite Quebec](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/nous-joindre/Pages/nous-joindre.aspx) by telephone or in writing.

## Ability to work

You can file an application for a disability pensionif you stop working or your employment earnings decrease considerably because of disability.

To receive a disability pension, Retraite Qubec's medical advisors need to deem you as having a severe and permanent medical condition. A severe and permanent medical condition is one that is considered to have an indefinite duration with no possibility of improvement and is one that prevents you from doing any type of work on a full-time basis. A disability is not considered severeif you can do work adapted to yourlimitations. 

It is not expected that you work while receiving disability benefits under the QPP. If you do return to work or there is a change in your earnings, it could impact your eligibility to receive the disability benefits.

### Returning to work while receiving disability benefits under the QPP

If you return to work while you are receiving disability benefits under the QPP, a number of factors will be assessed including your:

- Gross pay (before taxes)
- Net income from a business (if you are self-employed)
- Taxable benefits (example: housing, automobile, salary and group insurance premiums, etc.)
- Net remuneration generated as an intermediate resource or family-type resource (after deducting expenses for assistance or replacement services)
- Vacation pay and bonuses
- Income derived from public office (for example: a city councillor)
- Rental income for which you are required to do work

If it is decided that you are no longer eligible for disability benefits under the QPP, you will receive disability benefits for three months following the month during which you returned to work and then the payments will stop.

### Reapplying for disability benefits under the QPP

If you return to work and then must stop due to your disability within 24 months, you can reapply for disability benefits using the [abridged application for disability benefits under the QPP](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/SiteCollectionDocuments/www.rrq.gouv.qc/Anglais/formulaires/regime_rentes/invalidite/B004_en.pdf). This will allow for your application to be processed on a priority basis.

If it has been longer than 24 months, you will need to fill out a new application.
