title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs avoir dpos une demande - approuve ou refuse

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Congratulations! You have been approved to receive disability benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan. Once you are approved, you will be informed by mail. Your first payment will start the fourth month from the date Retraite Quebec deems that you have become disabled.

Your payments will be made by [direct deposit](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/services/services_en_ligne/depot_direct/Pages/depot_direct.aspx) or cheque. To see the specific dates your payments will be sent, you can see the [Quebec Pension Plan Payment Dates](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/dates-de-paiement/Pages/dates-de-paiement.aspx).

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

There are additional programs that may be better suited for your needs such as the [Social Solidarity Program](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity#c67408). If you are a person with a severely limited capacity for employment, this program can provide financial assistance and can promote your integration in your community. Examples of severe employment restrictions include:

- Mental disorders, such as neurosis or psychosis
- Intellectual disability, mental retardation or amnesia
- Chronic illness
- Hearing impairment
- The aftermath of an accident
- The inability to move around
- Inability to understand linguistic symbols due to language disruption

This program is administered by the Ministre du Travail, de lEmploi et de la Solidarit sociale (MTESS)and has a separate application process. To see the complete application process, you can see the [Application for Financial Assistance](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity/how-to-apply).

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

To ensure that you are still eligible to receive disability benefits under the QPP, you must be certain to report any changes that could impact your eligibility. This includes:

- If you move (either outside of Quebec or within the province)
- If your health improves
- If you return to work
- If you have children

If you do not report these changes you could receive more financial support than you are eligible to receive. This is called an overpayment. You will be required to pay back the overpayment. If you receive an overpayment, you will be given more instructions on how to repay the amount you owe.

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est refuse?

content3.en-CA:
If your application is denied, you may not meet the eligibility requirements to receive disability benefits under the QPP. However, if you disagree with a decision that was made about your application, you may choose to undergo the appeals process. This process involves two steps: requesting a review and filing an appeal.

### Requesting a Review

If you disagree with a decision that was made about your application for disability benefits under the QPP, you can request a review. A review must be requested within 90 days of when the decision was made. To file an [application for review](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/services/formulaires/regime_rentes/demande_revision/Pages/demande_revision.aspx), you must complete an Application for Review form or write a letter explaining why you disagree with the decisions and include any relevant proof.

Once you have completed the [Application for Review](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/services/formulaires/regime_rentes/demande_revision/Pages/demande_revision.aspx) or written a letter, they can be submitted [online](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/services-en-ligne-outils/Pages/transmettre-un-document-par-internet.aspx) or mailed to the following address:

Retraite Quebec  
Case postale 5200  
Quebec (Quebec)  
G1K 7S9 

### Filing an Appeal

If you disagree with a review decision, you can file an appeal with the [Administrative Tribunal of Quebec](https://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/en). This appeal must be filed within 60 days of the date the decision you disagree with was made.

Your appeal can be filed using the online [appeal form](https://riil.servicestaq.gouv.qc.ca/taq.riil.presentation/?lang=en), using the [PDF appeal form](https://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/documents/file/publications/formulaires/recours-introductif/formulaire_recours_introductif_ang.pdf), or by writing a letter. If you choose to write a letter, you must include the following information:

- Your name and contact information
- Your lawyers or representatives name and contact information, if applicable
- Why you are challenging the decision and what you want as a situation
- The decision you are challenging and all relevant documents (example: medical reports)
- A fee of $87 by cheque, money-order, or the banking information for a credit card.

Once your appeal is complete, you can submit it [online](https://riil.servicestaq.gouv.qc.ca/taq.riil.presentation/?lang=en) or to one of the [offices of the Tribunal](https://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/en/contact-us) or the offices of the [Court of Quebec, Small Claims Division](https://www.justice.gouv.qc.ca/nous-joindre/trouver-un-palais-de-justice/).

During the appeal hearing, you and a representative from the department will have the opportunity to present evidence. The Tribunal will have up to 3 months to make a final decision, which will be sent to you in writing by mail.

### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:     | Then take this step:    |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.        | Wait until you are at least 18 years old and reapply.       |
| You do not meet the financial criteria.       | You may not meet the necessary criteria. If you disagree with the decision that was made, you can request an appeal.       |
| You are between the ages of 60 -65 and you did not contribute to the QPP in at least 3 of the last 6 years of your contributory period.       | You do not meet the criteria for disability benefits through the QPP, but you may still receive some additional financial support.        |
content3.fr-CA:
Si votre demande est refuse, il se peut que vous ne rpondiez pas aux critres d'admissibilit pour recevoir des prestations d'invalidit en vertu du RRQ. Cependant, si vous n'tes pas d'accord avec une dcision qui a t prise au sujet de votre demande, vous pouvez choisir de suivre la procdure d'appel. Cette procdure comporte deux tapes : la demande de rvision et le dpt d'un appel.

### Demander une rvision

Si vous n'tes pas d'accord avec une dcision qui a t prise au sujet de votre demande de prestations d'invalidit dans le cadre du RRQ, vous pouvez demander une rvision. Une rvision doit tre demande dans un dlai de 90 jours  compter de la date  laquelle la dcision a t prise. Pour dposer une demande de rvision, vous devez remplir un formulaire [de demande de rvision](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/fr/services/formulaires/regime_rentes/demande_revision/Pages/demande_revision.aspx) ou crire une lettre expliquant pourquoi vous n'tes pas d'accord avec les dcisions et joindre toute preuve pertinente.

Une fois que vous avez rempli la [demande de rvision](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/fr/services/formulaires/regime_rentes/demande_revision/Pages/demande_revision.aspx) ou crit une lettre, elles peuvent tre soumises [en ligne](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/fr/services-en-ligne-outils/Pages/transmettre-un-document-par-internet.aspx) ou par la poste  ladresse suivante:

Retraite Qubec  
Case postale 5200  
Qubec (Qubec)  
G1K 7S9

### Dposer un appel

Si vous n'tes pas d'accord avec une dcision de rvision, vous pouvez faire appel auprs du Tribunal administratif du Qubec. Cet appel doit tre dpos dans les 60 jours suivant la date  laquelle la dcision que vous contestez a t prise.

Votre appel peut tre dpos en utilisant le [formulaire d'appel en ligne](https://riil.servicestaq.gouv.qc.ca/taq.riil.presentation/?lang=fr), ou en crivant une lettre.  Si vous choisissez d'crire une lettre, vous devez fournir les renseignements suivants:

- votre nom et vos coordonnes;
- le nom et les coordonnes de votre avocat ou reprsentant, le cas chant;
- la raison pour laquelle vous contestez la dcision et ce que vous dsirez comme rsultat;
- la dcision que vous contestez et tous les documents pertinents (par exemple, les rapports mdicaux);
- un paiement de 87 $ pay par chque, mandat ou carte de crdit en fournissant les renseignements bancaires.

Une fois que votre appel est complet, vous pouvez le soumettre [en ligne](https://riil.servicestaq.gouv.qc.ca/taq.riil.presentation/?lang=fr),  lun de nos [bureaux du Tribunal](https://www.taq.gouv.qc.ca/fr/nous-joindre) ou  lun de nos bureaux de la [Cour du Qubec, Division des petites crances](https://www.justice.gouv.qc.ca/nous-joindre/trouver-un-palais-de-justice/).  
Au cours de l'audience d'appel, un reprsentant du ministre et vous aurez l'occasion de prsenter des preuves. Le Tribunal aura jusqu' 3 mois pour prendre une dcision finale, qui vous sera envoye par crit par la poste.

### Choisir la meilleure option si votre demande est refuse

Voici quelques raisons courantes pour lesquelles les gens se voient refuser des conseils sur la prochaine tape  suivre :

| Si votre demande a t refuse  cause des raisons suivantes:     | Alors, faites cette dmarche :     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| Vous n'avez pas l'ge requis.       | Attendez d'avoir au moins 18 ans et refaites une demande.       |
| Vous ne remplissez pas les critres d'admissibilit financire.       | Vous ne remplissez peut-tre pas les critres ncessaires. Si vous n'tes pas d'accord avec la dcision qui a t prise, vous pouvez demander un appel.       |
| Vous avez entre 60 et 65 ans et vous n'avez pas cotis au RRQ pendant au moins 3 des 6 dernires annes de votre priode de cotisation.       | Vous ne rpondez pas aux critres d'admissibilit des prestations d'invalidit du RRQ, mais vous pouvez quand mme recevoir une aide financire supplmentaire.       |

title.fr-CA: Foires aux questions

lead.en-CA: Frequently asked questions about Disability Benefits Under the Quebec Pension Plan

content1.en-CA:
## What is the contributory period? When does it start and end?

The contributory period is the time in which you contribute to the Quebec Pension Plan. The contributory period beings the month after your 18th birthday. The contributory benefits ends at the end of the month that you become disabled.

## I received more income than the allowed annual gross amount. What do I do now?

You must [contact Retraite Quebec](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/nous-joindre/Pages/nous-joindre.aspx) by telephone or in writing and inform them of the additional income you received.

## If I do not report changes to my situation and receive an overpayment, will I be required to repay it?

Yes, if you receive an overpayment you will be required to repay it.
content1.fr-CA:
## Qu'est-ce que la priode de cotisation? Quand commence-t-elle et se termine-t-elle?

La priode de cotisation est la priode pendant laquelle vous cotisez au Rgime de rentes du Qubec. La priode de cotisation commence le mois suivant votre 18e anniversaire. Les prestations contributives prennent fin  la fin du mois au cours duquel vous devenez invalide.

## J'ai reu un revenu suprieur au montant brut annuel autoris. Que puis-je faire  ce stade?

Vous devez [communiquer avec Retraite Qubec](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/fr/nous-joindre/Pages/nous-joindre.aspx) par tlphone ou par crit et informez-les du revenu supplmentaire que vous avez reu.

## Si je ne dclare pas de changements dans ma situation et que je reois un trop-peru, serai-je tenu de le rembourser?

Oui, si vous avez reu un trop-peru, vous devrez le rembourser.

title.en-CA: Have you completed the Application for Disability Benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rempli la demande de prestations pour invalidit du Rgime de rentes du Qubec?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to complete the Application for Disability Benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan

Once you have downloaded your [Application for Disability Benefits Under the Quebec Pension Plan](https://www.rrq.gouv.qc.ca/en/services/formulaires/regime_rentes/rente_invalidite/Pages/rente_invalidite.aspx), you will need to complete the application by typing into the form. Read all of the information carefully and make sure to include all relevant information.

This form should be submitted as soon as possible. The maximum retroactivity possible is 12 months from the day your application is received. You will need to complete additional steps, but these can be completed after your form has been submitted. In some cases, you may also be able to receive QPP while you are waiting for your disability benefits to be processed.

### Additional payments for children

If you have children, they could also be entitled to a pension for a disabled contributors child until they reach the age of 18. Your child could be eligible if they:

- Are your biological or adopted child
- Have been living with you for at least one year at the time you are deemed disabled and you are their mother or father

Lisez attentivement tous les renseignements et assurez-vous de fournir tous les renseignements pertinents.

Ce formulaire doit tre soumis ds que possible. La rtroactivit maximale possible est de 12 mois  compter du jour de la rception de votre demande. Vous devrez effectuer des dmarches supplmentaires, mais celles-ci peuvent tre ralises aprs l'envoi de votre formulaire. Dans certains cas, vous pouvez galement bnficier de la RRQ pendant que vous attendez le traitement de vos prestations d'invalidit.

- est votre enfant biologique ou adopt;
- vivait avec vous depuis au moins un an au moment lorsque vous avez t reconnu invalide et vous tes leur pre ou leur mre.

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to send in the Application for Disability Benefits under the Quebec Pension Plan

Your application should be submitted as soon as possible. The maximum retroactivity possible is 12 months from the day your application is received. You will need to complete additional steps, but these can be completed after your form has been submitted. In some cases, you may also be able to receive QPP while you are waiting for your disability benefits to be processed.

### Submitting your application

You can submit your application two different ways: by [submitting your form online](https://www.retraitequebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/services-en-ligne-outils/Pages/transmettre-un-document-par-internet.aspx) or by mailing your application to Retraite Quebec.

### Submitting your application online

The first option to submit your application is to submit your form online. To submit the form online, save the document to your computer and then upload it as instructed.

### Submitting your application by mail

The second option to submit your application is to print the form and mail it to the following address:

Retraite Quebec  
Case postale 5200  
Quebec (Quebec)  
G1K 7S9

Cette demande doit tre soumise ds que possible. La rtroactivit maximale possible est de 12 mois  compter du jour de la rception de votre demande. Vous devrez effectuer des dmarches supplmentaires, mais celles-ci peuvent tre ralises aprs l'envoi de votre formulaire. Dans certains cas, vous pouvez galement bnficier de la RRQ pendant que vous attendez le traitement de vos prestations d'invalidit.

### Soumettre votre demande

Vous pouvez soumettre votre demande de deux faons diffrentes : en soumettant votre formulaire en ligne ou en envoyant votre demande par la poste  Retraite Qubec.

### Soumettre votre demande en ligne

title.en-CA: Have you been approved for disability benefits under the QPP?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous t approuv pour des prestations d'invalidit en vertu du RRQ?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need if you have not been approved for disability benefits under the QPP

You are not alone! If you were not approved for disability benefits under the QPP and you disagree with a decision that was made about your application, you may be able to request an appeal. For more information about the appeals process, you can see the section titled After you apply - approved or denied, What happens if your application is denied?.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
## Age requirement

To be eligible to receive Social Assistance and the Supplementary Allowance, you must be between the ages of 19 and 64.

## Financial requirements

To be eligible to receive Social Assistance and the Supplementary Allowance, you must have financial need. This means that you and/or your spouse do not make enough money to meet your basic needs. Basic needs are things like shelter, food, and utilities.

To assess your financial need, the total cost of your basic needs will be calculated as well as your income for the last 31 days. If your total income was less than the cost of your basic needs, you will likely be eligible for Social Assistance.

Income can come from a variety of sources including:

- Employment
- Employment insurance (EI)
- Pension money (CPP/OAS/GIS/CPPD)
- Child support or maintenance
- Financial assistance from other services
- Financial assistance from other locations
- e-transfers, money transfers, gifts or other deposits
- Loans (for example, personal, student or payday loans)
- Grants, bursaries, scholarships
- Inuvialuit Regional Corporation Distribution payment
- Dividends or entitlements from a First Nation
- Assets that can be quickly and easily exchanged for cash

### Excluded Income

Some specific sources of income will not impact your eligibility for Social Assistance. These sources of income are called Excluded Income. This includes income from the following sources:

- Canada child benefit
- GST
- Disability tax credit
- Extended family care agreement

title.en-CA: After you apply  approved or denied
title.fr-CA: Aprs votre demande  approuve ou refuse

content2Title.en-CA: What happens when your application is approved?
content2Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il lorsque votre demande est approuve?

content2.en-CA:
Congratulations! You have been approved to receive Social Assistance and the Supplementary Allowance. Any change in your circumstances and your need for financial assistance will be assessed each month  by submitting your monthly Assistance form (MAF) or your Assistance application card (ARC) to report your monthly income and submit the required documentation.

The required documentation could include:

- Utility bills;
- Job search documentation, if requested;
- Rent receipts;
- Pay stubs;
- Bank statements; and
- Proof of child support or maintenance

### Other supplemental benefits you may receive

Once you are approved to receive Social Assistance, you can request approval to receive assistance for prescriptions if you are not eligible for funding through other programs. You will need to get approval before buying prescription drugs. If you do not, it is unlikely you will get reimbursed. Generally, low-cost, generic prescriptions are covered.

### To Keep Your Information Up-to-Date and Avoid Overpayments

If there are any changes to your situation that could impact your eligibility for Social Assistance or the amount you receive, you must report it. If you do not report changes to your situation, you could receive more than the amount you are eligible for. This is called an overpayment. If you receive an overpayment it is considered a debt and will need to be repaid.

Changes that could impact the amount of financial assistance include changes to your:

- Financial situation
- Family arrangement
- Living arrangements
- Disability or health
- Employment status

content3Title.en-CA: What happens if your application is denied?
content3Title.fr-CA: Que se passe-t-il si votre demande est refuse?

content3.en-CA:
If you are not approved to receive Social Assistance and the Supplementary Allowance, you can undergo the appeals process. There are two steps in the appeals process: review requests and appeals to the Supreme Court.

### Review Requests

The first step in the appeals process is the review request. The review request must be in submitted writing within 30 days of the date the decision was made. The review request must state the decision that you disagree with and the month it applies to.

A hearing will be held within 30 days from the day the review request was received. During the hearing you can present information that is relevant to the decision and explain why you disagree. The committee will then make a decision, which will be reported to the director. If the committee disagrees with the directors original decision, the director will reconsider their original decision, which will be retroactive to the date of their original decision.

### Appeals to the Supreme Court

If you still disagree with the decision made, you may appeal the decision to the Supreme Court. This request must be submitted in writing within 30 days of the day the committee made their decision. The Supreme Court may confirm the committees decision or refer the decision back to the committee for a second hearing.

### Choosing the best option if you are denied

Here are some common reasons that people are denied with advice on the next step to take:

| If you were denied because:     | Then take this step:     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| You do not meet the age requirement.       | Wait until you are at least 19 years old and reapply.       |
| Do you not meet the financial requirements.       | Reapply when your basic needs cost more than your monthly income.       |
| You do not qualify for the Supplemental Allowance.      | You can still receive Social Assistance without the Supplemental Allowance.        |
content3.fr-CA:
Si votre demande dassistance sociale et dallocation supplmentaire est refuse, vous pouvez faire appel. La procdure dappel comporte deux tapes : la demande de rvision et le recours devant la Cour suprme.

### Demande de rvision

La premire tape de la procdure dappel est la demande de rvision. La demande de rvision doit tre soumise par crit dans les 30 jours suivant la date  laquelle la dcision a t prise. La demande de rvision doit prciser la dcision que vous contestez et le mois auquel elle sapplique.

Une audience sera organise dans les 30 jours suivant la rception de la demande de rvision. Au cours de cette audience, vous pouvez prsenter des arguments pertinents et expliquer pourquoi vous ntes pas daccord avec la dcision. La commission prendra alors une dcision qui sera communique au directeur. Si la commission nest pas daccord avec la dcision initiale du directeur, ce dernier rvisera sa dcision initiale de faon rtroactive  la date de sa dcision initiale.

### Appels  la Cour suprme

Si vous ntes toujours pas daccord avec la dcision prise, vous pouvez faire appel de cette dcision auprs de la Cour suprme. Cette demande doit tre soumise par crit dans les 30 jours suivant le jour o la commission a pris sa dcision. La Cour suprme peut confirmer la dcision de la commission ou renvoyer la dcision  la commission pour une seconde audience.

### Choisir la meilleure option en cas de refus

Voici quelques raisons frquentes pour lesquelles les gens se voient refuser ainsi que des conseils sur la prochaine tape  suivre :

| Si votre demande a t refuse parce que :     | Alors, faites cette dmarche :     |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| Vous navez pas lge requis.      | Attendez davoir au moins 19 ans pour refaire une demande.      |
| Vous ne remplissez pas les conditions financires.       | Refaites une demande lorsque vos besoins essentiels coteront plus que votre revenu mensuel.       |
| Vous navez pas droit  lallocation supplmentaire.       | Vous pouvez toujours bnficier de lassistance sociale sans lallocation supplmentaire.        |

title.fr-CA: Questions frquemment poses

lead.en-CA: Frequently asked questions about Social Assistance and the Supplementary Allowance

content1.en-CA:
## Do I need to report all forms of income, even if it wont influence my eligibility for Social Assistance?

Yes! You should report ALL forms of income, regardless of whether you think it will impact your eligibility for Social Assistance.

## Do I need to repay overpayments, if I receive one?

An overpayment occurs when you receive more financial support than you are eligible to receive. If this occurs, you will be required to pay back any additional financial support you received.

## How do I prevent an overpayment?

To prevent an overpayment, ensure that you report all changes that could influence your eligibility for Social Assistance or the amount of financial support you receive through Social Assistance.

## If I do not qualify for the Supplementary Allowance, can I still receive Social Assistance?

Yes. You do not need to qualify for the Supplementary Allowance to receive financial support through Social Assistance.
content1.fr-CA:
## Dois-je dclarer toutes les formes de revenus, mme si elles ne modifient pas mon admissibilit  lassistance sociale?

Oui! Vous devez dclarer TOUTES les formes de revenu, mme si vous pensez quelles nauront pas dincidence sur votre admissibilit  lassistance sociale.

## Dois-je rembourser les trop-perus, si jen reois un?

Un trop-peru se produit lorsque vous recevez une aide financire suprieure  celle  laquelle vous avez droit. Si tel est le cas, vous devrez rembourser laide financire supplmentaire que vous avez reue.

## Comment viter un trop-peru?

Pour viter un trop-peru, veillez  signaler tous les changements qui pourraient influencer votre admissibilit  lassistance sociale ou le montant de laide financire que vous recevez.

## Si je nai pas droit  lallocation supplmentaire, puis-je quand mme recevoir lassistance sociale?

Oui. Il nest pas ncessaire davoir droit  lallocation supplmentaire pour bnficier dune aide financire dans le cadre de lassistance sociale.

If you live in Whitehorse, you can call the [social assistance office](https://yukon.ca/en/legal-and-social-supports/community-supports/find-social-services-your-community) in your community to complete a pre-intake appointment over the phone. If the social worker thinks it is likely you are eligible, they will schedule an intake appointment. The social worker will also email you forms to complete for your intake appointment.

Si le travailleur social pense que vous tes probablement admissible, il vous donnera un rendez-vous dadmission. Le travailleur social vous enverra galement par courriel des formulaires  remplir pour votre rendez-vous dadmission.

title.en-CA: Have you collected the necessary documentation for the intake appointment?
title.fr-CA: Avez-vous rassembl les documents ncessaires pour le rendez-vous dadmission?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to collect the necessary documentation for the intake appointment

Prior to your intake appointment, make sure to collect all necessary documentation for yourself and your partner, if you have one. The necessary documentation includes:

- 2 pieces of personal identification (ID) for each family member
- A rental form, lease agreement or mortgage information
- Documents that show money or assets such as a notice of assessment of your last tax return or pay stubs
- Thesocial assistance report form that the social worker emailed to you
- The employment history form that the social worker emailed to you
- Bank statements from the past 90 days.Make sure these are printed on the date of your intake!

title.en-CA: Have you attended the intake appointment?
title.fr-CA: Vous tes-vous prsent au rendez-vous dadmission?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to attend the intake appointment

During your intake appointment, the social worker will review the documentation you have collected to determine if you are eligible to receive Social Assistance. If you are married or live with you partner, they must attend the intake appointment too. You may also bring a support person with you.
content.fr-CA:
## Voici les renseignements dont vous aurez besoin pour vous prsenter au rendez-vous dadmission

Lors de votre rendez-vous dadmission, le travailleur social examinera les documents que vous avez rassembls afin de dterminer si vous avez droit  lassistance sociale. Si vous tes mari ou si vous vivez avec votre partenaire, celui-ci doit galement tre prsent au rendez-vous dadmission. Vous pouvez galement tre accompagn par une personne de confiance.

title.en-CA: Have you been approved to receive the Supplementary Allowance?
title.fr-CA: Votre demande dallocation supplmentaire a-t-elle t approuve?

content.en-CA:
## Here is the information you will need to request to receive the Supplementary Allowance

If you have a severe or long-term disability that impacts your ability to be employed or you are receiving Old Age Security, you could be eligible for the Yukon Supplementary Allowance. For more information and to apply for the allowance, contact your case manager or call the Yukon Supplementary Allowance at [867-667-5674](tel:8676675674).

Pour de plus amples renseignements et pour faire une demande dallocation, communiquez avec votre charg de cas ou appelez le bureau de lallocation supplmentaire du Yukon au [867-667-5674](tel:8676675674).

content.en-CA:
You will need a doctor and/or medical professional to fill in the medical forms which are part of some benefits application process (Disability Tax Credit, Canada Pension Plan-Disability and provincial and territorial benefits).

If you do not already have a doctor who knows you, your medical history and how you are impacted in your daily living with a disability, please see below on how to find a doctor who will work with you.

title.fr-CA: Prsentation

content1.en-CA:
People with disabilities who live in Quebec and who meet the necessary age, financial, and resident criteria may be eligible to receive benefits under the Social Solidarity and the Basic Income Programs.

Both programs help individuals and families living with a long-term disability that [severely limits your capacity for employment](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity#c67410).

To receive the Basic Income Program, you must first apply for and receive the Social Solidarity Program. Once you are approved for the Social Solidarity Program you do not need to apply for the Basic Income Program. You will automatically receive it if you meet the eligibility requirements.

Each step involved in the application process for the Social Solidary Program will be described in detail in this module. You can leave the site and come back later when you have more time, energy, and the documents you may need to complete a step.

__Please note__: You may need a doctor or other medical professional to fill out parts of the application on your behalf, to confirm your disability.
content1.fr-CA:
Les personnes ayant un handicap qui habitent au Qubec remplissant les critres d'ge, de situation financire et de rsidence pourraient tre admissibles  recevoir des mesures daide dans le cadre du Programme de solidarit sociale et du Programme de revenu de base.

Ces deux programmes aident les personnes et les familles aux prises avec une invalidit de longue dure qui prsentent des [contraintes svres  lemploi](https://www.quebec.ca/famille-et-soutien-aux-personnes/aide-sociale-et-solidarite-sociale#c67410).

Pour bnficier du Programme de revenu de base, vous devez d'abord faire une demande et recevoir le Programme de solidarit sociale. Une fois que vous avez t approuv au Programme de solidarit sociale, vous n'avez pas besoin de faire une demande au Programme de revenu de base. Vous le recevrez automatiquement si vous remplissez les critres d'admissibilit.

Ce module dcrira en dtail chaque tape du processus de demande pour le Programme de solidarit sociale. Vous pouvez quitter le site pour y revenir plus tard lorsque vous aurez plus de temps et d'nergie, ainsi que les documents dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour accomplir une tape.

__Remarque__: Vous pourriez avoir besoin dun mdecin ou dun autre professionnel des soins de sant pour remplir certaines parties de la demande en votre nom, afin de confirmer votre invalidit.

title.fr-CA: Foires aux questions

lead.en-CA: Frequently asked questions about the Social Solidarity Program and Basic Income Program.
lead.fr-CA: Questions frquemment poses sur la programme de solidarit sociale et Programme de revenu de base.

content1.en-CA:
## Can income be earned without reducing the Social Solidarity benefit amount?

### For the amount for 1 adult

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount. Theallowablework incomein the case of1adultis$200.The benefit may or maynotinclude an additional amount.

### For the spouse of a student

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount. Theallowablework incomein the case ofthe spouse of a studentis$200. The benefit may or maynotinclude an additional amount.

### For an independent adult undergoing social reintegration

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount. Theallowablework incomein the case ofan independent adultresiding in a halfway houseis$200.

### For an independent adult receiving addiction services

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount. Theallowablework incomein the case ofan independent adult receiving addiction servicesis$200.

### For a minor sheltered with her dependent child

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount.Theallowablework incomein the case ofa minor sheltered with her dependent childis$200.

### Amount for two adults

Income may be earned without reducing the benefit amount. Theallowablework income in the case of2 adultsis$300.The benefit may or may not include an additional amount.

## When are the Social Solidarity benefits paid?

The Social Solidarity benefits are paid each month. The amounts may be deposited directly into your bank account or mailed to you in the form of a cheque.For the current year (2024), the payment dates are below:

- February 1
- March 1
- March 31
- May 1
- June 1
- June 29
- August 1
- September 1
- September 29
- November 1
- December 1
- December 28

## How can I view the amount and date of my next Social Solidarity benefit payment?

You can view the amount and the date of your next benefit payments in your online file by logging into your [My Account](https://mondossier.mtess.gouv.qc.ca/en/Portail/Index?returnUrl=%2Fen).

## Can I receive my Social Solidarity benefits directly into my bank account?

You can receive your benefit directly into your bank account by direct deposit on fixed dates.  It is a fast and immediate way to get access to your money. You can register for direct deposit by following these easy steps:

- download the[Direct Deposit Registration Form (SR-2301-01A)(PDF459 Kb)](https://cdn-contenu.quebec.ca/cdn-contenu/adm/min/emploi-solidarite-sociale/aide-sociale-solidarite-sociale/FO-SR-2301-01A-direct-deposit-registr-form-employ-assist-en.pdf)online or
- pick up the form at a[Services Qubecoffice](https://www.localisateur.servicesquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en)
- Complete the form and enclose a blank cheque marked Void or a bank statement from your financial institution, and to check the Registration box on the form.
- Mail it or drop it off in person at a Services Qubec office or a CLE.
- If you are already registered for direct deposit and want to change your banking information, check the Change of account box on the form.

## I am Indigenous. Is the journey different for me?

- __I live on a reserve__: You would not be eligible for the Social Solidarity program as the band council of the reserve where you live provides your support.
- __I live in a community in one of the northern villages__: Complete the Social Solidarity application form for a full assessment of your eligibility for this benefit.
- __I live in a community in one of the Cree villages__: Complete the Social Solidarity application form for a full assessment of your eligibility for this benefit.
- __I live elsewhere in Quebec__: Complete the Social Solidarity application form for a full assessment of your eligibility for this benefit.

## Who can I call if I have any questions about the Social Solidarity Program or the Basic Income Program?

You can call one of these numbers:

- __Montralarea__:[514-873-4000](tel:5148734000)
- __Elsewhere inQubec__:[1-877-767-8773 (toll free)](tel:18777678773)

Thisservice is available from 8:30am to 4:30pm. You can also contact these programs by email, using a form on the[Emploi-Qubec contact page](https://www.emploiquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/contact-us/)

## How will I know if I have been approved to get the Basic Income Program benefits?

A few weeks before getting your first payment, you will be notified that you have been admitted into the Basic Income Program.

## Can I still earn income and receive the Basic Income program benefits?

You can work to earn more money without affecting your benefit amount.  You can also have more property and more money without it reducing your benefit. You can earn up to $14,532 (2024) per year without your benefit being decreased. If you earned more than this amount during the year, your benefit will be reduced for the following year. Every dollar earned that is higher than $14,532 will reduce your annual benefit by 55 cents ($0.55).

## Can I have someone help me in the review process if my application is denied?

You can have a person of your choice or someone from an organization help you. You can even be represented by a lawyer if you prefer. If you want the reviewers to contact the person who you have chosen to assist you, indicate that in section 5 of the form.

## How will I be informed about the decision made from the review?

You will receive a copy of the decision in the mail and if you have a lawyer or another person who assisted you, they will also get a copy of the decision.  The Services Qubec department will be notified of the decision, and they will pay you if that is the decision.

## If I do not agree with the review decision, can I appeal it?

You have 60 days to file an appeal with the Tribunal administratif du Qubec (TAQ). If the Bureau de revision does not give you a decision within 90 days following the date of receipt of your application for review, or within 90 days of the date on which you presented your case or submitted your documents, you may file an appeal directly with the TAQ.
content1.fr-CA:
## Est-il possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation?

### Pour le montant dun adulte

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation. Le revenu autoris dans le cas d'un adulte est de 200$.La prestation peut comprendre ou non un montant supplmentaire.

### Pour le conjoint dun tudiant

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation. Le revenu autoris dans le cas dun conjoint d'un tudiant est de 200$. La prestation peut comprendre ou non un montant supplmentaire.

### Pour un adulte seul en rinsertion sociale

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation. Le revenu autoris dans le cas d'un adulte seul rsidant dans une maison de transition est de 200$.

### Pour un adulte seul recevant des services en toxicomanie

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation. Le revenu autoris dans le cas d'un adulte seul recevant des services en toxicomanie est de 200$.

### Pour un mineur hberg avec son enfant  charge

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation.Le revenu autoris dans le cas d'un mineur hberg avec son enfant  charge est de 200$.

### Pour deux adultes

Il est possible de toucher un revenu sans rduire le montant de la prestation. Le revenu autoris dans le cas de deux adultes est de 300$.La prestation peut comprendre ou non un montant supplmentaire.

## Quand est-ce que les prestations de solidarit sociale sont verses?

Les prestations de solidarit sociale sont verses chaque mois. Les montants peuvent tre dposs directement dans votre compte bancaire ou vous tre envoys par la poste.Pour lanne en cours (2024), les dates de paiement sont indiques ci-dessous:

- 1<sup>er</sup> fvrier
- 1<sup>er</sup> mars
- 31 mars
- 1<sup>er</sup> mai
- 1<sup>er</sup> juin
- 29 juin
- 1<sup>er</sup> aot
- 1<sup>er</sup> septembre
- 29 septembre
- 1<sup>er</sup> novembre
- 1<sup>er</sup> dcembre
- 28 dcembre

## Comment puis-je connatre le montant et la date de mon prochain versement des prestations de solidarit sociale?

Vous pouvez consulter le montant et la date de vos prochains versements des prestations dans votre dossier en ligne en vous connectant  [Mon dossier](https://mondossier.mtess.gouv.qc.ca/fr/Portail/Index?returnUrl=%2Fen).

## Puis-je recevoir mes prestations de solidarit sociale directement dans mon compte bancaire?

Vous pouvez recevoir votre prestation directement dans votre compte bancaire par dpt direct  des dates fixes.  C'est un moyen rapide et instantan d'accder  votre argent. Vous pouvez vous inscrire au dpt direct en suivant les tapes suivantes:

- tlchargezla [Demande dadhsion au dpt direct  citoyen (SR-2301-01) (PDF 463 Ko)](https://cdn-contenu.quebec.ca/cdn-contenu/adm/min/emploi-solidarite-sociale/aide-sociale-solidarite-sociale/FO-SR-2301-01-dem-adhesion-depot-direct.pdf)en ligne; ou
- obtenez-la demande  un[bureau de Services Qubec](https://www.localisateur.servicesquebec.gouv.qc.ca/fr)
- vous devrez y joindre une formule de chque portant la mention  Annul  ou une attestation bancaire provenant de votre institution financire. Pour adhrer au dpt direct, cochez la case  Adhsion ;
- vous pourrez lenvoyer par la poste ou le dposer  un bureau de Services Qubec ou  un CLE;
- si vous tes dj inscrit au dpt direct et que vous souhaitez modifier vos renseignements bancaires, cochez la case  Changement de compte .

## Je suis Autochtone. Le processus est-il diffrent pour moi?

- __Je vis dans une rserve__ : Vous ntes pas admissible au Programme de solidarit sociale, car le conseil de bande de la rserve o vous rsidez vous fournit l'aide dont vous avez besoin.
- __Je rside dans une communaut situe dans l'un des villages nordiques__: Remplissez le formulaire de demande de solidarit sociale pour obtenir une valuation complte de votre admissibilit  cette prestation.
- __Je rside dans une communaut situe dans l'un des villages cris__: Remplissez le formulaire de demande de solidarit sociale pour obtenir une valuation complte de votre admissibilit  cette prestation.
- __Je rside ailleurs au Qubec__: Remplissez le formulaire de demande de solidarit sociale pour obtenir une valuation complte de votre admissibilit  cette prestation.

## Qui puis-je appeler si j'ai des questions sur le Programme de solidarit sociale ou le Programme de revenu de base?

Vous pouvez appeler l'un de ces numros:

- __Rgion de Montral et les environs__ :[514-873-4000](tel:5148734000)
- __Ailleurs au Qubec__ :[1-877-767-8773 (sans frais)](tel:18777678773)

Le service est offert __de 8h30  16h30__. Vous pouvez galement communiquer avec le service  la clientle de ces programmes par courriel, en consultant la [page des coordonnes dEmploi-Qubec](https://www.emploiquebec.gouv.qc.ca/pour-nous-joindre/).

## Comment saurai-je si ma demande de prestations auprs du Programme de revenu de base a t accepte?

Quelques semaines avant de recevoir votre premier versement, vous serez inform de votre admission au Programme de revenu de base.

## Puis-je continuer  gagner un revenu et  bnficier des prestations du Programme de revenu de base?

Vous pouvez travailler pour gagner plus d'argent sans que cela affecte le montant de votre prestation.  Vous pouvez galement avoir plus de biens et plus d'argent sans que cela rduise votre prestation. Vous pouvez gagner jusqu 14532 $ (2024) par anne sans que cela diminue le montant de votre prestation. Si vous avez gagn plus que cette somme durant lanne, votre prestation sera rduite lanne suivante. Chaque dollar gagn qui est plus lev que 14532 $ fera rduire votre prestation annuelle de 55 cents (0,55 $).

## Puis-je demander  quelqu'un de m'aider dans le traitement de la rvision si ma demande est rejete?

Vous pouvez vous faire aider par une personne de votre choix ou par un reprsentant dun organisme. Vous pouvez mme vous faire reprsenter par un avocat si vous le souhaitez. Si vous souhaitez que les rviseurs contactent la personne que vous avez choisie pour vous aider, indiquez-le dans la section 5 du formulaire.

## Comment serai-je inform(e) de la dcision prise  l'issue de la rvision?

Vous recevrez une copie de la dcision par la poste et si un avocat ou une autre personne vous a assist, ils recevront galement une copie de la dcision.  Le personnel travaillant dans le bureau de Services Qubec sera inform de la dcision et vous versera une somme si telle est la dcision prise.

## Si je ne suis pas d'accord avec la dcision de la rvision, puis-je la contester?

Vous avez 60 jours pour contester la dcision auprs du Tribunal administratif du Qubec (TAQ). Si le bureau de rvision ne rend pas de dcision dans les 90 jours suivant la date de rception de votre demande de rvision, ou dans les 90 jours suivant la date  laquelle vous avez prsent votre dossier ou soumis vos documents, vous pouvez contester la dcision directement auprs du TAQ.

definition.en-CA: A type of legal relationship between couples, part of the Civil Code of Qubec since 2002, which civil allows same-sex couples to unite because the federal marriage law did not allow them to marry.
definition.fr-CA: Un type de relation lgale entre les couples, faisant partie du Code civil du Qubec depuis 2002, qui permet aux couples de mme sexe de s'unir parce que la loi fdrale sur le mariage ne leur permettait pas de se marier.

definition.en-CA: A situation when two people remain in a marriage-like relationship but are not married and have not lived together for a minimum of a year.
definition.fr-CA: Une situation dans laquelle deux personnes restent dans une relation maritale, mais ne sont pas maries et n'ont pas rsid ensemble pendant un minimum d'un an.

definition.en-CA:
Examples of severe employment restrictions include:

- Mental disorders, such as neurosis or psychosis
- Intellectual disability, mental retardation, or amnesia
- Chronic illness
- Hearing impairment
- The aftermath of an accident
- The inability to move around
- Inability to understand linguistic symbols due to language disruption
The term liquid asset means what a person owns in cash or an equivalent form.
definition.fr-CA: Le terme biens liquides dsigne ce qu'une personne possde en argent ou sous une forme quivalente.

title.fr-CA: Admissibilit

content1.en-CA:
Important information before applying for the Social Solidarity Program:

> Before you apply for the Social Solidarity program, you may want to use the [SimulAide tool](https://www.simulaide.emploiquebec.gouv.qc.ca/index.php/728252?lang=en) provided by Emploi Quebec to assess whether you might be eligible to receive financial assistance.
> 
> To get this benefit, you must be an individual or family with a person living with a long-term disability that [severely limits your capacity for employment](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity#c67410).
content1.fr-CA:
Renseignements importants  connatre avant de prsenter une demande au Programme de solidarit sociale.

> 
> Pour obtenir cette mesure daide, vous devez tre une personne ou une famille aux prises avec une invalidit de longue dure qui prsente [des contraintes svres  lemploi](https://www.quebec.ca/famille-et-soutien-aux-personnes/aide-sociale-et-solidarite-sociale#c67410).

content2.en-CA:
## Requirements

### Age requirement

Conditions to be met if you are 18 years of age or older:

- You can show that your resources (money, property, earnings, benefits and income) are equal to or less than the [scales set by regulation](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity/calculating-basic-benefit/calculation-benefit).
- You live in Quebec.

Conditions to be met if you are 18 years old or younger:

- You can show that your resources (money, property, earnings, benefits and income) are equal to or less than the [scales set by regulation](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity/calculating-basic-benefit/calculation-benefit).
- You live in Quebec
- You are married or have already been married or are the parent of a dependent child.

### Identification requirements

To be eligible to apply you need confirmation of your Social Insurance Number (SIN) or your plastic Social Insurance Number (non-expired). You may also be asked to provide a document with your photograph issued by a public agency to verify your identity. If asked for this photograph, you will need to go into one of the Social Assistance offices.  If you apply online using My Account  Employment Assistance  Social Assistance and are using clicSQUR, you will not have to provide this proof.

content3.en-CA:
## Basic Income Program

There are no steps you need to take to get the Basic Income Program benefits if you are eligible.

If you meet the following requirements, you will be admitted into this program automatically:

- You are already receiving benefits under the [Social Solidarity Program](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity#c67401).
- You have had [severely limited capacity for employment](https://www.quebec.ca/en/family-and-support-for-individuals/social-assistance-social-solidarity#c67403) for at least 66 months over the previous 72 months.
content3.fr-CA:
## Programme de revenu de base

Vous n'avez aucune dmarche  effectuer pour obtenir les prestations du Programme de revenu de base si vous y avez droit.

Si vous remplissez les critres suivants, vous serez automatiquement admis  ce programme:

- Vous recevez dj des prestations dans le cadre du [Programme de solidarit sociale](https://www.quebec.ca/famille-et-soutien-aux-personnes/aide-sociale-et-solidarite-sociale#c67401).
- Vous avez prsent des [contraintes svres  lemploi](https://www.quebec.ca/famille-et-soutien-aux-personnes/aide-sociale-et-solidarite-sociale#c67403) pendant au moins 66 mois au cours des 72 mois prcdents.
